articles.input: Ghana govment and DStv 'fight' don end wit new bouquet packages?
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, LEON SADIKI/BLOOMBERG VIA GETTY/MINISTRY OF COMMUNICATIONS DStv subscribers for Ghana dey react hours afta di kontri minister for Communications, Digital technology and Innovation Samuel George announce fresh bouquet packages afta weeks of 'fight'. For one joint press conference between management of multichoice Ghana and di communication ministry on Monday, Samuel George announce say di service provider agree to offer Ghanaians 'better value' for dia subscriptions wey go take effect from 1 October. Di minister for early September threaten to shutdown Multichoice Ghana DStv operations if dem fail to reduce prices of dia packages by 7 August, at a time di kontri dey witness reduced inflation and stable currency wey dey gain value against di major foreign currencies especially di dollar. "I direct di National Communications Authority (NCA) to suspend di broadcast licence of DStv if dem no reduce subscription fees by 30%." Sam George at di time accuse di company say dem dey use di depreciation of di cedi wey be ova 200% for di last eight years as dia excuse for di high prices, wey dem fail to adjust prices when di cedi dey perform well well. For di beginning, Multichoice no gree – dem describe di govment demand as "not tenable" wey dem maintain say dem get to charge di high prices to maintain di service quality. But di minister vex wey im insist and give anoda fresh deadline say make di broadcaster comply or dem go shut down dia office. Di national communications authority set up one committee to engage wit multichoice ova di drama. Afta more dan one month of back-and-forth di two parties now agree to "offer better value to subscribers." "For dis fresh arrangement, DStv subscribers go get upgraded packages at no extra cost, wey e go offer customers between 33 – 50% more value," di communication minister explain for di press conference on Monday. According to di minister, dis offer dey apply to old and new subscribers starting from 1 October. In addition, Multichoice also decide say dem go slash di price of dia zapper decoder and dish kit by 50% for new customers wey di cost dey come down to GH 555 ($45). "I request for 30% reduction, wetin we get now – di lowest be 33% wey di highest be 50%, I thank Multichoice for dat," Samuel George tok. Even tho di prices no physically reduce for di various bouquets, di minister say multichoice dey upgrade all di packages. Wia dis foto come from, MINISTRY OF COMMUNICATIONS Pipo dey ask if dis really be price reduction and improved value. For some of di subscribers, dis tin no be new. DStv dey offer promotional packages sometimes. But as di communication minister insist say di new deal neva happen bifor, some subscribers disagree. "I no dey even watch 70% of channels for my DStv bouquet, wetin I go use extra channels at di same price, for?," one subscriber Lambert Atsivor tok. Lambert write for social media say, "we need actual price reduction." Anoda subscriber write for Facebook say "make we admit say DStv outsmart us; dem only run di same step-up promo from January to March dis year. Notin special about di new pricing," Freddy Mawuli tok. Gerrard Israel also write say, "dis DStv pricing dey funny me, notin new for here – just few channels dem add to di same bouquets. Samuel George no really catch wetin we dey ask for." In fact, for some sabi pipo, DStv be luxury, so pipo fit opt out. "Dstv no be necessity; e be luxury. If pipo no fit afford, oda options dey for dem like free-to-air channels, YouTube or even oda entertainment packages wey no dey cost," Tilly Akua Nipaa wey be media personality tok. So di verdict still dey out dia as to whether dis be actual price reduction or not, but wetin many pipo dey happy about be say at least, di fight between di minister and di broadcast service provider Dstv dey over for now or maybe not. Di communications minister also say Dstv deactivate nearly one million 'ghost decoders' to deal wit cross-border piracy
articles.title: Ghana govment and DStv 'fight' don end wit new bouquet packages?

articles.input: Authorities release names of 25 schoolgirls bandits kidnap from Kebbi State
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Mustapha Ibrahim Maga/BBC Di Chairman of Danko/Wasagu Local Government Area of Kebbi State, Hussaini Aliyu wia bandits kidnap schoolgirls on Monday don release di names of di girls wey di terrorists kidnap from Government Girls Comprehensive Secondary School, Maga. Di terrorists kidnap 25 girls but two girls escape, wey leave dem wit 23 girls. We no fit name dem to protect dem. Wia dis foto come from, Presidency Meanwhile, President Bola Tinubu don postpone im scheduled trip to South Africa and Luanda. Di Nigeria leader suppose comot Abuja dis Wednesday to attend di 20th G20 Summit of leaders for South Africa and from dia, travel go Luanda to attend di 7th AU-EU Summit, but now, e don announce di postponement of dat trip afta bandits attack one church for Eruku, Kwara state, north-central Nigeria. Dis na about one day afta gunmen kidnap some schoolgirls for Kebbi State. For statement wey di Special Adviser to di president on Information and Strategy, Bayo Onanuga release on Wednesday, e say Oga Tinubu postpone im trip as e dey await further security briefings on di recent attacks wey don shake di nation. "Disturbed by di security breaches for Kebbi State and Tuesday attack by bandits against worshippers for Christ Apostolic Church, Eruku, President Tinubu don decide to suspend im departure," Onanuga tok for di statement. President Tinubu wey tok say im dey "depressed" about di recent terrorists attacks plus di kidnap of di schoolgirls, tok say im direct security agents to get into action. "As di Commander-in-Chief of di Armed Forces, I dey depressed wit di tragic death of our sojas and officers on active duty. May God comfort di families of Brigadier General Musa Uba and oda fallen heroes. "I  also dey depressed say heartless terrorists don scata di education of innocent schoolgirls," President Tinubu add. On di Eruku church attack, di Nigerian leader tok say im don direct police to go afta di bandits wey attack worshippers, and  don order di deployment of more security men to di area. E say "dos wey dey threaten di safety of di citizens go face di full weight of di Nigerian state." Dis article contain content wey X provide. Inside just one week, three bad attacks don hapun for different parts of di kontri from Northeast go Northwest, and di last one hapun for North Central. For Borno State for northeast, pipo wake up on Monday morning to hear report say Brigadier General Musa Uba don die in di line of duty after terrorists ambush am. Di tok about di whereabouts of di Brigadier General Uba bin make pipo begin worry, afta fotos show wia terrorists bin gbab am. Nigerian Army for one of dia previous statement say oga Uba bin dey on routine patrol to secure communities wey dey around Wajiroko for Azir Multe, Damboa LGA of Borno State. Dat na di last time wey dem hear anytin about am, up till wen di video of di death of Uba come dey trend. Although di Nigerian Army no issue any statement to confam di whereabouts of Brigadier General Uba since 15 November, but statement wey di presidency release on Tuesday through im tok tok pesin Bayo Onanuga, President Tinubu say e dey depressed to hear of di death of di senior army officer. Anoda attack wey hapun for Kebbi State for northwest Nigeria na di kidnapping of schoolgirls, but some of dem later manage escape from di hand of di bandits. Tori be say bandits capture 25 students from di Government Girls Comprehensive Secondary School for early hours of Monday. Di attack hapun for di school wey dey Danko/Wasagu Local Govment Area of Kebbi State, northern Nigeria. Local sources tell BBC News Pidgin say di bandits kill one school teacher bifor dem carry di girls, and later kill one school security guard. Di federal Govment don show deep concern and solidarity wit families of di female students wey bandits abduct from di school. For Kwara State, for north-central region of Nigeria, anoda deadly attack for one church for di town of Eruku, wia jaguda pipo bin open fire on top pipo wey gada to pray for Tuesday evening. Di attack hapun for di Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) for Oke Isegun, for Ekiti Local Government Are, Kwara state during di church evening programme. Di bandits shoot di pastor of di church bifor dem round up di worshippers at gunpoint. For dia statement, di police tok say: "As we search di area, we discover one male victim wey dem shoot die inside di Christ Apostolic Church, Oke Isegun, while we also find anoda victim of fatal gunshot for di bush. Meanwhile, eyewitnesses say na three pipo die for di attack wey hapun contrary to wetin police tok. Di eyewitness wey be member of di Church also say di bandits carry over 30 of dia members enta bush. E say dem no fit account for 35 of dia worshipers Plenty reactions don trail dis attacks, from prominent politicians, religious leaders to celebrities, all of dem don condemn di attacks as dem call on govment to put an end to am. Popular gospel musician Nathaniel Bassey pray for will and courage for di govment, security forces and citizens to rise and fight against di killings and abductions. "As long as we ignore and pretend about dis evils, di destiny of dis nation go only remain a wish." E also call on God judgement on di killers, kidnappers, bandits plus di architects of these evil systems and structures as well as dia sympathizers, e say dem "MUST BE JUDGED!". Former Kano state Govnor, Rabiu Kwankwaso call on di authorities to take decisive action by reinvigorating di armed forces and empower di Nigeria Police Force to effectively protect and defend Nigerians from these acts of terror. Wia dis foto come from, Jerry Eze/X Wia dis foto come from, Apostle Emmanuel Iren/X Meanwhile, Nigeria Vice President Kashim Shettima, don land Kebbi State on di directive of di president and currently dey for closed-door meeting wit di state Govnor Nasiru Idris sake of di schoolgirls wey dem kidnap from Government Girls Secondary School, Maga. Di president bin make am clear say bringing di innocent children home safely na di "singular, non-negotiable priority" and dem don deploy every security asset for dia rescue, di vice president tok.

articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Ulrik Pedersen/DeFodi Images via Getty Images Ghana don qualify for di 2026 World cup afta dem beat Comoros 1-0 for Accra. Tottenham Hotspurs forward Mohammed Kudus score di only goal of di game Bifor di game, di Blackstars carry one leg enta di competition – dem bin only neeed one point to qualify. Madagascar wey dey chase Ghana in second place lose dia game to Mali (1-4) for Bamako. Wit dis results from Group I, di Blackstars qualify for dia fifth world cup, afta dem fail to qualify for di 2025 Afcon. Ghana finish di qualifiers wit only one defeat wey dem score 23 goals. Di last time Ghana go di world cup for Qatar in 2022, dem comot for di group stage afta dem lose to Portugal (3-2) and Uruguay (2-0). Dem record one win vs Republic of Korea (3-2). Ghana go hope to go beyond di group phase again, like dem do for 2010 when dem meet Uruguay for di quarterfinal. Ghana lose dat game on penalties afta Suarez carry hand catch one shot on target, Ghana also miss di resulting penalty through Asamoah Gyan. Di players dey slow tins down now, THomas Partey now be di captain afta dem comot Jordan. 89" Goalkeeper Asare punch one cross inside di box as Comoros try to apply pressure. 87" chance! Comoros forward Mawlida blast his shot ova di bar. 85" Jordan Ayew dey comot togeda wit Antoine Semenyo for Thomas Asante-Brandon and Christopher Bonsu Baah. Antoine Semenyo try to thread di ball to Painstil inside di Comoros box but dem cut di supply 81" Comoros capitalize on some poor pass by Ghana for midfield but di cross from di right side comot di park 80" Ghana try to counter - di ball towards PAINSTIL no reach di La Galaxy man. Yellow card for Caleb Yirenkyi - di substitute miss hios footing wey he prevent di Comoros man from taking di ball 78" Comoros player Sulemani try to chip di Ghana goalkeeper from long range but di ball dey ova di bar. OFFSIDE ! Antoine Semenyo try to catch one long ball from Salisu, ref blow whistle bifor di Bournemouth striker lob di ball onto di crossbar. 66" Comoros dey make chage wit Lyad Mohammed wey dey replace Yacine Bourhane. 64" Ghana now dey try to possess di ball for dia own half to draw Comoros out. For di opda game Madagascar concede dia third goal against Mali. 60" Kwasi Sibo and Partey combine to spread di ball for di center area - di ball now reach Jordan, wey pass to Alidu; di defender delay on di ball bifor he pass di ball back to di Ghana defence. Chaaaance! Di delivery by Kudus be sweet but no yellow jersey fit connect to dat fine ball. 59" Jordan Ayew win freekick close to di Comoros box Zaydou Youssouf wey foul am 57" Ghana now dey control possession for di midfield area bifor Kudus cross di ball to di center of di Comoros box, di defenders deal wit dat cross 55" Salisu and Djiku combine again to stop one Comoros attack. For di oda end, Ayew no fit pick pone long ball ova di top. 54" Freekick to Comoros for di far left side. Dem take am quick but di shot neva trouble goalkeeper Asare 53" Di game retstart wey Comoros now try to attack di Ghana backline but Salisu pick di ball. 51" Adel di Comoros keeper fall for ground inside his box, he dey need treatment. 50" Partey foul his marker for di center circle. Di fans celebrate dat goal wit loud noise for di stadium. 46" GOOOOOAL! Mohammed Kudus slam di ball into di net afta Partey hit di shot. Dat be di final action for dis half. Ghana dey try build from di back but he slow di ball down to make hiss team mates get involved. Dem add two minutes bifor di break, any of di teams fit get di goal bifor halftime? 44" Kudus try to shoot from long range afta dem pass am one ball for di right hand side. Comoros block di shot 43" Anoda corner to Ghana, Adjetey try to head di Jordan corner but dem defend am. 42" Ghana win anoda corner, some good work from Kudus to create space and cross di ball into di box but Comoros defender clear di ball for corner. 41" Ghana keeper Benjamin Asare collect one long cross ova di top wey dey go to Comoros player; di fans appreciate di save. For di oda game, Mali dey beat Madagascar 2-0, we mean say Ghana dey sit comfortably for di top of di group with four points now. 40" Djiku and Salisu combine to clear one long ball ova di top - wey di fans dey cheeer. 39" Di game restart, di Comoros keeper dey fine to continue. 38" Di Comoros keeper Adel Aboudou dey sit for ground. Chance for Ghana? 30" So far none of di teams create any clear cut chances for dis game. 29" Alidu Seidu and Ismael Boura jump to challenge one ball, di Comoros player  dey worse, but after few seconds he rise for di game to continue. 28" Jordan Ayew try to thread one ball inside di backline for Kudus, but Comoros block di supply 26"OFFSIDE! Rafiki Said figure say he score but lineman raise flag for offside. 23" Comoros launch one long throw into di box, but Alidu Seidu clear di ball 20" Comoros dey find dia feet inside dis game now. Dem dey cause some trouble for di Ghana defence. 18" Freekick to Comoros close to di Ghana box. But di freekick dey straight into di hands of di Ghana keeper. 16" Jordan Ayew try to reach one through pass from Salisu but di Comoros defender bully him off di ball 15" Rafiki Said from Comoros concede throw-in, di ball dey back to di blackstars area. 13" Afta Ghana endure di Comoros pressure, dem begin dia own attack thru captain Jordan Ayew, but di Comoros keeper punch di ball away 10" Yellow card for Kwasi Sibo as he hack down Faiz Selemani for di centre circle. Alidu Seidu gift possession again. Di wing back so far no dey see top. 9" Di game dey quiet for di last few minutes, both teams dey struggle to create any beta chance. 7" Alidu Seidu foul di Comoros cpaptainYoussouf M'chanangama. Ref whistle for freekick 6" Partey misplace one pass afta dat Kwasi Sibo foul his marker - ref blow whistle but di fans disagree. 4" Ghana try to build up afta dat early chance from Comorso but dia keeper comot come grab one through ball for di box 3" Chaaance for Comoros afta Benjaloud Youssouf beat Alidu Seidu for di right side wey he cross di ball inside di box, but di Comoros attacker head di ball over di bar. 2" Early throw-in for Ghana for Semenyo to lift di ball inside di Comoros box. Ghana already dey try to start di buildup, di fans dey roar to every touch so far. 1" Ref blow whistle for di game to start - Comoros kick off for dis half. Pierre Ghislain Atcho be di centre referee. Thousands of fans dey di stadium to see dia players play dia final qualifying game. Di blackstars carry kente stole around dia neck as di national anthem blast through di speakers. Ghana dey wear dia all yellow jersey wey Comoros dey wear all-green jersey. Both teams comot for park now, wey dem dey sing dia national anthems Hello welcome everibodi to di capital of Ghana – Accra where dis match between Blackstars and Comoros dey happen Wia dis foto come from, GETTY/MB MEDIA VIA GETTY IMAGES Few minutes bifor di game between Ghana and Comoros for Accra. Ghana get one leg for di World Cup, dem dey need only one point to seal di deal. Dem go still qualify if dem lose wey Madagascar win. For Madagascar to win di group, dem for score at least eight or more goals vs Mali to beat Ghana on goal difference. If dem still tie wit goal difference, then dem go look at di number of goals both teams score. Ghana dey enta dis game wit 22 goals against 16 for Madagascar. Di two coaches release dia lineup for di game. Ghana XI:  Asare (GK), Alidu Seidu, Jonas Adjetey, Mohammed Salisu, Ebenezer Anan, Kwasi Sibo, Thomas Partey, Antoine Semenyo, Mohammed Kudus, Jordan Ayew Comoros XI: Adel Anzimati Aboudou (GK), Ismael Boura, Kenan Toibibou, Ahmed Soilihi, Faiz Selemani, Zaydou Youssouf, Youssouf M'changama, Rafiki Said, Kassim M'dahoma, Benjaloud Youssouf, Yacine Bourhane Di Blackstars get one foot already for di 2026 World Cup but dem go finally confam dia place if dem get at least a draw from di final Group I qualifier vs Comoros on Sunday. Ghana dey enter dis game wit full vim afta dem scatter Central African Republic 5-0 for Morocco last week. Goals from five different players – two defenders - Mohammed Salisu and Alexander Djiku as well as Captain Jordan Ayew, Thomas Partey and substitute Kamaldeen Sulemana seal di three points afta di dominant display. Wit dis result - Ghana get 22 points at di top of Group I, Madagascar wey win dem game 2-1 vs Comoros dey second wit 19 points. Mali beat Chad 2-0 to dey on di same points (15) wit Comoros. Ghana go hope to seal dia fate v Comoros for for Accra, wey Madagascar go take on Mali. Three teams dey fight to finish second for dis group. Chad go play wit Central African Republic wey Mali go play wit Madagascar. All di three matches go happun at di same time. If Ghana lose wey Madagascar win dia game, dem go dey level om 22 points wit Ghana. Wia dis foto come from, DANIEL BELOUMOU OLOMO AFP VIA GETTY Ghana lose to Comoros (1-0) for di first leg of di group I qualifier on 21 November 2023. Dat be di only defeat di Blackstars suffer for di qualifiers, wey dem go hope to avenge dat defeat for dis game wey go happun for di Accra sports stadium. Ghana coach Otto Addo warn di players against 'complacency'. "We get di same mentality for all our games – we wan end dis qualification wit victory. Sometimes in dis game of football, you comot your eye, you fit lose. My team in di past lose one game we dey lead 4-0. Dat game end 6-4, so we for be very careful " E add say "we want do dis one for di fans wey dey support us throughout di qualification." Coach Otto Addo say "we show di players plenti clips of wetin we wan do wey we dey enta dis game wit 100 percent focus." But di former Dortmund player scout know say tins no go be easy against di "Les Coelacantes". "Comoros be really good team wey dem play some good football ova di last years, so e never go be easy." "Even though dem lose to Mali (3-0) and Madagascar (2-1), dem create plenty chances inside those games, but wit di right mentality we fit beat dem. If Otto Addo fit qualify for dis World Cup, he go become di only coach to carry Ghana go di world cup two times. But Otto Addo no wan rock di boat just yet. "I no dey tink about dat record serf, e never be about me, but di team. All I dey tink about be how to qualify for di Mundial." Comoros team coach Stefano Cusin say dem make ready for an upset for dis game. "We lose di last game v Madagascar, so di team learn from dat game, from di time we beat Ghana for di first round in 2023 till now be long time, many tins change now." E also explain say "Ghana get good players, wey dem dey play at home, dem almost qualify, so of course everitin dey go on well for di team, but we go try our best." Fans go dey di stadium in dia numbers to support di Ghana team – coach Stefano Cusin say di role of those fans go dey important. "When you play in front of thousands of fans, you expect di game to be difficult. Ghana play very well against Mali, dat be di kind of game we dey expect." Comoros no fit qualify for di world cup but dem fit cause upset and spoil di Ghana party. But Stefano Cusin dey proud of di work dem do wit dia team. "Our first target when I take ova dis team be to qualify for di Afcon wey we qualify to play in Ivory Coast, but for dis world cup, we try our best but tins no happen di way we want." "Wey player or coach go tok say dem no like to play for di World Cup? We all wan play but we no go reach di mundial sake of we lose some points at di start of di qualifiers." Di Comoros coach say Ghana be team wey suppose qualify for di Afcon easily but somehow dem fail to qualify, but dat no mean say dem be bad team. "At di time Ghana no qualify for Afcon, because dem no dey good form. For di Afcon qualifiers, if you lose guard, you go drop, sake of di games dey happun ova a short space of time. If both Ghana and Madagascar get di same points, dem go use oda tins to separate dem. Yellow card -1 point (minus one point) Second yellow card/indirect red card – 3 points (-3) Direct red card – 4 points (-4) Yellow card wey direct red card follow – 5 points (-5) Drawing of lots: Dis be di last tin dem go use to separate two or more teams wey tie on points. Africa go present nine teams for di 2026 World Cup. Dem fit create 10th spot for din winner of di African playoffs for di intercontinental playoffs.
articles.title: Ghana qualify for 2026 Fifa World Cup

articles.input: Samia win Tanzania election wit 98% of votes, as hundreds die sake of protests
articles.output: President Samia Suluhu Hassan don win Tanzania presidential election, di electoral commission declare. Samia secure anoda term in office despite all di protest wey dey happun for di kontri. According to di electoral commission, Samia win 98% of di votes, nearly sweeping di 32 million ballots cast for di election wey happun on Wednesday. International observers don express concern over di lack of transparency and widespread kasala wey don lead to di death of hundreds of pipo and many odas wey wunjure. Di nationwide internet shutdown dey make am hard to verify di death toll. Di govment don play down di level of di violence - and authorities don extend di curfew in dia effort to stop di violence. "I hereby announce Samia Suluhu Hassan as di winner of di presidential election under di Chama Cha Mapinduzi (CCM) party," Jacobs Mwambegele, di electoral chief, tok as e dey announce di results on Saturday morning. Samia secure about 31.9 million votes, or 97.66% of di total, wit turnout nearing 87% of di kontri 37.6 million registered voters, di electoral chief tok. For Tanzania semi-autonomous archipelago of Zanzibar - wey elect dia own govment and leader - CCM Hussein Mwinyi, wey be di incumbent president, win wit nearly 80% of di vote. Di opposition for Zanzibar say "massive fraud" dey, di AP news agency report. Mwinyi swearing-in ceremony dey happun for Amaan Complex stadium for Zanzibar. Wia dis foto come from, Photothek via Getty Images) Protests kontinu on Friday, as demonstrators for di port city of Dar es Salaam and oda cities enta streets, dey tear down Samia posters and attack police and polling stations despite warnings from di army chief to end di protest. Tori of protests no dey as at Saturday morning, but tension remain high for Dar es Salaam streets, wia security forces mount roadblocks across di city. Na mostly young pipo dey lead di protests, wey don tok say ojoro dey di election. Dem accuse di govment say dem no follow democracy becos dem suppress di main opposition leaders - one dey jail and dem comot di oda one on technical grounds. Toktok pesin from di opposition Chadema party on Friday tell AFP news agency say "around 700" na im don die in clashes wit security forces, while one diplomatic source for Tanzania tell di BBC say credible evidence dey say at least 500 pipo don die. Foreign Minister Mahmoud Kombo Thabit don describe di violence as a "small set of kasala hia and dia" and say "security forces act very swiftly and decisively to address di situation". Na two  main opposition contenders - Tundu Lissu, wey dey jail ontop treason charges, wey e don deny, and Luhaga Mpina of di ACT-Wazalendo party - but dem comot am ontop legal technicalities. Na sixteen oda small parties, wey none of dem don get any history of better public support, na im dem allow to run. Samia ruling party, CCM, don dominate di kontri politics and neva election since independence. Ahead of di election, rights groups condemn govment suppression, wit Amnesty International wey tok say a "wave of terror" wey involve enforced disappearances, torture, and extrajudicial killings of opposition figures happun. Di govment reject claims, and officials say di election go dey free and fair. Samia come into office in 2021 as Tanzania first female president sake of di death of President John Magufuli.
articles.title: Samia win Tanzania election wit 98% of votes, as hundreds die sake of protests

articles.input: 'We no go rest until we rescue di girls ' - FG tok afta bandits kidnap 25 schoolgirls for Kebbi state
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Mustapha Ibrahim/BBC Nigeria government tok say dem don issue clear directive give di kontri security and intelligence agencies to "locate, rescue and safely return" di female students gunmen kidnap for Government Girls Secondary School, Maga, for Danko/Wasagu Local Government Area of Kebbi State, north-west Nigeria. Di Minister for Information Mohammed Idris for statement tok say govment no go rest until di girls regain freedom and those wey carry out dis act face justice. Di minister statement dey come afta Nigeria police force confam say gunmen wey dem suspect to be bandits storm di school, kidnap 25 school girls and kill some school officials. "Di govment condemn dis inexcusable attack on innocent students plus di killing of school officials wey dey carry out dia noble duty," e tok. Dis article contain content wey X provide. We ask for una permission before anytin dey loaded, as dem fit dey use cookies and oda technologies. You fit wan read di X cookie policy and privacy policy before accepting. To view dis content choose 'accept and continue'. Pipo for Maga wake up wit fear and sadness afta one bad attack wey bandits carry out early Monday morning, wia dem kill two pipo and kidnap secondary female students according to locals. Pipo for di town tok say before di bandits enta di area, dem hear say di bandits don attack and kidnap pipo for some villages wey near Maga on Sunday. One pesin wey dey di town, Malam Abdullahi, tell BBC News Pidgin wetin hapun, e say di attack hapun for early morning wen pipo dey prepare for morning prayer. "Around 3:30am we hear gunshot, but we tink say na local vigilante dem wey dey patrol." "Later we hear heavy gunshot around 4:30am, and wen I comot, we see pipo dey run comot from di school wia di bandits enta do di attack." Wia dis foto come from, KOLA SULAIMON/AFP via Getty Images) E add say di bandits first enter di teachers houses befor dem go carry di students wey dem kidnap. "Di wife of di teacher wey dem kill tell us say di bandits enter dia house meet her husband for wia e lie down. Dem ask am weda na im be di school chief security. Wen e answer yes, dem tell am say today na im last day. "She tell us say her husband beg dem make dem allow am sidon befor dem kill am. As e sidon, dem shoot am for chest," Abdullahi tok. E tok say afta dem kill am, dem tell im daughter make she carry dem go di hostel wia di students dey. "Afta dem kill di teacher, dem carry im pikin make she show dem di hostel wia di students dey. Na so dem pack all di children, and as dem dey comot wit dem, dem shoot di school security man," e tok. As tins be now, reports from Maga show say security pipo don full ground and all di traditional rulers for di area don reach di school to know wetin happun. Wia dis foto come from, Mustapha Ibrahim Kebbi State Police Command say dem don deploy police tactical units, sojas and vigilante pipo to begin serious search-and-rescue operation for di 25 school girls wey bandits carry from Govment Girls Comprehensive Secondary School, Maga, for Danko/Wasagu Local Govment Area. Nafiu Abubakar Kotarkoshi, tok-tok pesin for di Kebbi State Police Command say armed bandits enta di school around 4:00am on Monday, dey shoot anyhow. Police tactical team wey dey inside di school engage dem for gun battle, but di bandits still manage jump fence and carry di girls comot go unknown place. According to di Police one man, Hassan Makuku, die for di attack, and anoda man, Ali Shehu, injure for hand. Afta di incident, Police Command say dem don send more police officers join, plus military and vigilante, and all of dem dey comb di bandits dia possible route and nearby forest to rescue di girls and arrest di pipo wey do di bad act. Kebbi State Commissioner of Police, Bello Sani, reassure say police dey fully committed to protect pipo life and property. On April 14, 2014, Boko Haram attack one girls' secondary school for Chibok, Borno State, carry many students. Dem enta di town around midnight, shoot anyhow to wake residents, enter hostel, pack 276 girls inside truck, and kidnap dem. For February 2018, suspected Boko Haram militants attack one girls' school for Dapchi, Yobe State, and carry 110 students. Dis one hapun almost four years afta dem kidnap the Chibok girls. For December 2020, gunmen attack one boys science secondary school for Kankara, Katsina State. Dem kidnap more dan 300 students and carry dem travel long distance enter forest for Zamfara, one place wey also dey face insecurity. For February 2021, gunmen attack GGSS Jangebe, one girls boarding school for Zamfara State. Dem kidnap around 317 students. One eyewitness tell BBC say about 300 girls remain afta the attackers comot. For early March 2023, gunmen attack Kuriga Primary and Junior Secondary School for Chikun Local Govment Area of Kaduna State. Dem kidnap about 287 students and one teacher - di teacher later escape. Wen Governor Uba Sani visit di community, di teacher tell am say di attackers reach di school just as di morning assembly dey finish.
articles.title: 'We no go rest until we rescue di girls ' - FG tok afta bandits kidnap 25 schoolgirls for Kebbi state

articles.input: Twenty-seven-year-old Nigerian man allegedly stab im papa to death for US
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, NOPD News/website Police authorities for United States of America don arrest one 27-year-old man wey allegedly kill im papa and stab im sisters. New Orleans Police Department (NOPD) ontop dia website confam say dem don arrest Chukwuebuka Eweni becos of di alleged homicide wey im commit on November 11, 2025, for 8000 block of Pebble Street wia one pesin die and two oda pipo injure due to injuries from stabbing. Police tok say dem carry di two surviving adults to local hospital wia dem dey receive treatment. "At about 9:59 p.m, NOPD Seventh District officers respond to di location to investigate di reported battery, dem believe say na family mata. Wen dem reach dia, dem see one unresponsive adult male subject, e sustain at least one fatal stab wound and two oda adult victims wit stab wounds," di statement tok. "We carry di two surviving victims go one local hospital, wia dem dey treat dem for dia injuries." Local newspapers bin report say di Eweni family members no gree tok to tori pipo but dem don release one of di victims from di hospital, and di oda pesin still dey receive treatment and she go survive di injury. Family members tell police say Eweni dey suffer from mental illness but im no dey violent but di incident wey hapun dat night wen Eweni grab knife dey shocking and dem no know wetin enta inside am. Dem tell police say afta im stab dem, Eweni go New Orleans East Hospital, wia e dey always go for mental help. Di hospital transfer am to one facility for Jefferson Parish, na dia police track am down and arrest am. Afta police investigate, NOPD Homicide Section detectives find out say na Eweni be di prime suspect, and dem get warrant to arrest am for one count of second-degree murder and two counts of attempted second-degree murder. Dem believe say e get gun and dem no fit predict wetin go hapun. "Di suspect dey armed and dangerous," di statement tok. "Di Orleans Parish Coroner Office go identify di deceased victim and official cause of death upon completion of autopsy and notify di family. No additional information dey available." Di deceased, Samuel Eweni na Professor of Computer Sciences for di Southern University for New Orleans. Dr Joseph Bouie, Jr., Chancellor of Southern University for New Orleans tok say Dr Eweni no be only educator but na also mentor and a guiding light to many of di  students. "Im contributions to di College of Business and Public Administration and to di university mission of transforming lives through education go dey remembered and celebrated. Our hearts dey wit im family, friends, and colleagues during dis deeply difficult time," e tok.
articles.title: Twenty-seven-year-old Nigerian man allegedly stab im papa to death for US

articles.input: Why president Mahama order investigation into $245m All African Games expenditure for Ghana
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, NIPAH DENIS/AFP/VIA/GETTY Ghana president John Mahama order di kontris Auditor General to carry out forensic audit into di organization of di 13th All Africa Games wey happun for Ghana from 8-23 March 2024. Di $245m budget for di games wey cause controversy even bifor di games itserf start now be subject of investigation. Civil society groups and investigative media outlet Fourth Estate publish one report about di expenditure for di games and wetin dem tok say be questionable line items and dia various cost. Even though di games end well, wit Ghana getting dia highest medal collection, pipo want make govment investigate di whole organization. President Mahama first refer di mata to di National Intelligence Bureau (NIB), wey dem submit report to him. Now di president say di Auditor General get six weeks to finish di forensic audit and submit di report to di presidency. Di Auditor General dey expected to investigate all di financial and operational aspects of di games. Di audit go cover areas like; Dis dey include di tendering and selection of vendors, suppliers and oda contractors according to di kontris procurement laws. Financial management and expenditure control Dis go cover all di sources of funding, disbursement and expenditure including sponsorships and subventions. Di forensic audit dey expected to check di implementation, cost variations and timelines for some of di decisions wey di sports ministry take. Dem also for check for value-for-money for all di facilities wey di kontri develop for di games. Di audit go check and verify di ownership and status of assets wey di kontri procure or construct ahead of di games. Di forensic audit dey expected to evaluate di roles and responsibilities of agencies and committees wey dey involved for di planning and execution of di games. Wia dis foto come from, NIPAH DENNIS/AFP/VIA/GETTY Bifor di All-Africa Games go begin, di sports minister at di time, Mustapha Ussif confam say govment spend $195m on infrastructure out of which $145m dey invested in di construction of di Borteyman Sports Centre (one of di sports facilities wey dem use for di games). Di minister also explain during di press conference say di kontri spend $34m to renovate di University of Ghana stadium, and $16m for di rehabilitation of di Games Village for Legon. Mustapha Ussif continue to add say di ministry put aside $47.7m as operational budget. "Unlike football tournaments like di Africa Cup of Nations where di football federation dey in charge of accommodation cost for various teams, di host kontri for di All-Africa Games dey responsible for di hotel bills of all participating football teams wey dey part of di game budget," di sports minister tok. Experts and oda CSOs say di total amount dem spend for di games be more than $250m. Days afta di games end, some volunteers protest over unpaid stipends, bifor di local organizing committee agree to pay dem dia money. Afta di president call for di forensic audit, anti-corruption crusaders say dem expect proper job wey go lead to prosecution of pipo wey allegedly chop govment money. Co-chair for di citizens movement against corruption, oga Edem Senanu say "dis be important step, especially when di president dey on top of issues to see what we as citizens dey see about corruption and tins like dis wey deserve attention." "We dey hope say dis forensic audit go bring result wey go benefit di kontri – and punish wrongdoing to prevent odas from di same tin for future," he tok for local network TV3. Experts and sports analysts say for di president to order dis kind investigation mean say dem find something fishy for di expenditure for di games, wey dem dey expect proper action afta di audit. In 2024, di opposition party (now di govment in power – NDC) in parliament demand investigation into di expenditure for di games. Rankin member for dat committee at dat time, oga Kobena Mensah Woyome, tok say di plenty money govment pump into di games no deliver di expected economic value. "Di games be disaster and embarrassment to dis kontri, afta all di $245m dem spend for dis games, tins still no go well," Kobena Woyome tok journalists for one press conference for parliament on 26 March 2024. "Four years ago, Morocco organize di Africa games wit 46 million euros, bifor dat Congo spend $60m to host di 11th edition, so why Ghana spend $245m, at a time of economic crisis?" Lawmaker and member of parliament for Ketu North Edem Agbana say "dis proper forensic audit go reveal plenty tins, wey go lead to di arrest and prosecution of many pipo." "Di figures be outrageous, wey di money dem say dem spend to renovate sports facilities and oda tins no dey show for ground. In fact, dem no get podium for di winners for one of di disciplines, dem use cardboard to write di kontris." Edem Agbana add say "we no wan dis investigation to be like di many oda ones wey go drag and drag wey we no go see di end of it," Edem tok on top TV3. All eyes go dey di Auditor General office and di presidency in di coming weeks to see wetin go happun next. Wia dis foto come from, MONIRUL BHUIYAN/AFP/VIA/GETTY Some 5,000 athletes from 52 nations participate for 30 disciplines during di games in Ghana in 2024. Egypt dominate di games wit total of 189 medals, 101 of dem be gold, wey Nigeria follow wit 120 medals wey South Africa get 106 medals. Ghana get dia highest number of medals for di games wit 68 (19 gold, 29 silver, 20 bronze). Dis number pass di kontris previous best of 27 medals for di 1973 games. Di All-African Games be continental sports event wey dem dey organize every four years, owned by di Africa union on behalf of di member kontris. Di games be to promote track-and-field events and discover talented athletes for di continent. Athletes and organizing teams dey use di games to prepare for international and inter-continental games wey e also be to promote cultural exchange and tourism. Dem organize di first ever Africa games from 18-25 July 1965 for Brazzaville. Since den, Nigeria, Algeria, Kenya, Egypt, Zimbabwe, South Africa all host di games. Oda kontris like Mozambique and Morocco also host di games in di past. Egypt go host di next All-African Games in 2027.
articles.title: Why president Mahama order investigation into $245m All African Games expenditure for Ghana

articles.input: Ghana prosecutor finally charge ex-finance minister Ken Ofori-Atta and six odas wit corruption
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, SPECIAL PROSECUTOR'S OFFICE Di special prosecutor for Ghana officially charge di kontri ex-finance minister Ken Ofori-Atta and six odas wit corruption and corruption-related offences. Dis dey happun many months afta di prosecutor declare di ex-finance minister wanted wey dem also put am on top di Interpol red notice. Ken Ofori-Atta and im lawyers say di ex-minister dey di US for medical attention; di reason why he no show face. Apart from di ex-minister, di prosecutor Kissi Agyebeng also charge oda former directors for di Ghana revenue authority. Dis include Emmanuel Kofi Nti (former commissioner general for GRA), Ammishaddai Owusu-Amoah (former commissioner general for GRA) and Ernest Darko Akore (chef de cabinet to di ex-finance minister). Di oda suspects be Isaac Crentsil (former commissioner for customs division for GRA), Kwadwo Damoah (former commissioner for customs division for GRA ) and Evans Adusei wey be CEO for one company (Strategic mobilization limited – SML), wey di prosecutor allege say di suspects use to get govment contracts illegally. Wit dis formal charges, di court go set date to begin trial of di case. According to di prosecutor, di accused pipo conspire to set up "criminal enterprise wey directly and indirectly influence di kontris procurement process to win contracts for di company (SML)." "Di SML company carry unfair advantage to get transaction audit services, external price verification services, measurement audit for downstream petroleum products and odas form di Ghana govment through di finance ministry and di Ghana revenue authority." Kissi Agyebeng di special prosecutor tok say "dem begin di criminal enterprise in 2017 by di ex-finance minister Ken Ofori-Atta, Emmanuel Kofi Nti (ex-GRA commissioner) and Evans Adusei togeda wit di SML company itself." Di prosecutor say dem neva ensure value for money for di contracts dem carry give di SML company wey dem cause financial loss of Ghc 1.4bn ($128m). Ghana president John Mahama afta he order investigation for dis mata, direct di finance ministry to cancel dis contract wit SML on 31 October 2025. According to di prosecutor, if di president no cancel di contract at di time e do am, directors of di company tok say make di kontri pay dem Ghc $2.8bn for five years without parliamentary approval. Sake of dis tins, dem charge di suspects wit 78 counts. Even bifor di official charges; di SML company deny di corruption allegations. Dem also deny say di ex-finance minister get interest inside di company. Lawyer for di company oga Cephas Boyuo for one press conference on 7 November tok say "di claims by di office of special prosecutor be baseless wey dem neva be true." "We dey proud of di work we do, we go present all our documents to di appropriate authorities. All di payments dem give us be from work we do." On 10 November, SML sue di prosecutor's office demanding damages of more than $28m sake of wetin dem describe as "unlawful raid of dia offices." According to di suit, sake of di equipment wey di prosecutor's office seize from dia place, di software and oda networks dem dey use, never work again. SML want make di court declare say di prosecutor's office use unlawful means to seize dia property wey dem wan make dey return am. Wia dis foto come from, GHANA FINANCE MINISTRY Even bifor dis latest official charges, lawyers for di ex-finance minister tok say di prosecutor fit do dia investigations without di presence of di ex-minister for di kontri. Dem tok say Ken Ofori-Atta no dey fear to defend himserf for court. Di ex-finance minister file many suits for di court to stop di investigation Afta di formal chargers, Frank Davies tok on top local radio station Joy FM say he no shock say di prosecutor charge di former minister wit plenty counts (78). "Di prosecutor get long way to go. Dem for prove every single count beyond all reasonable doubt. You no fit put all of dem togeda," oga Frank Davies tok. Di ex-minister's lawyers say dia client no dey run away from prosecution as he accuse di prosecutor of wetin he describe as "trail by public opinion." Wit dis latest charges – di attorney general go fit send di charges and di full docket to US authorities make dem extradite am to di kontri. Anti-corruption campaigners say di latest development be "breath of fresh air" wey dem dey hope to see di end of dis mata.
articles.title: Ghana prosecutor finally charge ex-finance minister Ken Ofori-Atta and six odas wit corruption

articles.input: Christians dey persecuted for Ngeria as Trump dey tok?
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images US President Donald Trump threat to just enta Nigeria "guns-a-blazing" to stop di killing of "record numbers of Christians" no just comot from nowia. For months, campaigners and politicians for Washington don dey tok say Islamist militants just dey plan and target Christinas for Nigeria. For September, popular TV host and comedian, Bill Maher just increase evritin as e describe wetin dey happun as "genocide". E refer to di Boko Haram group say "dem don kill ova 100,000 since 2009 and dem don burn 18,000 churches". Pipo wit di influence don dey also ginger pipo for social media. Di Nigerian govment for Abuja don push back against dis claims as dem call dem say dem be "a gross misrepresentation of reality". Dem no deny say deadly kasala dey happun for di kontri. But officials tok say, "terrorists dey attack evribodi wey no gree for dia kill-kill ideology - Muslims, Christians and those wey no gey faith join". Oda groups wey dey torchlight political violence for Nigeria say di numbers of Christians wey dem don kill dey far lower as most of di victims of jihadist groups na Muslims. Nigerian secuirty analyst Christina Ani tok say even though dem dey attack Christians as part of bigger move to create terror, e no dey possible to justify claims say na Christians gan-gan dem dey torchlight. And Nigeria dey face plenty security kasala all ova di kontri and no be just kasala from jihadist groups. And all dis different kasala get different reasons so make dem no dey confused. Di kontri 220 million pipo roughly divide half - half between di two religions. Muslims na dem plenti pass for di north, wia most attacks dey happun. Texas Senator Ted Cruz don dey campaign on top dis mata from time and even tok di kain numbers wey Maher tok on 7 October. E write for X say "since 2009, ova 50,000 Christians for Nigeria don dey massacred and ova 18,000 churches and 2,000 Christian schools don dey destroyed". Im office send email wia e clear di air say di senator no dey call am "genocide" like Maher but e call am "persecution". But Cruz accuse Nigerian officials say dem dey "ignore and even ginger di murder of Christians by Islamist jihadists". Trump wey tok di same tin use am call Nigeria say na "disgraced kontri", and say di goment "kontinu to do dey allow di killing of Christians". Di Nigerian goment don deny am say dem dey do dia best to handle di jihadists. Some officials don also welcome di idea say US go help fight insurgents as long as dem no just run am by demsef. True-true, di authorities don struggle to handle di violent jihadist groups and criminal networks. Dis na as most weeks be like dem dey come wit new new tori of fresh attacks or kidnapping. Boko Haram wey dey known for di kidnapping of di Chibok girls ova 10 years ago, don dey active since 2009 but most of dia work na for di north-east wey gey mostly Muslim population. Oda jihadist groups don also land wey include di Islamic State West Africa Province but dem also dey do dia activities for di north-east. Di numbers of Christian deaths wey some for American dey tok dey scary but to find out weda dem be true, na anoda mata. As to wetin be di souce of dia data, Cruz for one podcast for September, bin refer to one 2023 report by di International Society for Civil Liberties and Rule of Law (InterSociety) - wey be non-govmental organisation wey dey torchlight and track human rights abuses across Nigeria. Im office also send BBC some links to online tori on di mata. But most dem bin link back to InterSociety. For data wey fit dey shape US policy for Nigeria, InterSociety work no clear. For report wey dem publish for August, wey combine previous research and updated numbers for 2025, e tok say jihadist groups for Nigeria don kill ova 100,000 Christians for di 16 years since 2009. E also note say 60,000 "moderate Muslims" bin also die for dat time. InterSociety no give list of sources wey make am hard to verify di full number of deaths e dey report. To ansa dis criticism, di organisation tok say "e dey almost impossiple to reproduce all our reports and dia references wey go back to 2010. Our easy method na to pick dia summary statistics and add dem to our fresh discoveries or findings to create our new reports". But di data sources wey InterSociety dey quote no get di figures wey dem publish. Wia dis foto come from, AFP via Getty Images For di deaths wey happun dis year, InterSociety conclude say between January and August, na just ova 7,000 Christians dey killed. Dis na anoda number wey pipo don dey quote all ova social media. Pipo like  Republican  Congressman Riley M Moore, wey don be leading voice for dis mata for di House of Representatives. InterSociety add list of 70 media houses as some of dia sources for wetin dem find about di attacks on Christians for 2025. But di wahala be say in like half of dis cases, di original news tori no tok anytin about di religion of di victims. For instance, InterSociety bin quote one Al Jazeera report of di attack for north-eastern Nigeria, and tok say according to di news organisation "no less dan 40 farmers wey be mainly Christians don dey abducted by Boko Haram for Damboa part of Borno State". But di Al Jazeera tori no tok anytin say di victims na "mainly Christians", as InterSociety quote dem say dem tok. InterSociety tell BBC say dem do more analysis to find out wia dem come from. Dem no explain how dem do am for dis situation but dem mention say dem get knowledge of local populations and how dem dey use "Christian media reports". But di number of deaths wey dey for di reports wey InterSociety dey quote no reach di total of 7,000 wey dem dey tok. To explain di mata, InterSociety say dem also dey estimate di number of pipo wey dem believe bin die for captivity plus eyewitness testimonies wey dem no fit tok come outside. For dia list of offenders na Islamist militant groups like Boko Haram but also Fulani herders. Di Fulanis na mainly Muslim ethnic group wey dey live all ova West Africa don traditionally dey make money from raising cattle and sheep. Di inclusion of di Fulani herders, wey InterSociety dey call "jihadists" for all dia reports na sources of wahala for Nigeria ova how dem dey arrange dis killings. While herders normally be Muslims, many researchers for field reject tok say dia kasala na religious mata. Dem say most of di time, na about how to get land and water. Fulani herders don get kwanta wit both Muslim and Christian communities around Nigeria. Security analyst, Oga Ani dey argue say, "to say dem be jihadist, na long tin. E no get anytin to di wit dat. Na more about criminal elements". Confidence McHarry, wey be senior security analyst for Africa-focussed consultancy SBM Intelligence tok say most times di kasala na bicos of ethnic tensions and competition for resources. "E fit dey ethnic in nature, dem wan grab  lands, expand dia territories, but di more dem dey pursue communities comot and di more dem dey attack worship centres, di more dem go dey look dis kain tins wit dat kain eye". InterSociety also mention who dem dey call for Nigeria say dem be bandits, dem tok say dem be mostly ethnic Fulanis for di north-west of di kontri wey dey do kidnapping and get history of killing both Christians and Muslims. Wia dis foto come from, Reuters E don tay wey politicians for di United State and international Christian groups don dey tok about dia worry ova threats wey dey face Nigerian Christians. Bifor, for years, na di Indigenous People of Biafra (Ipob) wey dey proscribed for Nigeria say dem wan create dia own kontri wit mainly di Christian south-east bin carry di mata go US. Di Nigerian military don accuse InterSociety say dem get link wit Ipob but di NGO say na lie. Anoda Biafran separatist group don also claim say dem play major role for di promotion for di "Christian Genocide" tori for di US Congress. Di Biafra Republic Government in Exile, BRGIE call am "highly orchestrated effort" say dem hire lobby firms and bin meet US officials plus including Cruz sef. Di senator no gree ansa dat one. InterSociety numbers dey far higher dan oda sources of data about how many Christians don dey killed for Nigeria. Acled, wey dey torchlight violence for West Africa don comot wit differenct numbers. Di sources wey dem get for di published findings dey easy to trace and cross-check. Dia senior analyst, Ladd Stewart don gree address InterSociety reports head on but tell di BBC say di number of 100,000 deaths wey dem dey carry loud am for social media up and down, go include all di acts of political violence for Nigeria and so e no go dey true say na di numbers of Christians wey don die since 2009. Acled find out say na just under 53,000 civilians weda na Christians or Muslims na im don dey reported say dem kill for targeted political kasala since 2009. Acled torchlight just di period from 2020 to September 2025 and tok say na about 21,000 civillians don dey killed for kidnap attacks, sexual kasala and di use of explosives. Dem find 384 times wia Christians bin dey targetted specifically from 2020 to September 2025 wia 317 pipo die, dis mean say dem dey account for small proportions of di pipo wey don dey killed. For dia sources, Acled dey rely on traditional media, social media wia di tori fit dey verified, rights groups plus including local partners. Last Friday, for Truth Social Trump post number of 3,100 Christians wey dem don kill. E bin dey tok about one report wey Open Doors release about di number of deaths for 12 months wey start from October 2023, according to White House official. Open Doors na charity wey dey do research on di persecution of Christians for di world. Dia report say while 3,100 Christians die, dem also kill 2,320 Muslims for dat 12 months. Open Doors also include wetin dem dey call "Fulani Terror Groups" for dia list of who dey do am and say dem dey responsible for about one third of di Christians wey dem kill in those 12 months. Senior research fellow for Open Doors, Frans Verrman say "wetin we dey see now na say Christians still dey targetted but some Muslims don dey increasingly targeted by Fulani militants". Analysts say plenti violent attacks for Mosques and Muslim communities dey happun for di north-west of di kontri. Oga McHarry say, "pesin fit see am as part of broader insecurity. Di reason wey e no fit dey assumed say na for religious reasons na bicos di fact be say di identity of di pipo wey dey attack Muslims, demselves be Muslims."
articles.title: Christians dey persecuted for Ngeria as Trump dey tok?

articles.input: Baba Ijesha regain freedom afta three years in prison ova sexual assault conviction
articles.output: Nollywood actor, Olarenwaju Omiyinka, wey pipo sabi as Baba Ijesa, don regain freedom from prison. Baba Ijesha lawyer, Barrister Olabiran Kayode wey confam im release give BBC News Pidgin on Saturday, 15 November tok say na afta one Court of Appeal judgment clear am of di accuse of sexual assault on a minor. Di lawyer tok say na on Friday, 14 November, di court declare am innocent of two count charges, out of di four charges wey Lagos state govment lawyers sama am. Baba Ijesha freedom dey come afta e spend more dan three years for prison. For 2022, Lagos State goment lawyers alias prosecutors drag am to court on alleged sexual assault of a 15-year-old. Baba Ijesha na popular Nigerian feem actor wey dey popular for Yoruba movies. Tori be say di victim na di adopted daughter of one Nigerian comedienne, Damilola Adekoya wey pipo sabi as Princess. Na on 14, July, 2022, one Lagos State High Court for Ikeja bin find Baba Ijesha guilty of sexual assault of a minor. Justice Oluwatoyin Taiwo of di Ikeja Sexual Offences Court for her ruling bin sentence Baba Ijesha to five years in prison. Earlier, Lagos state govment bin arraign di defendant bifor di court on 24 June, 2021 on a six (6) count charge of: Di judge for her ruling tok say di prosecution bin successfully prove di charge of sexual assault of a minor and indecent treatment of a minor against di defendant. Di judge, however, discharge and free am of count one and six, wey be sexual assault by penetration (wey happun for 2014) and attempted sexual assault by penetration, wey happun for 2021. Court bin find Baba Ijesha guilty and sentence am to five years imprisonment on four count charges, and say di sentence go run concurrently. "Court find di defendant guilty and sentenced to five years imprisonment for count two (2), three years for count three (3), five years for count four (4) and three years for count five (5) taking effect from today, 14th of July, 2022. Di sentences are to run concurrently." Di court bin rule. articles.input: Di only flying eye hospital for di world enta Ghana to save pipo eyes for free
articles.output: You go believe say any hospital dey for dis world wey dey inside aeroplane? Follow me enta di only flying eye hospital for di world – as dem visit Ghana to do eye surgeries for pipo for free. Meet six-year-old Alvin, one of thousands of pipo wey get eye problem for di Ashanti region and oda parts of Ghana. E get lump for im right eye wey dey become big as e dey grow. Di kindergarten school child travel wit im mother for four hours from di Bono East region to Kumasi for free surgery by Orbis. Alvin mother say she dey fear how tins go be – but she dey hopeful. "Di lump for Alvin eyes start wen e be two years old. E dey become big as e dey grow. I no know how to feel right now. But I dey expect say afta di surgery, everitin go dey okay. Wey e go fit continue im education." Apart from Alvin, dem do surgery for many odas. Orbis be non-profit organization wey dey work for ova 40 years around di world to prevent blindness and restore di sight of pipo for places wia eye care dey hard to reach. Dem dey train local eye care workers inside dia flying hospital before dem dey do free surgeries for local partner hospitals Dem screen hundreds of pipo wit different eye problems togeda wit di local care workers. Afta di surgery, Alvin mother dey happy; her bubbly son go continue im school without any fear. "By di Grace of God, everitin dey fine. I dey worried bifor wey I dey wonder how di surgery go be. As dem carry am go di theatre, I make sad." Alvin mother say "afta di surgery dem remove di bandage wey I see say everitin dey fine. Im eyes dey fine now." She add say, "Alvin be happy child, wey we go make sure e reduce playing until di wound heal finish. We be grateful to Orbis for dis free surgery, make God bless dem to help oda pipo for Ghana wey dey need dis kind surgeries." Oda pipo dey in line for dis free eye surgeries for di Komfo Anokye Teaching Hospital Orbis director for di flying eye hospital oga Maurice Geary say: "Globally, 1.1 billion pipo get vision loss. 90% of dis number be preventable wey mean say dem fit treat am or e fit be prevented." "From dis number wey dey live wit preventable vision loss, nine out of 10 pipo dey live for lower middle income kontris." Di group believe say pipo anywhere for di world need to get access to proper eye care weda dem be rich or poor. Di Orbis flying eye hospital travel to more dan 90 kontris around di world wey dem train thousands of doctors, nurses, biomedical engineers and oda eye care workers since 1982. Wia dis foto come from, THE FLYING EYE HOSPITAL/INSTAGRAM For Africa, dem get long-term projects for Ethiopia, South Africa, Zambia, Cameroon and Ghana. Dis be di third trip by di flying eye hospital to Ghana since dia oda visit for 1990 and 2006. "For dis project for Ghana, we set up di whole airplane like simulation centre wey we use virtual reality and artificial eyes to train eye doctors, we also dey do live surgical training inside di airplane," oga Maurice Geary tok BBC News Pidgin. E explain say, "in addition to dat simulation training inside di airplane, we also carry clinical team to Komfo Anokye Hospital for Kumasi wey dem dey work wit local eye care teams to train staff wey dem dey do surgeries for patients inside di operating room." About 26.3 million pipo for Africa get one form of visual impairment. Dis include about 20.4 million wey get low vision and 5.9 million wey dey blind, according to di World Health Organization (WHO). But Orbis and dia flying hospital dey work wit African kontris and oda local partners to reduce dis numbers, one pesin at a time.
articles.title: Di only flying eye hospital for di world enta Ghana to save pipo eyes for free

articles.input: 'My daughter bin no wan go dat school' - Mama of kidnapped Kebbi schoolgirl lament
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Mustapha Ibrahim Maga/BBC E don reach three days wey bandits attack Government Girls Comprehensive Secondary School for Magu, Kebbi state. For di same attack, dem kidnap 25 school girls, kill di vice principal and anoda pesin. Tori don come out say three of di girls don try escape, while di odas still dey wit dia captor. One parent wey we no wan tok her name for safety concerns for Maga community tok how her life turn upside down afta she hear say her pikin dey among di schoolgirls wey bandits dem carry. Di mother explain say since dat day, she no sabi wetin dey do for her life. For her mind, she dey fear say di girls no go return. She tok say "wen I hear di news, I begin dey cry, my bodi dey shake, chest dey pound. I try go house but I no fit move until one woman help am climb okada go back home." "Di pain dey burn my heart sake say na six weeks now since I last see my pikin. Di girl bin dey cry dat day say she no wan go school, but we beg am make she endure"  di mama of di pikin tok. She add say di community dey inside deep sorrow and distress - den beg make govment help return dia girls and give security help to protect di town. "Fear don dey before dis wahala happun, we dey always live for fear." Nigeria don face security wahala wey e neva see for a long time sake of attacks from armed bandits and jihadist fighters for Borno State for northeast. Inside just one week, three bad attacks don happun for different parts of di kontri from Northeast go Northwest, and di last one happun for North Central. For Borno State for northeast, pipo wake up on Monday morning hear report say Brigadier General Musa Uba don die in di line of duty during ambush by terrorist group. Di tok about di whereabouts of di Brigadier General Uba bin make pipo begin worry, afta fotos show wia terrorists bin gbab am. Nigerian Army for one of dia previous statement say oga Uba bin dey on routine patrol to secure communities wey dey around Wajiroko for Azir Multe, Damboa LGA of Borno State. Dat na di last time wey dem hear anytin about am, up till wen di video of di death Uba come dey trend. Although di Nigerian Army no issue any statement to confam di whereabouts of Brigadier General Uba since 15 November. But statement wey do presidency release on Tuesday through im tok tok pesin Bayo Onanuga, President Tinubu say e dey depressed to hear of di death of di senior army officer. Wia dis foto come from, Mustapha Ibrahim Maga Another attack wey happun for Kebbi State for northwest Nigeria na di kidnapping of schoolgirls, but some of dem later manage escape from di hand of di bandits. Tori be say bandits capture 25 students from di Government Girls Comprehensive Secondary School for early hours of Monday. Di attack happun for the school wey dey Danko/Wasagu Local Govment Area of Kebbi State, northern Nigeria. Local sources tell BBC News Pidgin say di bandits kill one school teacher bifor dem carry di girls, and later kill one school security guard. Di federal Govment don show deep concern and solidarity wit families of di female students wey bandits abduct from di school. Federal Govment dey adjust di kontri military, police, and intelligence system to prevent more attacks and to respond faster and more effectively wen threats show. For another development, President Bola Tinubu don tell Vice President Kashim Shettima make he go Kebbi State on Wednesday go sympathise wit di state govment and assure di parents and guardians of di kidnapped schoolgirls say govment go do everytin to make sure dem come out quick. Di President, wey di military authorities don brief well-well about di two incidents, tok say e dey sad about di kidnapping of di schoolgirls, even though intelligence don warn befor say bandits fit strike. While on di oda hand, Kebbi State Governor, Nasir Idris, tok say e don assure parents of di schoolgirls wey bandits carry from GGCSS Maga say efforts dey on ground to rescue dia children. For Kwara State, for north-central region of Nigeria one deadly attack for one church for di town of Eruku, wia jaguda pipo bin open fire on top pipo wey gada to pray for Tuesday evening. Di attack happun for di Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) for Oke Isegun, for Ekiti Local Government Are, Kwara state during di church evening programme. Di bandits shoot di pastor of di church bifor dem round up di worshippers at gunpoint. For dia statement, di police tok say: "As we search di area, we discover one male victim wey dem shoot die inside di Christ Apostolic Church, Oke Isegun, while we also find anoda victim of fatal gunshot for di bush. Meanwhile, eyewitnesses say na three pipo die for di attack wey happun for di Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) for Oke Isegun, contrary to wetin police tok. Di eyewitness wey be member of di Church also say di bandits carry over 30 of dia members enta bush. E say dem no fit account to 35 of dia worshipers One security expert, Dr Buhari Ubandawaki, tell BBC News Pidgin say di recent violent attacks wey happun for Nigeria witin one week show clearly say di kontri security system dey weak and overstretched. Dr Ubandawaki tok dis one as im react to three major incidents: di killing of one Army General for Borno, di kidnapping of 25 schoolgirls for Kebbi, and di attack wey gunmen do for one church for Kwara wey lead to deaths and kidnapping. According to am, di way di attacks take happun dey show say terrorist groups wan prove say dem get power pass govment. "From wetin we see for oda kontris  wey dey face similar wahala, terrorists dey always increase attacks when dem sense say di kontri dey weak or wen external pressure dey. Dem wan show say na dem dey control, no be government," e tok. Dr Ubandawaki identify many reasons wey dey cause insecurity for northern Nigeria. E tok say one big problem be di large ungoverned areas wey nobodi dey in charge, and na dat kind place terrorists dey use hide, plan and execute attacks. "Plenty areas for northern Nigeria no get any authority wey dey control am. Dat one dey give terrorists chance to settle, plan attack and go hide later," e add. E still tok say many state govments never put serious effort to fight insecurity, and communities just dey rely only on govnment to protect dem. E add say porous borders dey allow illegal guns dey enter Nigeria, and di kontri never still identify or punish di sponsors of terrorism. Di expert tok say Nigeria neva apply di three important security layers wey suppose help stop insecurity. E say "di first layer na community level, wia every community suppose set up dia first line of defence." "Di second layer na state level, wia state govments suppose work togeda wit communities and federal security agencies. Di third layer na federal level, wia better recruitment, correct deployment and enof weapons suppose dey in place, plus better defence budget." Im tok "Federal govment need to recruit more people and equip dem well to fit fight terrorists," e add. E advise say govnors for di affected states suppose work togeda instead of evribodi dey run dia state individually. "Govnors gatz to come togeda develop cross-border plan to fight terrorism," e add. Dr Ubandawaki tok say state govments suppose put more money for community security groups, and federal govment suppose make sure say all ungoverned land dey under govment control. "Govment need to take over those lands again. Dis one go require better surveillance and modern technology," e tok.
articles.title: 'My daughter bin no wan go dat school' - Mama of kidnapped Kebbi schoolgirl lament

articles.input: Super Eagles return to training for 2026 World Cup Africa qualifying play-offs afta 'settlement'
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, NurPhoto via Getty Images Nigeria Super Eagles train on Wednesday 12 November, 2025 afta di Nigeria Football Federation 'resolve issues' wit di players. Di team wey bin boycott dia training session on Tuesday sake of unpaid bonuses and allowances do tok-tok wit di football body and dem get to put di football and di kontri first bifor any oda tin. Nigeria go face Gabon on Thursday for dia first game for di 2026 Africa World Cup qualifying play-offs. Tori be say di three-time Africa Cup of Nations champions boycott dia training sake of dia bonuses and allowances wey authorities dey owe dem. Sports journalist Oluwashina Okeleji post for im X handle say "2026 World Cup playoff: Nigeria players and officials boycott training sake of bonus mata. But di captain of Super Eagles later confam say di team don resolve dia mata. William Troost-Ekong for im X handle say "Issue resolved. Outstanding financials cleared and on ground. E add say di team dey and focussed as before on representing Nigeria wit our maximum for di games ahead!" Dis action fit affect dia game against Gabon and e fit put dia chances to qualify for di World Cup at risk. Na hours remain for di Super Eagles to face dia opponent Gabon for di 2026 Fifa World Cup Africa Qualifying Play-offs and dis kain kasala dey hapun. Almost all di players don land for Rabat, Morocco wia di play-offs go happun except Maduka Okoye wey dem dey wait to arrive. Nigeria go face Gabon on Thursday for dia first match of di play-offs. For June 2019 for Egypt, Nigeria Super Eagles bin threaten to boycott training sake of govment no gree pay dem dia bonus. But di Nigeria Super Eagles bin return to training afta dem beat Guinea 1-0. For June 2022, Nigeria Super Falcons no attend training sake of unpaid bonus Di players bin no attend training dat Wednesday evening, and e make di NFF to act immediately so dem go fit prevent anoda strike before di match against Zambia wey bin dey come up dat Friday. "Di players don refuse to leave dia hotel for Casablanca sake of unpaid bonuses," one top NFF official tell BBC Sport Africa. "Issue also dey sake of unpaid first five days of camp, wey di players expect in dia bank accounts but e neva arrive." Di NFF, wey dey receive dia funding from di Nigerian govment make $1,000 payment to each player sharp-sharp to cover dia 10 days' allowance. NFF President Amaju Pinnick tell BBC Sport Africa dat time say im organisation dey "deal wit di issue" - but funds go get to come from di kontri Sports Ministry before dem go fit make any payment.
articles.title: Super Eagles return to training for 2026 World Cup Africa qualifying play-offs afta 'settlement'
