articles.input: Court jail Sean 'Diddy' Combs for more dan four years sake of prostitution case
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Angela Weiss/Getty Images Court on Friday 3 October sentence Sean 'Diddy' Combs to more dan four years on prostitution-related charges. Dem convict am of flying pipo across di US for sexual encounters e call "freak-offs", including im girlfriends and male sex workers. As e sentence di hip-hop mogul, US District Judge Arun Subramanian say di court don see "massive" amounts of evidence against Combs and ogbonge sentence bin dey required. Judge Subramanian impose di 50-month sentence for di hearing wey happun for Manhattan federal court. Combs bin plead not guilty and e dey expected to appeal im conviction. Di music mogul lawyers admit say dia client bin physically abuse im girlfriends, but tok say dem willingly take part for di sexual performances. Ahead of di sentencing, Combs bin beg di court sake of im actions against im ex-girlfriend Cassie Ventura inside one letter wey e address to di judge on Thursday. Inside di four-page letter, wey im address to di district judge of southern New York, Arun Subramanian, 24 hours bifor dem go sentence am, Combs tok say im take full responsibility and accountability for im past wrongs. "I take full responsibility and accountability for my past wrongs. Dis don be di hardest 2 years of my life, and I no get anyone to blame for my current reality and situation but mysef," e tok for di letter. Diddy apologise to im ex-girlfriend Cassie Ventura for assaulting her and di woman wey testify under di name "Jane" during di trial for hurting her also. "I literally lose my mind. I dey wrong for beating di woman wey be say I love," e tok. "I go always dey sorry for dat. My domestic violence go always be heavy burden wey I go carry forever." Diddy tok say im bin dey tink say e dey help provide for Jane and her pikin but afta im kon hear her testimony, e don realise say im hurt her. E say, "for dis I dey deeply sorry." Diddy explain say im crimes dey "rooted inside im own selfishness" and e dey "lost in drugs and di excess." E add say afta im don spend one year for prison, e don change for di beta. "Di old me die for jail and I don reborn, new version of me. Prison go change you or kill you - I choose to live," Diddy tok. Combs bin beg di court make dem reduce im jail time so e go fit spend time with im family and get "anoda chance to be beta papa, anoda chance to be beta son, anoda chance to be beta leader for my community, and anoda chance to live beta life." "I ask you for mercy today, no be only for my sake, but for di sake of my pikin dem. God don bless me wit 7 beautiful children—3 sons and 4 daughters," Diddy tok "Four out of my children lose dia mama, Kim Porter, as she tragically die for 2018. I be di only parent. I don fail my children as dia papa. My papa die of murder wen I bin dey 3-year-old so I know how e take be if pesin no get papa." For July, afta eight-week trial, jury acquit am of di most severe charges: racketeering and sex trafficking. Dem find am guilty of two counts of transportation to engage for prostitution. Each count carry maximum sentence of 10 years for prison. Prosecutors bin ask for minimum of 11 years, but Diddy lawyers don argue say such sentence go dey too dramatic to reach. Diddy lawyer bin ask for 14 months for prison, wey go amount to di time e don spend for custody since im arrest. Dem arrest di 55-yearl-old for September 2024, and di judge bin deny am two bail requests since di trial begin.
articles.title: Court jail Sean 'Diddy' Combs for more dan four years sake of prostitution case

articles.input: Refugees for UK go wait for 20 years to settle permanently under asylum reforms
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Alishia Abodunde/Getty Images Pipo wey dem grant asylum for UK go wait for 20 years bifor dem fit apply to settle permanently under plans wey Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood go announce on Monday 17 November. Di major shake-up to asylum policy dey come as di govment dey seek to reduce small boat crossings and asylum claims. Under di plans, pipo wey dem grant asylum go only dey allowed to stay for di UK temporarily, and dem go review dia refugee status regularly and dem go ask pipo wey dia kontri safe to return home. Currently, di refugee status dey last for five years, and pipo fit apply for indefinite leave to remain. Now di home secretary wan cut di initial period from five years to two-and-a-half years, afta dat, refugee status go dey permanently reviewed. But she plan to significantly lengthen di time wey e go take to gain permanent residence for UK from five years to 20 year. Mahmood tell di Sunday Times say di reforms bin dey "designed to essentially tell pipo: no come to dis kontri as illegal migrant, make you no get on a boat". She continue: "Illegal migration dey tear our kontri apart", and she add say na di govment job to "unite our kontri". "If we no sort dis out, I tink our kontri go become much more divided," she tell di newspaper. Dem copy di policy from Denmark, wia one govment wey di centre-left Social Democrats bin lead preside ova one of di toughest asylum and immigration systems for Europe. For Denmark, dem dey give refugees temporary residence permits, typically of two years, and dem gatz re-apply for asylum wen di residence permits expire. And Mahmood new approach go certainly face opposition from some Labour MPs. Liberal Democrat home affairs tok-tok pesin Max Wilkinson say e dey "right say di govment look at new ways to fix di disorderly asylum system wey di Conservatives bin create". E add say make Labour "no kid diasef say dis measures na alternative to processing claims quickly so we fit remove dose wey no get right to dey here". Enver Solomon, chief executive at di Refugee Council, say rather dan discourage migrants, di 20 years limit go "leave pipo in limbo and in tense anxiety for many, many years". "We need system wey dey controlled and wey dey fair, and di way you go do am, you make decisions fairly, in a timely fashion, and if dem find pesin as refugee, dem go on and contribute to our communities and dem pay back," e tell Breakfast on Sunday. A total of 109,343 pipo bin claim asylum for di UK in di 12 months to March dis year, a 17 percent increase compared to di year bifor, according to govment data. Mr Solomon say concern about di increasing number of asylum claims na becos pipo feel say "di govment don forgot about dia communities". According to di latest Home Office figures, 1,069 migrants bin arrive for di UK in di last seven days. More dan 39,000 pipo don arrive for UK by small boats for 2025. Di number of arrivals dis year dey higher dan di whole of 2024 (36,816) and 2023 (29,437), but below di total at dis point for 2022 (39,929).
articles.title: Refugees for UK go wait for 20 years to settle permanently under asylum reforms

articles.input: Health benefits of green pepper
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Yasuhiroamano via Getty Images Green pepper wey pipo dey also call bell pepper na one kain vegetable wey belong to di same family wit chili pepper, tomato and eggplant. E first come from Central and South American kontris like Mexico, Peru and Bolivia. Pipo for dat side don dey plant am for more dan 6,000 years both for food and for medicine. If you dey chop green pepper steady, e fit make your bodi strong, help you recova quick from sickness, and protect you from common infection like cold and flu. One Dietitian Ibrahim Abdulsalam Bichi for Kano tok say "Green pepper get almost two times more Vitamin C pass orange (per 100g wen e fresh), and dat one make am strong food wey fit boost pesin health well well." E still tok say if pesin dey chop green pepper regularly, e go help di body stay healthy for long. Generally, dis kain side effects no dey happun often, and even wen e happun, e small. Green pepper na veri nutritious and safe food for most pipo if dem dey eat am as part of balanced diet.
articles.title: Health benefits of green pepper

articles.input: Why Ghana no punish anybody afta bloody 2020 and 2024 elections wey kill 15 pipo
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, NIPAH DENNIS/AFP via GETTY Elections for many parts of Africa now become do-or-die mata. Dis mean say politicians wan win power by all means, so some dey use violence and oda means like vote-rigging to stay in power for many years. But dis kain tins dey affect di democracy wey kontris for Africa say dem dey practice. For Ghana, one investigation by di kontri Inspector General of Police (IGP) Christian Tetteh Yohuno into di violence wey kill 15 pipo during di 2020 and 2024 elections reveal some tins. President John Mahama for di campaign ahead of di 2024 elections, promise say e go ensure pipo wey dey responsible for di death of pipo for di 2020 elections, go face di law. In January dis year, afta he take office, president Mahama order di IGP to investigate di mata and submit di report to his office. Afta eight months, di IGP submit di report. Security analysts and many citizens say di findings of di investigation no "inspire confidence". Many pipo say dem dey disappointed say afta all dis while (five years), di kontri no prosecute even one pesin for di violence and di shooting during di two elections wey kill 15 citizens, including teenagers. Di taskforce establish say eight pipo die during di 2020 elections when security pipo open fire into party supporters for some polling centres. Dem also find say 40 pipo injure afta various incidents for polling centres during and afta di voting and counting process. Di kontri interior minister Mohammed Muntaka Mubarak for one press conference to announce details of di report tok say so far dem identify 21 suspects responsible for di violence during di two elections. Wia dis foto come from, CHRIS STEIN/AFPviaGETTY Some of dis pipo be policemen and soldiers wey fire live rounds at polling centres during di elections, wey odas odas be political party supporters. "Out of di 21 suspects, dem arrest four wey dem dey on police bail, five of dem dey remanded into prison custody wey di rest dey on di run," di interior minister tok. About di status of di cases – di minister tok say "four cases dey court now, three dey under investigation, wey three odas dey di Attorney General's office for advice." Di interior minister say govment dey committed to ensure justice for di victims no mata how long e go take. Under di previous govment (President Nana Akufo-Addo en tenure), for four years, di police fail to prosecute anybody. Di service for four years (2020 -2024) under di former IGP Dr George Akuffo Dampare say dem still dey investigate. Di police at di time tok say dem no find di security officers wey fire dia weapons for di collation centre wey kill two pipo and injure nine odas for di Techiman South constituency for di Bono East region. Civil society groups and oda human right agencies put pressure on di police but dem no deliver justice to di victims. On 2 September 2024, di High Court for Wenchi in di Bono East region order govment to pay total of GHc270K ($25K) to six victims of di 2020 electoral violence for Techiman. Justice Frederick Nawurah wey preside ova di case tok say "dem abuse di right to life and dignity of di victims." Di six pipo Suleman Elliasu, Abubakari Iddrisu, Alhassan Nasiru, Aremeyaw Alhassan, Alhassan Abdul-Rahman and Paul Asue - sue di govment to demand Ghc 25m compensation ($2.3m). Father of one 18-year-old boy wey dem kill during di violence for Techiman also join di lawsuit at dat time. Di judge rule say di security officers wey fire dia guns on di election day, abuse di rights of di victims wey he order say make dem prosecute dem. He also order say as part of di compensation, make govment pay each of di six victims GHc 25k ($2.3k) wit an additional GHc20k ($1.9k) to cover legal fees during di trial. Human rights groups and experts at dat time tok say dat compensation money be too small. Oga for di Ghana Human Rights Commission, Joseph Whittal for one interview wit BBC Pidgin bifor di 2024 elections tok say dat money be chicken change. "I agree wit pipo wey tok say di compensation be small, sake of to pay pesin Ghc45k at di time di cedi dey depreciate, wey cost of living togeda wit amount for medication and bills dey high." "But di court look at di evidence bifor dem wey dem order dat kind amount – we believe say di compensation for be more than dat," oga Joseph Whittal add. Afta dis court ruling in September, di state neva pay di compensation to di victims till di end of 2024 when di kontri go thru anoda election. Elliasu Sulemana wey receive bullets for his right arm on election day for di collation centre in 2020, still no fit use di hand do anytin since. Security officers for di centre fire into di crowd of party supporters dat day. "I dey work in di timber industry, I dey carry logs from di forest wey we dey take go di cities and towns, but I no fit do dat work again sake of I no fit use my right hand again." He explain say afta dem fix metal inside his arm, he always dey feel pain, wey he no fit use dat hand to even chop food. Di current president John Mahama during di 2024 election campaign promise di victims say his govment go compensate dem for dia injuries and di families of those wey die go also receive compensation. But one year since president Mahama enta di presidency, dat compensation never reach di victims. "We di victims dey on our own, nobody dey mind us, even di presidency wey promise us compensation, no deliver on dat promise. Make you pipo help us to get Justice," Elliasu Sulemana tok BBC Pidgin. Family of 15-year-old Samira Zakaria wey also die during di 2020 elections for di Northern region of Ghana, say dem dey disappointed. Her uncle Yakubu Zakaria say "election be to elect leaders, no be to kill pipo. My niece Samira die when bullet hit her for di party office. She no do anytin wrong." Oda families still get pain for dia heart – afta wetin happun to dem during di two elections in 2020 and 2024. As part of dia recommendations, di IGP special police taskforce say govment gatz to pay compensation to all di victims – both families of those wey die and di pipo wey hurt. Dem also recommend say make di police receive orientation so say dem go stop dey use lethal force to control crowd. Di taskforce also tok say election security gatz to dey coordinated well to determine when dem fit use force to control crowd. Some pipo say because di state no punish security officers and odas wey cause di death of eight and injury to 34 pipo during di 2020 elections, di officers get liver to do di same tin wey cause death of seven more pipo for di 2024 elections. CSOs and human rights groups say dis record dey affect wetin dem describe as di democratic power of di kontri. Executive Director for di Africa Centre for Security and Counterterrorism (ACSC), Emmanuel Kotin say "ibi shame say dem no punish anybody for five years now." "Ghana get many laws – even recently we pass di anti-vigilantism law wey dey ban political parties from using vigilantes, but dem no prosecute even one pesin under dat law. We no be serious as a kontri," oga Emmanuel Kotin tok. He explain "until we begin to enforce our laws, we just go dey waste taxpayers money to create dis laws for dis kontri." "Di victims no get justice, ibi now dem start di process, we get long way to go." "Until dem prosecute all di 21 suspects wey di IGP taskforce identify from dia investigations, di victims no go get justice," oga Kotin tok di state broadcaster GTV. Di security expert also say time reach for di kontri to demand accountability from security officers. "Ibi difficult tin to prosecute our security pipo and for dis case, ibi di actions of dis security personnel wey cause di death of seven out of di 15 deaths during di two elections. Until we begin to punish dem, dis tins go continue." He also add his voice to di calls for compensation for di victims as well as psychological support. "Di compensation no be only di money, di state also gatz to provide psychological support to dem as di court also dey work to bring dem justice – even though we know say di courts fit take years to deal wit dis kind mata." Experts also dey demand reforms for di kontris electoral processes – so say political parties go support di electoral commission when dem dey organize elections, to reduce di tension and violence. articles.input: Wia Cameroon opposition leader Issa Tchiroma Bakary dey?
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, DANIEL BELOUMOU OLOMO/AFP via Getty Images Cameroon opposition leader Issa Tchiroma Bakary don claim say military dey support and protect am for one secure location afta di govment tok say im go face legal actions Reuters report. "I thank di loyalist army, dem shown patriotism by escorting me to safe location and currently dem dey ensure my protection," Tchiroma tok dis for im Facebook page. Tchiroma Bakary bin claim say na im win di 12 October, presidential election for Cameroon but di constitutional council declare Paul Biya di winner of di election on Monday 27 October. Although, Tchiroma Bakary don dey im house for northern city of Garoua since di presidential election on October 12 but e don come out to claim say dem don kidnap two members of im family and personal cook for im Garoua hometown. Di 76-year-old opposition leader tok say im don move to safe location by im "loyalists" in di military, afta one big protest break out in di kontri ova di weekend. Cameroon Interior Minister Paul Atanga Nji blame di opposition leader Tchiroma Bakary say na im dey organise di "violent post-election" protest wey don lead to di loss of lives across di kontri. At least four protesters don die as di tension kontinu to grow afta di consitutional council declare Paul Biya as di winner of di election. Inside anoda statement on Friday, Tchiroma Bakary call for national lockdown protest against di election results from November 3 to November 5, im ask di pipo make dem observe "ghost town across di kontri. "Despite dis climate of terror to make us retreat, we no go give in. I diafore call on you, from Monday, November 3 to Wednesday, November 5, to observe ghost town," e tok. "Make di entire kontri come to standstill, so di whole world go know say we dey resist and say we no go gree. "Make we close our shops, suspend our activities, sidon for house, in silence, to demonstrate our solidarity and to remind dis regime say di strength di economy na di pipo — and di pipo no longer recognize dem as dia leader. "Cameroonian pipo. Dis no be di time to dey for fear or dey divided. Make we remain standing, united, proud, and in solidarity against pipo, wit Machiavellian cynicism, invoke peace while sowing terror as dem continue to rule through misery and blood. "I repeat, dem no go steal our victory. I don make solemn pledge neva to betray una, and I no go fail. Dis na di reason for di rest of my life. We go win dis togada." Tchiroma Bakary call for "ghost town" afta days of post-electoral violence wey don lead to di arrest of plenty pipo, some don die and some wunjure. Di UN, EU, France, Canada and rights groups such as Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International don condem di killings. Although normalcy don dey return to some parts of di kontri afta di protest, but di situation on ground remain unpredictable. On Facebook, Tchiroma Bakary praise di pipo for dia courage and unity for standing against di "seizure of power." E tok say across di regions, from North to South, East to West, Cameroonians don express demselves peacefully, wit di only weapon wey di constitution grant to dia "voice." "And yet, dem welcome dis voice by di use of arms. Real bullets respond to di chants of freedom. Dem don steal our parents, our children prime, and peaceful marches don turn into blind repression, wit facie crimes. "Hundreds don die and wunjure. Entire family dey in grief, recalling di traumatic events of 1984. "While di pipo dey mourn dia misfortune, pipo wey dey responsible for dis tragedy dey celebrate shamelessly, displaying on social media dia cynicism and contempt for di pipo. "Inside one video, di President of di Constitutional Council imself, don drink champagne, e dey boast say im don "ensure" di outgoing President' victory."
articles.title: Wia Cameroon opposition leader Issa Tchiroma Bakary dey?

articles.input: Wetin be Trump Gaza plan wey di UN Security Council don adopt to end di Isreal-Gaza kasala
articles.output: Di UN Security Council don vote yes to one US drafted resolution wey don stamp di US President Donald Trump, im 20 point plan for Gaza. Part of di plan include di establishment of one international Stabilisation Force (ISF) wey US say some unamed kontris don offer say dem go contrubute inside. Di resolution get di support of 13 kontris like di UK, France and Somalia. But Russia and China abstain from di vote even though no kontris bin vote against di proposal. Tok-tok pesin for di UN Secretary-General Antonio Gutteres tok say to adopt dis plan na "important step for di consolidation of di ceasefire". But Hamas don reject di resolution say e no meet di needs and demands of Palestinians. Di Palestinian armed group bin write for Telegram afta di resolution pass say di plan "force international guardianship mechanism for di Gaza Strip, wey our pipo and dia factions reject". Dem add say, "dem give di international foce wit tasks and roles for inside di Gaza Strip wey include to scata di resistance, comot dia neutrality and turn am to part for inside di kasala wey go favour di occupation". For inside di resolution, di ISF go work wit Israel and Egypt to geda wit a newly trainned and vetted Palestinian police force, to help secure border area and start di process to permanently disarm high-state armed groups, wey include Hamas. Mike Waltz, di US ambassador to di UN tell di council say di ISF go get "di work of securing di area, support di demilitarisation of Gaza, scata di terrorist infrastructure, remove weapons nad ensure di safetyy of Palestinian civillians". Di security Council bin also approve di creation of transitional governance bodi wey dem call di Board of Peace (BoP), wey go supervise governance of Palestinian technocratic, apolitical committee and go oversee di rebuilding of Gaza and di delivery of humanitarian aid. To finance di reconstruction of Gaza afta two years of war go come from trust fund wey di World Bank dey back according to di resolution. For di resolution, both di ISF and di BoP go work togeda wit Palestinian committee and police force. Trump call di Security Council vote say e dey "historic" and tok say na way to "acknowledge and endorse" di BoP wey dem go announce dia final membership soon. Trymp dey expected to be di oga of di board. E write for Truth Social say, "dis go go down as one of di biggest approvals for di history of di United Nations, wey go lead to more Peace all ova di World and na moment of true historic proportion". Unlike oda drafts, dis resolution tok about credible way to Palestinian self-determination and statehood. Dis na wetin plenti council members bin dey fight for. Israel dey strongly against creation of Palestinian state, wey go cause beta blockage for di road to future statehood. Key Arab States don ginger drafters of di resolution make dem put Palestinian self-determination for inside di text. Di US, Palestinian Authority and plenti oda Arab and Muslim-majority kontris dey include Egypt, Saudi Arabia and Turkey don dey ginger for di quick adoption of di resolution. Di Palestinian Authority (PA) tok for statement say di resolutions terms need to dey implemented "urgently and immediately". Russia and China no use di veto wey dem get instead dem abstain di vote mostly bicos di PA and eight oda Arab and Muslim kontris don alreadi back am. But dem don come for di resolution say e no clear for di key mechanism composition, say e no ensure di participation of di UN, and say e no really tok am outside of di commitment for di two-state solution. Di first phase of di plan wey be ceasefire between Israel and Hamas and handover of hostages and detainees bin happun for 10 October. Waltz call am say na "fragile, fragile first step".
articles.title: Wetin be Trump Gaza plan wey di UN Security Council don adopt to end di Isreal-Gaza kasala

articles.input: Di new military service plan Germany wan use to boost troop numbers
articles.output: Germany coalition govment don agree one new military service plan wey go boost troop numbers sake of months of fight between political forces. Di new military service plan go mandate all 18-year-old men to fill out  questionnaire weda dem dey suitable to serve and, from 2027, dem go do medical screening. Di decision dey come as Berlin dey aim to create di strongest conventional army for Europe. Di oga of Germany biggest defence firm, Rheinmetall, tell BBC say im believe say dem  fit meet di target in five years. Lawmakers dey expected to vote on di plan by di end of 2025. Armin Papperger say Chancellor Friedrich Merz aim to boost di Bundeswehr dey "realistic" and im tell di BBC say "clear decisions" dey come from govment. Earlier dis year, German defence chief Gen Carsten Breuer bin warn say di Western Nato alliance bin need to prepare for possible Russian attack within four years. Mr Papperger say im bin "no get glass ball" about di future but agree say Germany need to dey "ready in '29". Wen dem bin form di coalition earlier dis year, Merz conservative CDU/CSU and di centre-left Social Democrat SPD bin agree to re-introduce military service wey go dey voluntary "to start wit". Di Bundeswehr currently get around 182,000 troops. Di new military service model dey aim to increase di number by 20,000 ova di next year, wey go rise to between 255,000 and 260,000 ova di next 10 years, supplemented by approximately 200,000 reservists. From next year, dem go send all 18-year-old men and women one questionnaire to assess dia interest and willingness to join di armed forces. E go dey mandatory for men and voluntary for women. From July 2027, all men wey dey 18 go also do medical exam to assess dia fitness for duty. If di govment no meet dia target, dem go try one form of compulsory enlistment wey parliament fit consider. If war wan hapun now, di military go fit look di questionnaires and medical exams for potential recruits. Some wey dey within Germany political left still no support di mandatory service at all. Small fear dey say many young Germans no too feel am and a significant majority no support am. One recent Forsa survey for Stern magazine bin suggest say while just ova half of respondents favour di compulsory service, opposition bin rise to 63% among 18- to 29-year-olds. "I no wan go war becos I no want to die or I no want make dem shoot me" Na wetin Jimi, wey be 17-years old student from Berlin, wey bin attend one anti-conscription protest outside di Bundestag earlier dis week tok. "I no wan shoot pipo." Attack against Germany na "unlikely and abstract scenario" wey di govment bin use to legalise "stealing millions of young pipo right to decide wetin dem wan do", im tok. Meanwhile, 21-year-old Jason bin sign up as new Bundeswehr recruit early dis year becos of di current "security situation". "I bin wan contribute to defend peace, to defend democracy if di worst hapun," im tok. As im join, e say im bin feel like "giving back to society" but also believe in di army, "so potential enemies no dey even tink about attacking you". Defence Minister Boris Pistorius bin want to reassure Germans, say despite di new military service plan no " cause for concern... no reason for fear". "Di more capable of deterrence and defence our armed forces dey, through armament through training and through personnel, di less likely say e go be say we go become a party to di conflict at all," Pistorius tok. Defence spending for Germany tumble afta di end of di Cold War, while dem bin suspend compulsory recruitment for 2011. Sake of dia past, Germany no dey too show dia military might since, but early dis year, Friedrich Merz bin announce say di rule for German defence "now go be whatever it takes", sake of Russia full-scale invasion of Ukraine. Nato kontris across Europe don come under pressure from President Donald Trump White House to hike spending. Di move wey Europe dey make to re-arm don mean significant revenue for Rheinmetall. Di CEO, Armin Papperger, wey im company dey also supply Ukraine, say: "We dey make plenti money becos di demand big well-well." "We need to grow strong on vehicles, on ammunition, we need to get our own satellite competencies. We dey do much more on di electronics and artificial intelligence... dan ever bifor," im tok. One US report last year bin suggest say di Rheinmetall boss na di target of one Russian assassination plot. Confirmation bin no dey dat time and Mr Papperger no gree tok on di report, but im say: "I feel good, I feel safe." On weda im feel say Europe bin dey in a state of a cold or hybrid war, im say: "Anytin wey you call am, no be peaceful time."
articles.title: Di new military service plan Germany wan use to boost troop numbers

articles.input: Tinubu confam death of Brigadier General Musa Uba - Di Army Commander wey ISWAP ambush
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Presidency/Amaq Nigeria President Bola Tinubu don confam di death of high ranking Nigerian Army officer, Brigadier General Musa Uba wey die in di line of duty during ambush by terrorist group. Di tok about di whereabouts of di Brigadier General Uba bin make pipo begin worry, afta fotos show wia terrorists bin gbab am. Nigerian Army for one of dia previous statement say oga Uba bin dey on routine patrol to secure communities wey dey around Wajiroko for Azir Multe, Damboa LGA of Borno State. Dat na di last time wey dem hear anytin about am, up till wen di video of di death Uba come dey trend. Although di Nigerian Army no issue any statement to confam di whereabouts of Brigadier General Uba since 15 November. But statement wey do presidency release on Tuesday through im tok tok pesin Bayo Onanuga, President Tinubu say e dey depressed to hear of di death of di senior army officer. "As di Commander-in-Chief of di Armed Forces, I dey depressed wit di tragic death of our soldiers and officers on active duty. May God comfort di families of Brigadier General Musa Uba and oda fallen heroes. President Tinubu send im condolences to di military ova di death of 'gallant sojas and Brigadier General Musa Uba, wey pay di ultimate price while on active duty to fight insurgents for Borno state.' Brigadier General Uba enta tori just few days afta di Nigeria Army say e lead troops of di 25 Task Force  Brigade for Borno State. As senior army officer, Brigadier General Uba na Brigade commander wey don lead officers of di army to different operations for Nigeria. Nigerian Army say oga Uba bin dey on routine patrol to secure communities wey dey around Wajiroko for Azir Multe, Damboa LGA of Borno State. Howeva, viral videos and pictures begin fly for social media wia terrorist group Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) bin show footages of di Brigade Commander. For di video wey di terrorist group bin release, dem show di face of di Brigade Commander for helpless position. Also e bin no clear wia oga Uba dey despite ISWAP claims, until President Tinubu confam im death for 18 November 2025. Borno State na one of di states for Nigeria wey don suffer bandits and terrorist groups attack. For Sunday 12 January 2025, armed militia group wey be suspected Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists attack some farmers and fishermen inside Dumba community, near Baga for Kukawa local goment area of Borno State, northeast Nigeria. Local goments like Gudumbari, Marte and Abadam for Borno state na part of wia pipo wey dey live for dis places tell BBC News Pidgin say dem don dey under Boko Haram and Iswap control for over six years, and dem dey live inside fear evriday. Now, di tori of Brigadier General Uba don raise plenti kwesion. Brigadier General Musa Uba na di commander 25 Brigade of di Nigeria Army. For Nigeria Brigadier General na one-star General and e dey command Brigade or Regiment. Dis rank dey among di Nigerian Army commissioned officers ranks. Dis na officers wey enta di military through di Nigerian Defense Academy (NDA) or di Direct Short Service Commission (DSSC). Tori come for 15 November 2025 say terrorist groups don capture di Commander of Nigerian Army 25 Task Force Brigade for Damboa, Borno State, Brigadier General Uba. Di report say na for Wajiroko village for Borno state di ambush happun wen e dey return from operation. Nigeria Army confam say two sojas and two civilian task force die from di encounter wit di terrorists, but dem no mention names. Brigadier General Uba na di highest ranking military officer wey terrorist groups go kpai since 2021.
articles.title: Tinubu confam death of Brigadier General Musa Uba - Di Army Commander wey ISWAP ambush

articles.input: Taylor Swift: The Life of a Showgirl na triumphant pop victory lap
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, TAS Rights Management Di last time we meet Taylor Swift, she bin dey ball. Her last album, The Tortured Poets Department, na emotional song – one ogbonge postmortem of two bitter, messy break-ups. We bin see her for her lowest, "she bin dey cry for gym" and "dey vex" say she waste her youth on top one six-year relationship wit British actor Joe Alwyn, wey later end as she chop breakfast. Eighteen months later, she don come back wit di latest update from her bureau; and di story dey veri different. Di songs wey she record for stolen moments during di record-shattering Eras tour, don see di 35-year-old happy, energised and newly in love wit American Footballer Travis Kelce. "Dis album dey about wetin dey happun behind di scenes for my inner life during dis tour, wey dey so energetic and electric and vibrant," she tok as she appear on Kelce New Heights podcast last month. Wia dis foto come from, Max Martin / Instagram To capture dat dynamic, she produce di album no be wit her longtime collaborator Jack Antonoff – wey im productions define di sounds of Midnights, and Tortured Poets Department – but wit Swedish pop masterminds Max Martin and Shellback, wey don work wit Swift bifor on hits like Shake It Off and I Knew You Were Trouble. Di goal, Swift tok na to make a tight, compact album of "bangers" wit "melodies wey dey so infectious wey go make you almost dey vex for am". But dis rant don do. Dis The Life of a Showgirl na rhinestone-studded success, or a chorus line catastrophe? Getting straight to di point: It's a triumph. To get straight to di point: na victory. Na combination of compelling songwriting and whip-smart production easily clear di high bar wey Swift don set for hersef. Fans wey dey expect a return to di maximalist pop of Red and 1989 go dey surprised. Swift new music dey more cool and collected pass her previous collaborations wit Martin; e tap into di atmospheric textures of im recent hits for The Weeknd and Ariana Grande. At 41 minutes, The Life of a Showgirl na di shortest album Swift don release since her debut for 2006. Wia dis foto come from, TAS Rights Management Thematically, Swift latest lyrics get two distinct threads. Half of di album 12 songs na about falling completely, goofily, head ova heels in love. Di rest tackle di seedy underbelly of fame. Along di way, we get some classics, like di image of one burlesque dancer "wey dey glow like di end of cigar"; she compare one critic yarn to "a toy chihuahua wey dey bark from a tiny purse". Anoda entire song dey wey dey filled witvplayground innuendo. Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Fans bin expect say The Fate of Ophelia go be like Swift Shakespeare story of one noblewoman wey drown in a fit of mania afta grief make her mad. Instead, she sing about how Kelce save her from dat fate, for one crisp pop track wey dey packed wit cute references to dia relationship – wey include di Kansas City Chiefs, and di number 100 (di total of Kelce jersey number, 87, and Swift lucky number 13). "I hear you dey call me on di megaphone," she tok, as she confam how dia romance start wen Kelce publicly declare im affection on im podcast for July 2023. "If you no eva come for me, I for don drown for sadness." Musically, di song play clever trick as e add one extra bar for di end of evri oda phrase, as though Swift dey linger in di moment, too swept up for her feelings to continue. She pepper di album wit little flourishes like dat - and e dey supremely satisfying. Wia dis foto come from, TAS Rights Management Di lovestruck theme bin continue on Opalite, wey im breezy chords and Abba-esque harmonies unfurl like a blossoming romance; and Wi$h Li$t, wia Swift remove herself from di Hollywood pack for a life of domestic bliss. "Dem want dat critical smash Palme d'Or and Oscar on dia bathroom floor," she observe. "I just want you". (Plus "a couple of kids" wit "a best friend wey I tink say dey hot"). But perhaps di most eye-opening tribute to Kelce na Wood - one staccato dance track, wey complete wit a Jackson 5 guitar riff. For dia, we see Swift superstitiously "knocking on wood", say dia relationship go last, and knocking wood for di bedroom, for one unexpected homage to her fiancé "manhood". E dey so silly and unexpected and e make me laugh out loud. Di same tin go for Actually Romantic, one fantastically sarcastic track about one fellow pop star (unnamed), wey call Swift "boring Barbie" and write songs about how much dem hate her. Ova grungy guitars and slapping drum beat, Taylor taunt dem wit a touch of reverse psychology. "E bin sound nasty but e feel like you dey flirt wit me," she trill. "All di effort you don put inside, actually dey romantic." She continue to settle scores on Father Figure - di scathing story of one backstabbing protégé, wey interpolate di George Michael classic of di same name. Fans go try hard to uncover di subject identity, but, to me, di song be more like a morality tale about music industry Svengali, wey possess di power to wipe out anyone wey no dey "loyal to di family". Full of cinematic strings and disorientating key changes, e sit alongside No Body, No Crime, Bad Blood and Vigilante S*** for Swift expanding catalogue of revenge anthems. Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Di album best track, however, na di soft-focus ballad Ruin The Friendship. Time-travelling to Swift high school days for Tennessee, recollect di tori about one boy wey she put for friend zone as she dey long for a single kiss. Delicate and nostalgic, e take a heart-wrenching turn for di third verse, wen Swift real life best friend Abigail call to say dia former schoolfriend don die, and she fly through di night to attend di funeral. For inside album wey largely centre on contentment, di regret and sadness hit double hard. Di collection end wit di title track, one spirited duet wit Sabrina Carpenter wey double as a cautionary tale about stardom. Na di only song wey really lean into di showgirl concept, wit a percussive tap-dancing interlude and ostentatious key changes, as di stars trade lines about dia cut-throat industry. "All di headshots on the walls of di dance hall / Are of the bitches who wish I'd hurry up and die," Swift sing. Den di punchline: "But I'm immortal now, baby doll." E feel like a deliberate call-back to Look What You Made Me Do, wey she write for 2017 afta one public showdown wit Kanye West and afta months of negative press. Back den, she sing: "The old Taylor can't come to the phone right now… Why? Oh, cause she's dead." For 2025, wit di world at her feet, Swift fit finally tok wit certainty say her place for pop history dey guaranteed. The Life of a Showgirl na her well-earned victory lap.
articles.title: Taylor Swift: The Life of a Showgirl na triumphant pop victory lap

articles.input: #JusticeForRansford campaign start for Ghana afta death of academy player sake of alleged sexual abuse by coach
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, SIANOBAAKOPE Dis tori get wetin fit turn your belle. #JusticeForRansford dey trend for Ghana for several days. For social media, celebrities, influencers and oda citizens carry dia voice join dis hashtag to demand justice for one 16-year-old boy wey die in March dis year. Di juvenile footballer wey im parents carry am go di Siano Football Academy for Pokuase to become professional soccer star, allegedly suffer sexual abuse from im coach. According to di late Ransford Owusu Ansah, di coach Ibrahim Anyass allegedly sodomize am almost evri day for three months inside di football academy. Afta di mother suffer to take care of di medical bills of di boy wen e fall sick, carry di mata go one local radio station, Oyerepa FM. Di little boy explain on top di radio show say "di coach always carry me enta one of di academy rooms wey e dey sleep wit me. He say make I no tell anybody." "I get big wound but di coach still dey sleep wit me," di late Ransford tok for di radio show. E also explain say di coach promise to make am di best footballer if e allow am to kontinu to sleep wit am. Mother of di late juvenile footballer say di coach neva allow her to tok to her son on phone for many weeks even though Ransford tok am say e dey sick. According to Eno Ansah, coach Ibrahim Anyass always dey tok am say di academy dey take care of her son and im hospital bills so make she no worry, until she go di academy by herself one day. "Afta I carry my son come house, di condition become worse wey dem admit am for one children's hospital for Kumasi, bifor e enta coma for one month." She tok di host of di Oyerepa FM show say "my son open up to wen im health become critical, wey dem admit am for hospital." "While e dey on admission I call di coach to give am update about di condition wey e send me money to pay for medical bills and buy herbal medicine. Di coach also promise to visit di child for hospital but e neva show up," Eno Ansah tok. Ransford Ansah later enta coma for one month wey e get plenty bed sores bifor e die in March, according to im mother. She later report di mata to di police, but afta many months, dem no give am any closure wey she carry di mata enta social media. Inside one viral video, Eno Ansah cry out to Ghanaians say make dem help her get justice for her son. Dem call coach Ibrahim Anyass on top di radio show for his side of di story but e deny. "Wetin Ransford tok say I dey sexually abuse am no be true. Dem carry Ransford come di academy wen e be small boy wey I train am till now. I no fit do such a tin to im." Coach Anyass explain say "for some time, Ransford dey fall sick for di academic plenty times, wey I dey buy herbal medicine for am until di sickness become serious." Even afta dem play back di voice of di little boy wen e dey explain how di coach dey abuse am every day, oga Ibrahim Anyass still deny di allegation. Wia dis foto come from, CHANGE.ORG One online petition wey dey demand justice for di late 16-year-old juvenile footballer get more dan 2,900 signatures as at 5 AM (GMT), Saturday 8 November 2025. Di petition dey demand investigation into di mata from di Ghana football association, di Ghana police service and oda agencies to prosecute di coach. Gifty Saah Osei wey start di petition say, "absence of action from di agencies wey dey responsible be unacceptable." "Dis case dey expose weakness in di kontris child protection system, when adults wey dey in position of trust neva dey face any punishment, e dey teach oda predators say dem fit continue dia bad tins." Inside one statement, di ministry of gender, children and social protection explain wetin do since di mata reach dia office. According to di ministry, dem find say di late Ransford Owusu Ansah dey di Siano Football Academy for Amasaman for three years, where his coach allegedly sexually abuse him. "According to di records, di victim dey receive treatment since December 2024, bifor dem later admit am for di Komfo Anokye Teaching hospital (Kath) where he later die." Di ministry tok say "management of di Siano football academy suspend di coach wey dem tok say dem go dey available to assist di law enforcement agencies to provide justice for di 16-year-old." "When di gender minister Dr Agnes Naa Momo Lartey take her post in February 2025, she engage di Ghana football association about dis mata to ensure accountability and strong child protection for di football sector." Di ministry say "in addition to di suspension of coach Ibrahim Anyass, dem also close di football academy for investigations into di mata." Di domestic violence and victim support unit of di police (Dovvsu) chook eye for di mata wey dem transfer di docket to di homicide unit of di CID for further investigations. Di Ghana police service no officially tok anytin yet but sources say dem invite di suspect – Ibrahim Anyass to answer some questions for di CID headquarters. According to human rights advocate and lawyer for mother of di late 16-year-old, di police arrest di suspect. "I fit tok you people say di police arrest Siano football academy coach Ibrahim in connection wit di Ransford case," lawyer Annan tok. "Dem dey investigate – sake of di law say pesin dey innocent until court go prove say you be guilty. As lawyer, we provide all di information to di police wit di help of Ransford family." E also explain say wetin remain now be for di police to submit di docket for dis mata to di Attorney General office for advice about how dis mata go continue. Now pressure dey on di police to provide update on dis mata as di  #JusticeForRansford campaign dey continu for social media. Popular blogger and digital journalist Kobby Kyei write for twitter (X) "dem take di life of dis young footballer afta years of abuse. No boy gatz to ensure sometin like dis. We stand wit di family and demand justice; boys deserve safety." TV personality Anita Akua Akuffo also tok say "no human, especially a 16-year-old, deserve to die like dis. Di tin make I weak." Actor Yaw Dabo wey also get soccer academy say make di whole kontri rise to demand justice. "I dey call on di president and oda big pipo like di IGP and odas to take dis mata serious. Dis be shame to di Ghana football sector. #JusticeForRansford" For TikTok, pipo dey do videos to add dia voice to di call for #JusticeForRansford
articles.title: #JusticeForRansford campaign start for Ghana afta death of academy player sake of alleged sexual abuse by coach

articles.input: Trump sign bill wey order justice department to release Epstein files
articles.output: US President Donald Trump announce on Wednesday say e don sign bill wey order di release of govment files wey relate to di late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Di bill require di justice department to release all information from dia Epstein investigation within 30 days, although some fit dey withheld if dem relate to active investigation or fit invade personal privacy. Wit Trump support, di legislation really clear both chambers of Congress, di House of Representatives and Senate, on Tuesday. Afta e face pushback from Epstein victims and members of im own Republican Party, Trump change im opposition to release di files last week. Until recently, Trump bin dismiss di need to release di documents, recently as e call am a Democrat-led "hoax" to "deflect" attention away from im party work. "Perhaps di truth about dis Democrats, and dia associations wit Jeffrey Epstein, go soon dey revealed, becos I JUST SIGN DI BILL TO RELEASE DI EPSTEIN FILES!" e write. Although a congressional vote no dey required to release di files - as Trump for order di release on im own - lawmakers for di House pass di legislation with a 427-1 vote. Di Senate give unanimous consent to pass am upon arrival,  and send di bill to Trump for im signature. Di Epstein files subject to release under di legislation na documents from criminal investigations into di financier, including transcripts of interviews with victims and witnesses, and items wey dem seize for raids of im properties. Those materials include internal justice department communications, flight logs, and pipo and entities wey dey connected to Epstein. Di files dey different from di more dan 20,000 pages of documents from Epstein estate wey Congress release last week, including some wey directly mention Trump. Those include 2018 messages from Epstein wia e tok about Trump say: "I be di one wey fit take am down" and "I know how dirty Donald dey". Trump bifor-bifor friend of Epstein for years, but di president say dem quarrel in di early 2000s, two years bifor dem first arrest Epstein. Trump consistently deny any wrongdoing in relation to Epstein. Speaking to reporters on Monday night, Trump say Republicans get "nothing to do wit Epstein". "Na really a Democrat problem," e tok. "Di Democrats bin be Epstein friends, all of dem." Di family of Virginia Giuffre, wey die by suicide earlier dis year, tok for statement say Trump signing di bill dey "nothing short of monumental", for Giuffre and oda survivors. "As we look towards di next chapter, we still remain vigilant. Dis work neva finish. Evri name must be revealed, regardless of power, wealth, or party affiliation," her brother and sister-in-law, Sky and Amanda Roberts, tok. Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Dem find Epstein dead in 2019 for im New York prison cell for wetin a coroner rule as a suicide. Dem hold am on charges of sex trafficking. E previously dey convicted of soliciting prostitution from a minor in 2008. Di once high-flying financier get ties wit a number of high-profile figures, including Andrew Mountbatten Windsor, di brother of King Charles and former prince; Trump; Trump former advisor Steve Bannon; and a cast of oda characters from di world of media, politics and entertainment. On Wednesday, former Harvard president Larry Summers take leave from teaching for di university while di school investigate im links to Epstein, and reveal a series of chummy email exchanges. Attorney General Pam Bondi dey required to release "all unclassified records, documents, communications, and investigative materials" wey dey related to Epstein and im co-conspirator Ghislaine Maxwell no later dan 30 days afta di law dey enacted. Maxwell currently dey serve a 20-year sentence for sex trafficking. But based on di law text, portions fit still dey withheld if dem fit invade personal privacy or relate to an active investigation. Di bill give Bondi di power to withhold information wey fit jeopardise any active federal investigation or identify any victims. One of di bill architects, Republican Congressman Thomas Massie, say e get concerns say some files fit dey withheld. "I dey concerned say [Trump dey] open a flurry of investigations, and I believe say dem fit try to use those investigations as a basis for not releasing di files. Dat na my concern," e tok.
articles.title: Trump sign bill wey order justice department to release Epstein files

articles.input: Dolly Parton sister say make fans pray for Country music veteran
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Jason Kempin via Getty Images Dolly Parton sister don ask fans to pray for di ogbonge American country singer afta she postpone her Las Vegas residency sake of health mata wey she no gree tok outside. Di 79 year old music legend don alreadi delay her December concerts as she tell fans say she need "few procedures" to handle "health wahala". Di sister, Frieda Parton write for Facebook say, "Last night, I bin do all night prayer for my sister, Dolly. Most of una know say she no dey feel her best lately. "I believe in di power of prayer wella and I dey led to ask all di world wey love am to turn prayer warriors and pray wit me". Frieda end di message on high note as she write say, "she dey strong, she dey loved and wit all di prayers wey dem don pray for her, I know for my heart say she go well. Godspeed my sissy Dolly. We all love you". Tok-tok pesin for Dolly Parton tell CBS wey be BBC US partner say she go post social media message on Wednesday wey go "tok about evribodi worry". Parton suppose perform six shows for The Colosseum for Caesars Palace for December. But she postpone am till September next year say she bin no get enof time to rehearse for dem. Dis waka go Las Vegas suppose be her first to di Strip since di 1990s wen she bin perform togeda wit Kenny Rogers wey follow her sing di hit song Islands In The Stream. Parton neva tok wetin dey do her but recently she even cancel Dollywood event afta dem find kidney stone for her wey she say bin dey cause "plenti wahala". For March dis year, she bin loose her husband Carl Dean afta almost 60 years of marriage. She  bin sing di song If You Hadn't Been There to remember am. Wia dis foto come from, Ron Jenkins via Getty Images Dem born Dolly Parton for 1946 for one room cabin for Tennessee wit six brothers and five sisters. According to her dem bin grow up "dirt poor". Wen she be small pikin she go dey imagine say di fowl for her hard be her fans. She later turn child celeb as pikin bifor she record her first hit at di age of 13 and japa go Nashville di day afta she finish hight school. She bin dey write songs give oda pipo as teenager but for 1966 she get her own hit wit di song Dumb Blond. Na still for dat year she marry her husband Carl Deen. From 1967 she call her first few albums say dem specialize in "sad ass songs" den she drop feminist bop fir 1968 wey she call Just Because I'm a Woman.] For di 70s howeva, her hand mature for song writing and na wen she start to drop bangers like Jolene wet don dey covered by many artists including her own god-daughter Miley Cyrus and di song I Will Always Love You wey Whitney Houston make popular. By 1977, Dolly Parton don shift to pop superstart wen she make her first US platinum album, Here You Come Again. For di 1980s she start to dey act and bin sing di Oscar nominate song 9 to 5 and Islands in the Stream. For 1986, she don drop anoda banger wen she open di Dollywood theme park for Tennessee bifor she act for Steel Magnolias. Even sef na ger company Sandollar Productions rin di series for Buffy the Vampire Slayer. She don also make cameo appearances for plenti series, like di Disney show of her god daughter wey dem dey call Hannah Montana. For November 2020,, e comot say Dolly Parton bin drop $1m for Morderna Covid-19 vaccine effort. More recently she don run plenti big songs featuring trending musicians as for 2024, she follow Sabrina Carpenter do di remix for Please Please Please.

articles.input: Tributes pour in for Kenya gospel singer Betty Bayo wey die
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Betty Bayo/Instagram President Williams Ruto don join many Kenyans to mourn di death of popular gospel singer Beatrice Wairimu Mbugua wey pipo sabi as Betty Bayo. Di family of Betty announce her death on Monday, 10 November. Dem say she die afta one private battle wit advanced leukaemia. Her death still be shock for di kontri, as some of her fans don flood her social media pages to question if she truly don pass. Reports say di 43-year-old singer, bin keep her diagnosis secret, as she appear active and well for most of her fotos for social media. President Ruto for im tribute describe Betty as an extraordinary gospel artiste wey her voice carry hope into di hearts of countless Kenyans. Her song, Breakthrough hit, "11th Hour," na powerful anthem of divine turnaround wey inspire di faithful and comfort many wey dey find strength, healing and reassurance in gospel music." E tok. E add say for ova 15 years, Betty bin lift spirits through music wey speak of resilience, renewal and steadfast faith for di face of life challenges. "Her voice fit don fall silent, but her ministry live on for every heart she touch, every soul she uplift, and every life she help steady in difficult moments." Former Kenya Deputy President Rigathi Gachagua also say di tori of Betty passing na sad tin to am and di whole kontri. E pray for comfort for di family she leave behind. Betty Bayo na popular Kenyan musician wey dey often sing for her native tongue, Agikuyu. She rise to prominence during di 2010s as part of one strong wave of Kikuyu gospel singers. Her voice and her songs cut across church walls and bicom trendy songs for town halls, household radios, and online platforms. Some of her best-known songs include "11th Hour", "Gatho", "Jemedari", "Thiiri", "Udahi", "Ndîkerîria", "Maneno", and "Agocwo". Dis songs dey mix worship wit personal storytelling. She sing about waiting on God at late hours, about seasons of loss and gain, and about di small struggles wey dey shape life. As a performer, Betty dey energetic and direct. Her live shows dey always dey mixed wit praise and testimony. She dey often use her stage time to share parts of her story wey involve di time wey she serve as housemaid, wen she return to school, di years of hustle — and den she go sing prayer for di pipo wey dey present. Fellow gospel musicians and church leaders bin hail her for her authenticity and a clear heart for ministry. For Kenya gospel scene, she dey known as a steady voice wey bring joy and honest testimony to every stage.

articles.input: Court grant bail to Regina Daniels brother, but wetin don happun so far?
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Sammy West/Instagram Actress Regina Daniels broda, Samuel Ojeogwu wey call imself Sammy West don get im bail afta e bin dey arrested for Abuja. Dis na according to informate wey actress, Doris Ogala bring come outside. Videos of Sammy release don also spread for social media - wey show dia mama Rita Daniels dey thank Nigerians wey dey support dem. According to Ogala, na Omoyele Sowore bin assist in di release of Sammy even though di video no show am dey comot custody. Dis dey come afta oga Sowore don alreadi chook mouth inside di mata say, "APC Senator, Prince Ned Nwoko suppose dey held accountable for crimes against minor and abuse of power." On Saturday, Senator Nwoko accuse di musician, Sammy say e destroy im property and add say na im sef introduce Regina to di drugs wey she dey take to lead am to di rehab mata wey she run comot from. E post videos for im social media say, "dis videos dem show Sammy, Regina brother dey come my house several times and harass my pikin dem and domestic staff, especially wen I no dey. Im vists most times dey agressive and disruptive". Oga Nwoko accuse di broda of im siblings say dem dey force dia way into di house wen Regina Daniels dey do rehab to give am di drugs wey dem dey try rehabilitate am from. E add say, "e dey important to torchlight say Lawrence, Sammy, im babe NK, Destiny, Sonia and odas dey do di same drugs wey Regina dey do. Infact na Lawrence and Sammy introduce di drugs give and ans supply am di drugs." While e neva clear wen dem arrest am even as Regina Daniels bin first post say she dey find am on Wednesday, 5 November, di FCT police force comot on Friday, 7 November tok di reason for im arrest. Di command say dem receive one petition against di actress brother for alledged conspiracy, trespass, assault, criminal intimidation, theft and cyber-bullying. FCT police tok-tok pesin, SP Josephine Adeh, tok say dem bin don invite Sammy for questioning but e no gree show. Dis na wetin carry dem go Lagos "on di authority of di duly issue arrest warrant from di competent court, and den carry to Abuja for more investigation," to arrest am. Di police tok-tok pesin tok say dem don charge Sammy West to court on 6 November on charges "bordering on criminal conspiracy, criminal trespass, assault, criminal intimidation, and theft." She tok say di court remand am pending di fulfilment of im bail conditions. Wia dis foto come from, Instagram/@princenednwoko Di Nollywood actress post one video on Instagram on Friday morning wia she dey cry ova di detention of her brother, Sammy West by di Nigeria Police Force (NPF). Regina demand ansas to why police neva gree to release her broda from dia custody. "I try, I feel say I dey go crazy and I dey lose my mind, and E no make any sense. I dey cry presently in front of evri body. Please, wetin I dey beg for? I no know," she tok. "Una tink say e dey easy to dey wake up and seeing one tin about my broda online? Today, I go hear some good news say dem go release am, and tomorrow, I go hear anoda tin. Like, wedtin be di problem? I don try, but I go, go back." For anoda post on Saturday, she tok say na true say she dey take drugs but say Ned Nwoko bin like am like dat. For notes app style post on Instagram, di actress write say, "you say you wan make I go rehab, but na you be di same Ned wey always want make I high, bicos for your words, I dey 'sexier' wen I dey high". She also reveal some oda pipo for oga Ned life wey allegedly dey do drugs too, she say, "why you no also tell dem say all your wives and ex wives dey on drugs? And you fit dey kind enough to tell dem why e be so?" For di post she also add accuse of alleged sexual assault on top di mata as well as accuse of underage marriage. Wia dis foto come from, instagram/@regina.daniels For 18 October, Regina Daniels post one video wey go viral wia she accuse her husband say im send im "thugs" make dem attack her. Regina Daniels dey cry inside di video while di pipo wey dey around her dey try to console her, she begin dey shout say she no fit tolerate di violence by her husband again. "For Ned Nwoko house, I be notin, but for my house, I be queen. Not again, I no fit stand di violence, e too much," she tok. By dat Sunday, 19 October, Oga Nwoko comot wit evidence against di accuse as e show video wey contain images of cracked windows, table wey di glass don break and damaged car. E allege say im wife, Regina dey violent and she don hit three staff and destroy properties inside for no reason. "Regina na di violent one here, slapping and hitting three staff in di past 48 hours and destroying property, including cars and windows, for no just cause. "Di truth be say, I don set clear condition for her to accept rehab for Asokoro or outside Nigeria especially Jordan wia she no go get access to drugs." For di statement, di 64-year-old senator, tok say im no dey violent towards any of im wife but Regina bin move comot from house becos she wan get unrestricted access. "Regina no always like dis. Her current battle wit drugs and alcohol abuse na di root of our problem," e tok. "She must continue her rehabilitation program, or I fear for her life and safety. "Now she don move to place wia she get unrestricted access to drugs. I get oda wives, and none go ever accuse me of violence." Few days ago, Regina accuse police of arresting her broda ontop di mata. But tins take anoda turn on Wednesday wen she publicly address clearly some of di issues. "Finally some pipo go get video now wey dem go fit take mock me... My entire focus right now na to know wia my broda dey. Wia Sammy dey Ned!!!" Regina also accuse di "highest authorities for di police force, or if not di highest wey say dia hands dey tied" she write. "I no regret anytin. Na only me carry my leg enta but dis na di route wey I dey meant to take, no be my final destination!!" Senator Ned bin celebrate dia six years togeda dis year for 27 March as di union don born two boys.

articles.input: How jihadists use fuel blockade bring Mali to standstill
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, AFP/Getty For Bamako, Mali capital city, di normal sound of car engine and horn don turn to sound of pipo wey dey waka for road. Residents dey push dia motorbike wey fuel don finish for inside through di dusty road, dem dey vex becos di fuel blockade don paralyze Mali for more dan two months. Di jihadist group Jama'at Nusrat al-Islam wal-Muslimin (JNIM), wey dey linked wit al-Qaeda, dey attack fuel tankers wey dey bring petrol enter Mali. Dem don kidnap drivers and burn more dan 100 trucks wey dey come Bamako. Life don hard for plenty Mali pipo, school and university don close, food price don rise, and hospital dey struggle wit light wahala. Di fuel shortage don even make foreign kontris worry. US don tell Americans make dem no travel go Mali, and France don advise im citizens make dem comot from di kontri quick. One picture wey show how serious di mata be na di long fuel queue wey dey outside almost every petrol station. "We dey here dey wait for fuel, and we don dey here for more dan four days now," na wetin Sidi Djiré, one taxi driver wey dey wait for petrol station for Bamako, tell BBC. Mr Djiré tok say e dey hope say Mali military govment go solve di wahala quick, bicos "whether you be trader or teacher, everybody work don suffer." For some petrol station inside Bamako, motorists dey meet one small paper wey get just three frustrating words "no fuel today." Plenty delivery and bus drivers don begin sleep for filling station, just to be among di first pipo to buy fuel wen e finally land. As transport fare don triple for some part of Bamako, some passengers don abandon bus completely, dem dey trek long distance go work. For Baco Djicoroni market, one customer, Assitan Diarra, tok say food price don triple. "Life hard well well now. But wetin we fit do? We dey war. We dey pray make God bring peace and relief for our kontri," Ms Diarra tok. "Di goods wey we dey get before easily no dey easy again bicos transport no dey for pipo wey dey sell food, fuel shortage don make am hard to get supply" na wetin Amadou Traoré tok. Wetin dey hapun for Mali fuel wahala no be ordinary, e look like well-planned move. Wen di military junta take power five years ago, plenty pipo support dem bicos dem promise to solve di security crisis wey start from northern rebellion before Islamist militants like JNIM take over. But instead of peace, di Islamist wahala don worse, especially for di north and east, wey don turn areas wey govment no fit control again. Over di past year, JNIM don increase attacks, and di fuel blockade now show say dem don change strategy from small ambush to economic warfare. Mali no get sea na landlocked kontri, so dem dey depend on fuel wey dey come from Senegal and Ivory Coast. Now wey jihadists don block di roads, transport, light, and logistics don nearly stop. Hospitals dey suffer sake of diesel no dey to power generator, and e don begin affect emergency services. For Kalaban Coro Health Centre, Dr Issa Guido tell BBC say, "our workers suppose report to duty early, but now, e hard for dem to even get fuel to come work." Teachers and students too no fit travel, and dat one make schools and universities close for two weeks. Even wen dem reopen, some rural teachers still no fit show up. Di kasala don affect millions of pipo for Mali, and pipo don start to dey ask questions. To reduce di tension, govment don send army trucks to escort fuel tankers from border to Bamako, but some convoys still come under attack. Reports say Mali govment don also sign emergency fuel deal wit Russia, to import refined fuel and get technical help to protect transport routes. Even though officials dey talk say evritin dey under control, critics still accuse di junta say dem no dey plan ahead, dem just dey react to every new crisis. Wia dis foto come from, AFP/Getty Images Di fuel shortage don turn double wahala for Mali govment wey Colonel Assimi Goïta dey lead. One side of di mata be say di regime fit use am show say dem be victim of jihadism, to gada national support and justify tighter security control. But di oda side be say, di fuel blockade don expose how weak di govment don become outside Bamako, and e don make pipo begin lose confidence for di same junta wey promise to end jihadist wahala. Di fuel shortage don also make Mali depend more on Russia. Since French and UN soldiers comot, Russian mercenary groups don dey support Col Goïta govment, and now, di situation fit push Mali deeper inside Moscow influence, wey fit make Western kontris withdraw aid and investment. Relations wit di US and European Union no dey strong, while France relationship don nearly cut finish. But for ordinary Mali pipo, all dis geopolitics no mean anytin wen food don cost and pipo no fit even go work. Amidou Diallo, one welder wey dey waka up and down to find fuel for im generator, tell BBC say di situation fit lead to more crime and bad security. "We dey face crisis," e tok. "If e continue like dis, oda problems fit rise and dat one fit give pipo dangerous ideas."
articles.title: How jihadists use fuel blockade bring Mali to standstill

articles.input: Crystal Palace striker Eddie Nketiah speak on rumours to switch to Ghana from England
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Eddie Nketiah say "di future go take care of itsef" as rumour dey fly around say di Crystal Palace striker fit switch allegiance from England to Ghana ahead of di 2026 Fifa World Cup. Anoda player wey rumour dey spread say e fit switch also be Nottingham Forest winger Callum Hudson-Odoi. Dis gist begin to spread wey pipo dey debate over di mata since di Black Stars qualify for di World Cup for Canada, Mexico and the United States. Nketiah be di record goal scorer for di England U-21 team wit 16 goals wey e only play for di senior national team only once for one friendly between England and Australia for October 2023. Under Fifa rules wey dem introduce in 2020, player fit switch nationality if dem no play more dan three competitive games at di senior level bifor dem chop 21 years or dem dey involved for major championship like di World Cup or Africa cup of nations. "At di moment, I just dey enjoy my football wit Crystal Palace – dat be my main focus," Nketiah tok wen BBC Sport Africa ask am about di rumours wey dey fly around. "I be Ghanaian and I no fit deny dat. I dey proud of my roots and wia I come from. "I dey sure say di future go take care itsef and wetin go be, go be." Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Dem born Nketiah for Lewisham, south London to Ghanaian parents wia e begin im youth career for Chelsea bifor e move to Arsenal. E play im first game for Arsenal wen e be 18 years for September 2017 – e continue to score 38 goals in 168 games bifor e move to Crystal Palace in August 2024 for £30m. Di Ghana football association in di past approach Nketiah, as dem dey pursue diaspora talent. Anoda player wey di association approach, be Chelsea U-21 defender Joshua Acheampong. Ghana coach Otto Addo tok say some players wey refuse to agree in di past, now change dia mind since di World Cup dey around di corner. Even say Nketiah no rule out di switch, e deny any recent contact by di GFA. "Dem no call me recently, so my focus dey on playing well every week to help my team to win trophies," e tok. "If I dey play well, wey I dey do di right tins, naturally, di international future go sort itsef wen di time reach say make I make decision.' Ghana coach Otto Addo say dem go treat di mata about players wey neva play for di qualifiers but wan go di World Cup on "case by case' basis. For one interview wit 3sports last month, di coach tok say: "I tink Ghana need to have some pride as a kontri. We need to check di commitment of each player, sake of di team dey united at dis moment wey I no wan scata am." Even though di kontri Sports Minister Kofi Adams say di technical team and di coach get di final say about who dem go select for di World Cup, di situation dey confuse some Black Stars supporters. "Di tin for Ghana be say, dem for no call players wey no accept to be part of di Black Stars to qualify for di World cup,' sports journalists Muftawu Abdulai tell BBC Sport Africa. "In fact, even some parliamentarians tok dis same mata. If you tok to fans, dem describe dis players wey now dey hustle to play for Ghana afta dem reject us in di past, say dem be opportunistic." Afta Nketia and Hudson-Odoi, Jayden Addai wey be winger for Como and Netherlands youth international, also dey linked to play for Ghana. Apart from Chelsea player Acheampong, teammate Tyrique George be anoda England youth player wey fit represent Ghana if e choose to switch – sometin wey oda high profile players like Antoine Semenyo, Tariq Lamptey and Inaki Williams do. "E reach some time, di ex-president of Ghana, Nana Akufo-Addo even try to personally involve to try to convince Hudson-Odoi; GFA committee pipo also chook mouth for dis mata, dem say make dem no call dis players." Wia dis foto come from, BOA AWARDS/TRINITY MEDIA Even though Nketiah get football history wit England youth teams, e get connection to Ghana through charity work, wey make am collect award last month for di Best of Africa Awards for London. "I return to Ghana last summer wey I do plenty work there also I dey try to do more for di community for di youth clubs for di local area where I comot from," di striker explain. Di Nketiah Foundation dey support children wey dey live wit disability and oda pipo for Ghana – last year, dem organise football tournament for there. "I feel say God bless me wit dis ability and opportunities," e add. As di debate online dey only about di possible switch to Ghana, e believe say e dey beta to close eye and ear for dat debate. "I try to stay away from social media, plenty tins dey there wey be negative and positive, so I try to dey level-headed."
articles.title: Crystal Palace striker Eddie Nketiah speak on rumours to switch to Ghana from England

articles.input: 'Dem dey kill and chase Christians for Nigeria' - Nicki Minaj defend Trump genocide claim for UN
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, ANGELA WEISS/AFP via Getty Images Nicki Minaj - di US-based, multi-million-selling Trinidadian rapper - don publicly back President Donald Trump allegations say  Christians dey face persecution for Nigeria. "In Nigeria, Christians dey targeted," Minaj tok on Tuesday for one UN event organised by di US, come add say "Churches dey burn, families don tear finish … simply becos of how dem pray." Dis dey follow recent threats by Trump to send troops to Nigeria "guns a-blazing" if di govment "kontinu to allow di killing of Christians". But di Nigerian presidency say di widespread violence wey for long don dey worry di West African nation dey affect evribodi, regardless of background or belief. Minaj, wey her real name na Onika Tanya Maraj-Petty, say calling for di protection of Christians in Nigeria "no dey about taking sides or dividing pipo,"but na about "uniting humanity". "Dis na about standing up in di face of injustice. Na about wetin I always stand for," she add as she stand wit di US ambassador to di UN, Mike Waltz. Di 42-year-old rapper thank Trump as e "prioritize dis issue and for im leadership". She describe Nigeria as "a beautiful nation with deep faith traditions" and even acknowledge di "beautiful Barbz" - wey be her fans - for di West African country. End of Di one wey oda users dey read well well Waltz thank di rapper as she "use her massive platform to spotlight di atrocities against Christians in Nigeria". For months, right-wing campaigners and politicians for Washington don dey allege say Islamist militants dey systematically target Christians in Nigeria. Deadly disputes often dey over vital resources like land and water or dey fueled by inter-ethnic tensions, rather than religion, some analysts tok. Nigeria govment no deny say deadly violence dey di kontri. But say, "Terrorists dey attack evri pesin wey reject dia murderous ideology - Muslims, Christians and those of no faith alike". Minaj previously name-check her fanbase, pipo sabi as di "Barbz", as a reason for her intervention, come tok online say: "di Barbz & I no go stand down in di face of injustice. We get our influence by God. Bigger purpose must dey." Last year she publicly reveal say despite moving from her native Trinidad to New York for early age, she still neva get US citizenship. Her appearance for di UN on Tuesday na her highest-profile political intervention to date. She make headlines during di pandemic for sharing disinformation about side-effects of di Covid vaccine - claiming say wen a friend of her cousin bin get di jab, e cause im testicles to swell up and im come dey impotent. "Im friend bin dey weeks away from getting married, now di girl don cancel di wedding," Minaj write online. Her comments bin dey criticised by UK chief medical officer at di time, and di then-Prime Minister Boris Johnson also comment with joke say: "I no dey as familiar with di works of Nicki Minaj as I probably suppose dey." In recent months, her years-long quarrel wit fellow New York rapper Cardi B escalate as dem insult dia sef about each oda careers and family members.
articles.title: 'Dem dey kill and chase Christians for Nigeria' - Nicki Minaj defend Trump genocide claim for UN

articles.input: Five easy food to swap to if you wan improve your gut health - Expert
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, BBC and Getty Scroll through social media or check supermarket and you go see plenti products wey claim to improve your gut health. E be like say everybody dey tok about looking after dia microbiome - wey be di trillions of tiny organisms wey dey live inside our digestive system – wey dey influence everything from digestion and immunity to mood and sleep. Gut health na all about having di right mix of bacteria and enough fibre-rich food to keep everytin moving and to make your body feel im best. Di key to keeping di microbes happy na to feed dem di right food and e dey easier dan you tink to maintain a healthy gut. Instead of going for dat expensive probiotic shot or snack, expert - Dr Xand - recommend making dis five easy food swap to give your gut a boost. Of course many oda foods dey wey you fit consume to improve your gut health like drinking kombucha or eating fermented food such as kimchi or sauerkraut, but e no dey necessary to focus on dat too much. Di most important tin for your gut and overall health na eating a range of whole foods wey dey rich in fibre like fruits and vegetables. And wen e come to supplements and probiotics, Dr Xand advice na di same - no evidence dey say e go do you any good and products like probiotic drinks and powders wey dey promise miraculous results fit cost you hundreds of pounds wey di expert say e see as a waste of money. Additional reporting by Yasmin Rufo
articles.title: Five easy food to swap to if you wan improve your gut health - Expert
