articles.input: Six pipo die odas injure for Ghana military recruitment crush
articles.output: One crush during military recruitment exercise for Ghana don kill at least six pipo and injure odas. Di incident hapun for di El-Wak sports stadium near di military camp wia thousands of young pipo bin gada for di recruitment exercise on Wednesday. Videos for social media videos on Wednesday bin show long queues for street as pipo bin turn out as early as 2:00am to form di line for di recruitment. Di Ghana Armed Forces inside one statement wey confam di incident tok say di pipo wey injure dey receive treatment for di 37 military hospital. "Our first investigation show say di plenty numbers of applicants wey wan enter di military choke for di El-Wak stadium, wey dem breach security protocol to rush inside di gate ahead of di exercise around 6 AM. Medical teams dey work hard to stabilise those wey dey affected, wey and we dey make arrangement to inform di families of those wey die." Di recruitment exercise still dey go on as di service tok say dem dey begin di documentation and body selection exercise from 12-13 November for di various screening centres. Ghana president John Mahama visit di victims for di 37 military hospital togeda wit some top govment officials. He direct say make di military halt di recruitment process until further notice. Opposition and oda civil society groups dey call for investigation into di tragedy. Di acting defense minister and his deputy and di minister for govment communication join di president for di visit. Commander for di 37 military hospital Brigadier General Evelyn Vivian Abraham-Kwabiah tok journalists say "di casualties in total be 28 pipo, six die, five odas dey critical and 12 odas dey fairly critical wey di rest dey stable and out of danger." She tok say dem go provide healthcare for di victims wey dem carry go di hospital. articles.input: Full list of kontris wey don qualify for di 2026 Fifa World Cup and all you need to know
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, AFP via Getty Images Di 2026 Fifa World Cup go host 48 teams for di first time and all di kontris wey qualify don dey sabi diasef. Na di first time wey di World Cup tournament go dey hosted by three different nations be dis - di tournament go take place for di United States, Canada and Mexico. Some kontris across Africa, Europe, Asia, North America and many odas don sabi dia place for di World Cup and na preparation remain. For instance, England seal dia place for di 2026 World Cup wen Thomas Tuchel side defeat Latvia to qualify wit just two games to spare. Di likes of Ghana, South Africa and Cape Verde don qualify from Africa. While on di oda hand, some countries go still gatz wait for di play-offs. Di opening match of di Fifa World Cup go take place for 11 June 2026 for Mexico City, while di final go take  place for 19 July for New Jersey. Di tournament go expand to 48 teams for di first time and sake of dat, e go last for record 39 days. Di tournament don double for size since di last time di tournament hold for di United States, wen na 24 teams bin compete for di  trophy for 1994. Di new format go feature 12 four-team groups and extra knockout round - round of 32. Di general admission tickets for di World Cup go split into four categories, wit matches for USA costing between $560 (£417) and $2,235 (£1,662). Di cheapest ticket for di 2026 World Cup final go cost up to $2,030 (£1,510), and di most expensive go be $6,000 (£4,462). England, Ghana and Brazil secured dia place for di World Cup tournament, along wit 25 oda teams. Argentina, di world champions also dey among dose wey don qualify but e still get 20 spots to fill. Di kontris wey don alreadi secure dia spot na: Hosts: Canada, Mexico, United States. Africa: Algeria, Cape Verde, Egypt, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Morocco, Senegal, South Africa, Tunisia Asia: Australia, Iran, Japan, Jordan, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, South Korea, Uzbekistan. South America: Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Paraguay, Uruguay. Of all of dis countries, three bin qualify for di World Cup for di first time for dia history- di kontris na Cape Verde, Jordan and Uzbekistan. One country wey dem call Suriname and Curiacao also dey hopeful to join di list of World Cup teams for di first time. Some teams wey go win for di intercontinental play-off tournament wey go feature di winner of di African playoff go face di winners from Bolivia, New Caledonia and two teams from Central America, and one from Asia. Na afta dem don play all di play-offs bifor di 48 teams go complete. Di draw for di Fifa World Cup group stage go hold for Friday, 5 December, and e go take place for John F Kennedy Centre for di Performing Arts for Washington DC. Wia dis foto come from, AFP via Getty Images Sixteen cities go host games during next Fifa World Cup - 11 cities for di United States, three for Mexico and two for Canada. Dis na di 2026 World Cup host cities: USA: Atlanta, Boston, Dallas, Houston, Kansas City, Los Angeles, Miami, New York/New Jersey, Philadelphia, San Francisco and Seattle. Mexico: Guadalajara, Mexico City and Monterrey.
articles.title: Full list of kontris wey don qualify for di 2026 Fifa World Cup and all you need to know

articles.input: Why to dey brush your teeth two times a day fit no always be best practice
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images All of us tink say we sabi brush our teeth – we tink say na to brush am for morning and night, rinse our mouth wit water plus maybe one minty mouthwash for good measure. But according to dental experts, even di pesin wey sabi brush pass fit dey make small-small mistakes wey fit affect dia teeth. Dr Praveen Sharma, from di school of dentistry for di University of Birmingham, tok say half of adults go get gum disease at some point and di early sign na bleeding gums. "If your gums dey bleed or dey swell, dat na sign say you suppose dey brush well-well," e tok. Apart from regular dentist visits, e say four tins dey wey many of us dey do wrong, wey if we fit change, go improve di health of our teeth. To dey brush two times a day na one of di greatest dental commandments – and na wetin NHS recommend. But Dr Sharma say di real key na quality, no be quantity. "If you fit find time, den yes, two times a day," e tok. "But e beta to brush well-well once a day, pass make you brush two times and no do am well. If you dey brush once a day, e advice say make e be for evening and make sure you also use dental floss to comot all di nyamayama and food wey hide inside teeth wey toothbrush no go fit remove. Although, nobody like to dey floss but Dr Sharma say using interdental brushes, particularly rubber ones, fit make am dey easier and less painful. Wen e come to di method, each tooth get outer, biting and inner surface and you gatz brush wit all three. Dr Sharma advise small circular motions ova each surface without applying too much pressure. E also advice pipo to pay particular attention to di junction between di tooth and gum as dat na wia gum disease dey start from. Dr Xand tok say e dey important to "focus on di sensation of di bristles" and approach tooth brushing mindfully. Many pipo dey brush dia teeth afta dem chop finish, but dat fit no dey right. "Di best tin na to brush bifor breakfast," Dr Sharma tok. "You no wan do am afta something acidic. "If you brush afta you chop, den you go need leave some space between eating and brushing." Dat na bicos acids from foods and drinks, especially fruit juice or coffee, fit soften tooth enamel and to brush immediately afta you chop fit affect am. Dr Chris suggest rinsing your mouth wit water afta you chop finish to get clear off some acid and den wait at least 30 minutes if you wish to brush afta breakfast. If you dey always rinse and gargle your mouth afta you brush, you go need tink am again. "You fit spit out di paste but no rinse," Dr Sharma advise. Rinsing your mouth go wash away di concentrated fluoride for di remaining toothpaste. E simply mean spitting out di excess toothpaste and leaving di thin layer of fluoride behind to continue protecting your teeth. Dr Sharma, say e no really mata which brand you choose, as long as e contain one key ingredient. "As long as your toothpaste get fluoride, e no make much difference," e tok, e add say im dey like buy di one wey dey cheaper or di one wey dey free. Fluoride dey help protect di enamel and prevent decay, and dat na wetin really count. However, your dentist fit recommend specific toothpastes to use if you suffer from issues like sensitive gums. Dr Sharma say you need to find time to brush properly. "You no wan to dey brush your teeth or clean your teeth while you dey do oda tins," e tok. Ideally, you go need to dey stand in front of your mirror and focus properly. Many right-handed pipo unconsciously dey brush dia left side longer, and left-handed pipo dey brush dia right side longer, wey fit lead to more inflammation on di side wey dey receive less attention. Be aware of which hand you dey use brush and consciously try to brush both sides equally and carefully.
articles.title: Why to dey brush your teeth two times a day fit no always be best practice

articles.input: Six tins we learn as Ghana qualify for dia fifth World Cup
articles.output: Di celebrations by di Blackstars players and fans on Sunday last till late for night afta Ghana qualify for di 2026 World Cup wey go happen for USA, Canada and Mexico. Ghana secure one of di nine automatic spots as winners of Group I, afta di last match day wit a slim 1-0 win vs Comoros. Aside di excitement and vibes, fans and players believe say dem fit prove a point afta di kontri fail to qualify for di 2025 Afcon – di first time in 21 years. For some of di fans and experts, dat failure go kontinu to haunt di team, but dis World Cup be chance to make a statement. Dis be some of di tins we learn as Ghana qualify for di Mundial. For a long time, fans and experts dey fire di Blackstars say dem no dey score goals in games. Under previous coaches, Ghana fit score one goal each game and defend. But tins dey change wit di quality of players wey dey dis squad. Ghana be one of six teams to score 20 goals or more (23 goals) for di qualifiers. Dem score nine goals vs Central African Republic (home and away) and six goals vs Chad. Dem also score four goals vs Madagascar. In all dem win eight games wey dem lose one and draw one to get 25 points in total. Wit di way dem dey score goals, di fans hope say tins go Kontinu like dat into di world cup proper. Dis be di fifth time Ghana dey qualify for di world cup since dem first reach di Mundial in 2006. In dat year dem advance to di second round bifor Brazil defeat dem 3-0 to boot  dem out. In 2010, Ghana reach di quarterfinal but dem miss out on di semis through penalties vs Uruguay afta Luiz Suarez controversial handball deny Ghana di winning goal in extra time. Asamoah Gyan miss di penalty wey follow bifor Uruguay comot Ghana for di shootout. Dat be Ghana highest finish, since dem comot for group stage for 2014 in Brazil and 2022 in Qatar. Di Blackstars fail to qualify in 2018 for Russia. "Wit dis qualification, we go go far dis time, we get all di quality players to do well for dis tournament," one fan Rafael Ansong tok BBC News Pidgin for di stadium afta di game Di 34-year-old Leicester City striker be di captain of di team, afta im brother Andre Ayew comot di team. Ayew carry di Blackstars on his shoulders for dis qualifiers wey he lead by example wit 14 goal contributions ( 7 goals, 7 assists). As tins stand he dey lead for di Caf World Cup qualifiers goal contribution chart – same category wit Mohammed Salah - 12 goal contributions (9 goals, 3 assists). Algeria forward Mohammed Amoura get 12 goal contributions (8 goals, 4 assists), Denis Bouanga of Gabon also get 10 goal contributions. Ghana go hope say dia captain go inspire di team to perform for di World Cup proper for USA, Mexico and Canada. Coach Otto Addo – di man under pressure afta he fail to qualify Ghana for di 2025 Afcon. Fans and football experts put pressure at di time for di football association to sack am. But di GFA back di Dortmund-trained coach and player scout on im second-coming to coach di team. Even tho di Afcon qualifiers be horrible, di World Cup qualifiers provide some fine stats for di former Blackstars player. In 2006, Otto Addo reach di tournament wit di Blackstars as a player. In 2022, he qualify di team to play di World Cup for Qatar as coach. Dis be di third time he dey reach di competition; di second time as coach. Even afta getting 25 points from 10 games to win dia group, some fans still figure say Otto Addo no reach dat level yet. Ghana sports minister Kofi Adams say "di coach be lucky. E no mean say he no fit improve. I also no fit talk say he be incompetent, but I no dey satisfied." Di minister tok local media network Joynews say "concerns still dey, we qualify but sometimes we dey on di edge of our seats for some of di games, tins for improve." Di football association say dem dey back dia man – from now till di World Cup next year, many tins fit happen. Ghana president John Mahama say make dem give di coach space to work. Inside one interview wit Sporty FM, President Mahama tok say "make we give di management and technical team some peace. I know say we be 33 million coaches for Ghana but make we keep our coaching to ourselves, and make di coach do his job." Many of di players for di team dey shine for dia clubs for Europe and America. Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth currently dey on fire for di Premier League – wit six goals and three assists so far. But in di Ghana jersey, Semenyo score only three goals and one assist from 27 games. He come under pressure from fans to show some of di form wey he get for England. Same wit Inaki Williams, di captain of Athletic Club wey dey struggle anytime he play for Ghana. Inaki be one of di biggest stars for Spain wia he score 100 goals in 481 official games for Athletic Club. Since im debut, he only score two goals – against Madagascar in 2023 and Central African Republic in June 2024. Mohammed Kudus score di only goal in di final home game against Comoros – bifor dat, di Tottenham Hotspurs score one wit four assists for his new club for England. But he score two goals against Egypt for di 2023 Afcon for Ivory Coast. Leicester City forward Abdul Fatawu Issahaku, LA Galaxy forward Joseph Paintsil, Thomas Brandon-Asante and di odas gat to raise dia game to push Ghana forward. Wia dis foto come from, ISSOUF SANOGO/AFP VIA GETTY Bifor now wen di players no dey deliver wey di team dey lose games – di fans vex wey dem decide not to go to di stadium to watch games. Around dat time, tins scatter, experts say di football association dey in tatters and players no dey give 100% for di national team like dem dey show for dia clubs. Even some fans boycott di team indefinitely – wey advocacy groups put pressure for reforms for di football association and di management of di team. Odas also tok say make di management focus on local base players and groom dem to di national team if di foreign-base players no dey pull dia weight for di Blackstars jersey. For di last home game vs Mali wey Ghana win 1-0, ova 15,000 fans go di stadium to watch di game afta di national sports authority block one area for maintenance. But for di final game vs Comoros on Sunday, more dan 30,000 fans go di stadium to watch di game wey dem chant di players throughout di game. Wia dis foto come from, JACQUES FEENEY/OFFSIDE VIA GETTY Di sports authority print 35,000 tickets – VIP, VVIP, Centre line, popular stands, evri wia full for dis last game. Afta di game, di team thank di supporters say dem full di stadium. "We see your energy, your passion, and support throughout dis qualifiers," di Blackstars team tok inside one statement.
articles.title: Six tins we learn as Ghana qualify for dia fifth World Cup

articles.input: Wetin to know about di 'mystery' of Palestinians wey full inside plane wey enta South Africa
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Gift of the Givers South African President Cyril Ramaphosa don tok say dem go do investigation into di "mysterious" arrival of one chartered plane wey dey carry 153 Palestinians from Gaza into di kontri. Di group arrive for OR Tambo International Airport but dem initially refuse dem entry and dem dey stranded for di plane for more dan 10 hours. Local authorities say di group "no get di customary departure stamps for dia passports." Dem eventually allow most of dem into di kontri afta intervention from a local charity and becos di govment "empathy [and] compassion", Ramaphosa say. Di circumstances wey surround dia departure from Gaza and travel to South Africa still remain unclear. South Africa don maintain strong support for di Palestinian throughout di war between Hamas and Israel for Gaza. Ramaphosa say di group "somehow mysteriously dey inside plane wey pass by Nairobi" and fly to South Africa, according to reports by di News24 site. Israeli military body Cogat, wey dey control Gaza crossings, tok for dia statement say "di residents comot from di Gaza Strip afta Cogat receive approval from third country to receive dem." E no specify di kontri. End of Di one wey oda users dey read well well According to di Palestinian embassy for South Africa, di group bin comot from Israel Ramon Airport and fly to di country through di Kenyan capital, Nairobi, "without any prior note or coordination". "One unregistered and misleading organization don cheat di tragic humanitarian conditions of our pipo for Gaza, deceive families, collect money from dem, and facilitate dia travel for irregular and irresponsible manner". Of di 153, 23 bin manage to fly on to oda destinations, wit 130 wey dem admit into di country, South African authorities say. Ramaphosa, wen e tok during one event for Johannesburg, e say di home affairs minister bin inform am of di crisis. In response, di president say "we no fit turn dem back", according to News24. "Even though dem no get di necessary documents and papers, dis na pipo from a strife-torn, a war-torn country." Di president also tell reporters say di South African govment go carry out "proper evaluation" of di mata and update di public on "wetin dey happun and how dis mata come to be wia e dey", according to public broadcaster SABC. Home Affairs Minister Leon Schreiber say di while Palestinian passport-holders qualify for 90-day visa-exempt access to South Africa, di lack of departure stamps, return tickets or accommodation addresses for some of di travellers documentation result in di initial refusal to let dem into di kontri. Once dem establish say di absence of dis information "no mean say di travellers wish to apply for asylum" and dem confam dia accommodation, dem grant dem entry. "All of di travellers dey in possession of valid passports and, at present, none of dem have don apply for asylum," e say. South African charity Gift of di Givers say e go provide di group wit accommodation for di kontri. Civil societies for South Africa don call for investigations into di conditions di Palestinians bin comot from Gaza and di exact route of di aircraft. One of di Palestinians wey speak to local eNCA TV express im relief to dey for South Africa, e describe am as a kontri of "peace, laws and justice". "We come from Gaza wia we face death on daily basis. We survive war of two years and we dey lucky to dey here," one man wey run wit im wife and two children say. Gift of di Givers don call for Ramaphosa to investigate di home affairs ministry and border authority for di "humiliation wey dem cause" di Palestinians. Di organisation founder Dr Imtiaz Sooliman say dis treatment include being forced to wait for hours on di tarmac for di airport, dem deny dem food provided by di group and "using evri excuse for di book to prevent dis passengers make dem no come down from di plane." South Africa dey highly critical of Israel military operation for Gaza. Di kontri sympathy for di Palestinian fight for an independent state go back decades, particularly di early 1990s wen anti-apartheid icon Nelson Mandela pledge support for di Palestinian cause. Large pro-Palestinian march don hold around South Africa since di conflict begin. Smaller pro-Israel marches and rallies don hold for di kontri, wey dey host di largest Jewish community for sub-Saharan Africa. For 2023, di South African govment filed case against Israel wit di International Court of Justice, accusing dem of genocide for Gaza. Israel don strongly reject di South African claim, as e call am "baseless".
articles.title: Wetin to know about di 'mystery' of Palestinians wey full inside plane wey enta South Africa

articles.input: Di proposed UK asylum system reforms wey Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood announce
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, PA Media United Kingdom Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood don unveil wetin dem dey reason to be di biggest changes to tackle illegal migration "for modern times". Di package, follow di stricter approach wey di Denmark centre-left govment bring wey make refugee status temporary. UK don narrow di appeal process and threaten visa bans on countries wey block return attempt of dia nationals. Pipo wey UK grant asylum go only dey allowed to stay for di country temporarily, dem go dey review dia status every 30 months. Dis one mean say, dem go fit return pipo go dia home country if dem see say e dey "safe". Dis scheme na di same wit di approach for Denmark, wia refugees get two-year permit and must reapply wen e expire. Refugees go also need to be resident for UK for 20 years bifor dem go fit apply for permanent residence or indefinite leave to remain – dis one go up from di current five years. Di govment go also create one new "work and study" visa route and encourage refugees to find employment or begin education in order to switch enta dis route and earn settlement more quickly. Only those wey dey dis work and study route go fit sponsor family members to join dem for UK. Di home secretary dey also plan to end di process wey dey allow multiple appeals for di cases of asylum cases and replace am wit one single, consolidated appeal wia dem must raise all grounds once. Dem go create one new independent appeals body, staffed by trained adjudicators and supported by early legal advice. To do dis, di govment go introduce one law wey go change how dem dey apply for right to family life under Article 8 of di European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) for migration court cases. Only those wey get immediate relatives, like children or parents, go fit remain for UK for future. Dem go remove foreign offenders and pipo wey enta di country illegally. Di govment go also narrow di application of Article 3 of di ECHR, wey ban inhuman or degrading treatment. Ministers say di current interpretation of di law dey allow multiple appeals against refusals for asylum – wey include serious criminals wey don block dia deportation sake of healthcare issues. Dem go tighten di Modern Slavery Act to stop last minute trafficking claims wey dem dey use stop removals by requiring asylum seekers to disclose all relevant information early. Dem go treat any information wey dey disclosed later as less credible. Mahmood go cancel di legal duty to provide asylum seekers wit support, and dat go end guaranteed housing and weekly pay. Support go still dey available for "those wey dey very helpless" but dem no go support pipo wey get permission to work but no gree work, and from pipo wey break di law or disobey removal directions. Dem go also deny support for those wey "deliberately make themselves destitute". Asylum seekers wey get assets go dey required to contribute to di cost of dia accommodation. Dis one dey similar to Denmark approach wia asylum seekers must use dia savings to pay for dia accommodation and authorities fit seize dia assets for border. UK Home Office sources don rule out seizing sentimental items like wedding rings, but Home Office Minister Alex Norris don suggest say cars and e-bikes fit dey targeted. Di govment bin previously promise to end di use of hotels to hold asylum seekers by 2029, official figures show say e cost di govment £5.77m per day last year. Di govment also dey plan to end di current system wia families wey dem deny dia asylum claims still dey receive housing and financial support until dia youngest child turn 18. Ministers say di current system don create one kain encouragement to remain for di UK without status. Instead, dem go offer families financial assistance to return voluntarily, but if dem refuse, enforced removal go follow. Alongside tightening access to refugee status, UK go create new legal routes to di di country, wit annual cap on numbers. Under di changes, volunteers and community groups go fit sponsor individual refugees, wey be like di "Homes for Ukraine" scheme wia Britons bin host Ukrainians wey bin dey run from war. Govment go also expand di work of di Displaced Talent Mobility pilot, wey dem set up for 2021, to encourage businesses to sponsor at-risk pipo from around di world to come UK to help fill skills gaps. Di home secretary go set annual cap on arrivals via dis routes, based on local capacity. But those wey dey come di country on legal routes go be on a streamlined ten-year route to settlement. Di Home Secretary say UK go apply Visa penalties to countries wey fail to co-operate wit di returns policies, wey include one "emergency brake" on visas for countries wit high asylum claims until dem take back dia citizens wey dey for UK illegally. UK don already identify three African countries wey dem get plans to penalise if dia govments no improve co-operation on removals. Di govments of Angola, Namibia plus Democratic Republic of Congo get one month to start co-operating before dem impose sanctions, Home Office tok on Monday. Di govment dey also plan to roll out new technologies to strengthen enforcement. Trials of AI-driven technology to verify di age of asylum seekers, particularly those wey dey claim to be children. Alongside dis, di govment dey plan to introduce one digital ID by di end of Parliament. Dis go allow more accurate right-to-work checks by employers and e go make am harder for illegal workers to use fraudulent documents, di govment argue.
articles.title: Di proposed UK asylum system reforms wey Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood announce

articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Cristiano Ronaldo don become football first billionaire player, according to financial information and media firm Bloomberg. Di valuation bin take into account career earnings, investments and endorsements and dem say Ronaldo net worth na $1.4bn (£1.04bn). Im contract suppose end for June 2025 but e sign one new two-year deal – wey reportedly worth more dan $400m (£298m) – wey go keep am for di club beyond im 42nd birthday. Argentina and Inter Miami forward Lionel Messi, wey play against Ronaldo for many years during dia time for Spain, earn more dan $600m (£447m) in pre-tax salary during im career, according to Bloomberg. Dat include $20m (£15m) in guaranteed annual pay since 2023, wey be about 10% of Ronaldo income during di same period. Wen e retire, 38-year-old Messi dey set to get a stake in Inter Miami.

articles.input: Kwanta between Senator Ned Nwoko and Regina Daniels – wetin we know
articles.output: Ned Nwoko don break im silence ova di allegations say e dey abuse im wife, Nollywood actress Regina Daniels. Di Nigerian lawmaker wey dey represent Delta north senatorial district tok say im no dey abusive instead na im wife dey addicted to hard drugs and alcohol, claim wey Regina neva respond to. Oga Nwoko for social media post allege say im wife dey battle drugs and alcohol abuse and e wan make she kontinu her rehabilitation program ova fear for her life and safety. Di 64-year-old senator, tok say im no dey violent towards any of im wife but she move comot from house becos she wan get unrestricted access. "Regina no always like dis. Her current battle wit drugs and alcohol abuse na di root of our problem," e tok. "She must continue her rehabilitation program, or I fear for her life and safety. "Now she don move to place wia she get unrestricted access to drugs. I get oda wives, and none go ever accuse me of violence." Wia dis foto come from, sir.sammywest/Instagram Inside one video wey bin go viral on Saturday night, Regina accuse her husband say im send im "thugs" make dem attack her. Regina Daniels dey cry inside di video while di pipo wey dey around her dey try to console her, she begin dey shout say she no fit tolerate di violence by her husband again. "For Ned Nwoko house, I be notin, but for my house, I be queen. Not again, I no fit stand di violence, e too much," she tok. Inside di short video, wey Regina brother, Sammy West, post on im Instagram story, e accuse di senator say im dey violent towards im sister and afta e physically assault  im sister, e run commot from di scene. On Sunday, Oga Nwoko provide evidence to di allegations, showing video wey contain images of cracked windows, table wey di glass don break and damaged car. E allege say im wife, Regina dey violent and she don hit three staff and destroy properties inside for no reason. "Regina na di violent one here, slapping and hitting three staff in di past 48 hours and destroying property, including cars and windows, for no just cause. "Di truth be say, I don set clear condition for her to accept rehab for Asokoro or outside Nigeria especially Jordan wia she no go get access to drugs." 25-year-old, Regina Daniels na popular acctress for di Nollywood industry. Regina start her career as child actress at di age of 7. She feature in her first movie for 2007 in di movie "Marriage in Sorrow". Since den she don feature in ova 100 Nigerian movies including Miracle Child, Python Girl, Spider-Girl, Hanging Coffin, Jaja the Great, Queen Rebecca, among odas. Regina Daniels marry Ned Nwoko at di age of 18. Dia marriage don reach six years and dem both get two pikin. Regina na di youngest wife of Ned, and she dey popular as an actress in di Nigeria feem industry. Dem don nominate her for plenti awards and she don win some too. Regina get five siblings, wey dey supportive of her career and she be Mass Communication graduate and recently she join di Senators Wives Association as dia social secretary. Wia dis foto come from, PrinceNedNwoko/Instagram Sixty-four-year-old, Ned Nwoko na Nigerian politician, lawyer and philanthropist. Ned Nwoko go University of Keele, Staffordshire, wia e bin get im first and second degree in law. Afta e finish school for UK, dem call am to English Bar for Lincoln Inn, one of di four Inns of Court for London. Ned Nwoko start im career as lawyer for United Kingdom, wia e gada experience bifor e come back Naija to do politics and business. For 1995, dem recognise am as di Best Black Lawyer of African Descent for England, for im success in di England legal field. After e make am well for im legal career for United Kingdom, Nwoko return back to Nigeria for 1998. E enta politics for 1999 and serve as House of Representatives member, e represent Aniocha/Oshimili Federal Constituency of Delta State from (1999–2003) Ned na still active politician and e be sitting senator wey dey represent Delta North Senatorial District.
articles.title: Kwanta between Senator Ned Nwoko and Regina Daniels – wetin we know

articles.input: Nigeria don qualify for World Cup 2026?

articles.input: Wetin we know about bandit attack on Church for Kwara
articles.output: Police for Kwara State,  for north-central region of Nigeria don confam deadly attack for one church for di town of Eruku, wia jaguda pipo bin open fire on top pipo wey gada to pray for Tuesday evening. Two pipo die for di attack and some odas wunjure - di attackers also kidnap several pipo from di worshippers. Di attack happun for di Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) for Oke Isegun, for Ekiti Local Government Are, Kwara state during di church evening programme. Di bandits shoot di pastor of di church bifor dem round up di worshippers at gunpoint. For dia statement, di police tok say: "As we search di area, we discover one male victim wey dem shoot die inside di Christ Apostolic Church, Oke Isegun, while we also find anoda victim of fatal gunshot for di bush. "One local vigilante person also sustain gunshot injury and we rush am immediately go ECWA Hospital, Eruku, for medical treatment." Police say dia men and di local vigilante pipo don start to search for di attackers wey run enta bush afta dia attack. Foto and short videos of di attack - wey come from di Church livestream - don go viral on top social media and e show as di worshippers bin try to hide wen di gunmen enta di church. Di video also show one elderly woman as she dey try desperately to escape di gunmen. Tension still dey high for Eruku town wey dey close to Kogi State as pipo dey fear say di attackers fit come back. Eyewitnesses say na three pipo die for di attack wey happun for di Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) for Oke Isegun, contrary to wetin police tok. Di eyewitness wey be member of di Church also say di bandits carry over 30 of dia members enta bush. E say dem no fit account for 35 of dia worshipers. Police neva comment on di number of pipo wey di bandits kidnap. "E happun around 6:00 pm wen dem enta through di fence, dem start to dey shoot guns. Di security man wey dey for di Church dem pursue am, shoot am and e shoot dem back. Dem later kill am. "Di pipo wey dem kidnap pass 35 pipo, blood stain dey everywia for inside di church. "We no see security operatives yesterday, even di hunters no fit come becos di gunmen fire teargas. "Police officers come dis morning but dem no do anything na only foto dem take for di place. Dem carry both male and female, young and old enta di bush." "Hunters don go search for di pipo wey dem kidnap inside forest, "Di gunmen use dia leg waka come inside di church wit guns and loot pipo properties wit di bags wey dem bring come." Anoda source tok say dem pick over 100 bullets shells afta di attack. Dis attack dey happun about 24 hours afta bandits bin attack one govment girls secondary school for Maga community for Kebbi State, northwest Nigeria, and kidnap 25 school girls from dia school hostel. Dem kill di Vice Principal and di security pesin for di school bifor dem pack di girls enta bush witout any confrontation from security pipo. Tori later come out say two of di girls later escape, and by Wednesday morning tori also tok say anoda school girl return home but she get injury. Meanwhile, more dan 20 of di schoolgirls still dey for di hand of di bandits. Also inside dis week, Boko Haram terrorists bin capture and kill one big oga for di Nigerian army, Brigadier General Musa Uba for Borno State. Di tori about di killing of di army oga bin still dey fly like rumour until President Bola Tinubu imsef confam am for one statement late on Tuesday. "As di Commander-in-Chief of di Armed Forces, I dey depressed wit di tragic death of our soldiers and officers on active duty. May God comfort di families of Brigadier General Musa Uba and oda fallen heroes," Tinubu tok. Dis recent attack for di CAC church for Kwara State dey come for a very bad period for Nigeria as President Donald Trump of di United States bin don accuse di Nigeria govment say dem no dey do anything to stop "di Christian genocide" we dey go on for di kontri. Di US govment recently add Nigeria to di list of kontris of particular concern wia pipo dey face persecution and death sake of dia Christian beliefs. Trump even threaten say im fit send US military to come into Nigeria "guns ablazing" to wipe out di radical Islamisc extremists we wan wipe out di Christian population for di kontri. However, President Tinubu and di Nigeria guvment reject dis accuse as dem tok say di insecurity for di kontri dey affect evribodi no mata dia religious standing.
articles.title: Wetin we know about bandit attack on Church for Kwara

articles.input: Super Eagles beat Lesotho 2:1 but e dey enough to qualify dem?
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Nigeria Super Eagles don move one step closer to 2026 FIFA World Cup qualification afta dem beat Lesotho 2-1 on Friday for inside one match wey fit prove decisive for Nigeria campaign. Troost Ekong bin give Nigeria di perfect start for di 55th minute as e convert one penalty into goal afta one handball for di Lesotho box. Akor Adams later double di advantage wit one ogbonge finish for di 80th minute, wey put Nigeria on top. Lesotho respond for di 83rd minute wit one goal from Kalake, but di Eagles secure di crucial three points. However, Benin Republic score dia own match, wey mean say Nigeria go remain behind on points and goal difference in Group C. Nigeria still dey third for di standings, wit three points behind group leaders Benin and one shy of South Africa, wey draw 0-0 wit Zimbabwe. Nigeria and Lesotho face each oda for di Fifa 2026 World Cup qualifying match for di New Peter Mokaba Stadium in Polokwane, South Africa, Di West African kontri dey hope say dem go fit qualify for dis World Cup afta dem miss out from di 2022 edition. For dia first match Nigeria come from behind to play 1-1 draw wit Lesotho. Lesotho shock di three time African champions afta dem take di lead through Motlomelo Mkhwanazifor goal inside 56 minutes for di Godswill Akpabio stadium for Uyo. Super Eagles struggle to break down di Crocodiles wey defend well through out di match. However, Nigeria need to get all di three points for dis match and even dia next match den rely on fate. For Nigeria to qualify, di Super Eagles need to beat Benin Republic with at least 3-0 for di last match and pray say South Africa go lose dia match against Rwanda on Tuesday 14 October.
articles.title: Super Eagles beat Lesotho 2:1 but e dey enough to qualify dem?

articles.input: Top military officers wey Boko Haram, ISWAP don kill for terror war
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Nigerian Army Tori come out on Tuesday say fighters of Islamic State of West Africa Province (Iswap) don kill Brigadier General Musa Uba for Borno State for northeast Nigeria. Di killing cause plenty tok-tok about how jihadist groups like Boko Haram and Iswap dey still fit kill senior Nigerian military officers, even though no be first time officer go die for battlefield. Report show say General Uba na di second highest-ranking officer wey gunmen don kill since 2021. Iswap announce di killing for dia Telegram page, say dia fighters capture am on 15 November afta dem do ambush for Nigerian soldiers near Wajiroko town for Borno State. Nigerian Army later confam di attack, say two soldiers and two vigilante pipo die. President Bola Tinubu send im condolence to General Uba family and oda soldiers wey die. Dis article look di senior Nigerian military officers wey don die for di fight against Boko Haram since 2018. Wia dis foto come from, Presidency Brigadier General M. Uba na di commander of 25 Brigade for Nigerian Army. Uba na di highest-ranking Nigerian soldier wey di group don kill since 2021. Borno na one of di states for Nigeria wey dey suffer pass from attacks by jihadist groups, wia Boko Haram and oda factions dey control some areas. Around mid-January, some Boko Haram or ISWAP fighters still attack farmers and fishermen for Dumba town inside Borno State for northeast Nigeria. Majority of pipo wey dey live for Gudumbari, Marte and Abadam local govment areas don dey under di control of di gunmen for almost six years. Since Boko Haram wahala start for 2009, Brigadier General Dzarma Zirkusu na di highest-ranking Nigerian soldier wey die for 2021. Di General die wit three oda soldiers wen ISWAP fighters wey break away from Boko Haram ambush dem for Askira Uba for November 2021. Di General, wey come from Adamawa State, becom commander of 28 Task Force Brigade for Chibok around January dat same year. Statement wey Nigerian Army release dat time tok say dem succeed kill many of di gunmen and recover plenty weapons as dem take repel di attack wey dem launch against di soldiers. Wia dis foto come from, Nigerian Army For September 2020, Boko Haram fighters ambush Colonel Dahiru Chiroma Bako near Wajiroko town, and e later die from di injuries wey he get for di attack. Reports tok say dem do surgery for am for 7 Division Military Hospital bifor e finally die. E bin be commander of 25 Taskforce Operation Lafiya Dole for Damboa. Borno State Govnor, Babagana Zulum, describe Colonel Bako as "one gallant soldier wey enemy nor ever fit capture Damboa under im leadership." Wia dis foto come from, Nigerian Army Lieutenant Colonel Muhammad Abu Ali die for November 2016, one year after dem promote am from Major to Lieutenant Colonel. Colonel Ali pass hundreds of him fellow soldiers bicos of di strong bravery wey e show for battlefield against Boko Haram as e dey command di 272 Task Force Battalion wey dey operate war tanks. Na im unit fight one of di toughest battles against Boko Haram for February 2015, wey later make dem capture back Baga town from di insurgents. Wen im death break, na one of di biggest gist for Nigerian social media dat time. E die wen Boko Haram fighters attack Nigerian Army 119 Battalion for Mallam Fatori, Borno State. "One moment e dey near tank dey hold him radio. But bicos everiwia dark, nobodi see di terrorist wey shoot am," one military hospital source tell TheCable dat time. Wia dis foto come from, Nigeria Army Anoda gallant Nigerian soja we di kontri lose na Lieutenant Colonel Ibrahim Sakaba, we die for November 2018. Dem kill Lt Col Sakaba during attack we gunmen carry out for one army base for northern Borno, wia dem also kill plenty Nigerian soldiers. Before im die, na im be di commander of 157 Task Force Battalion for Metele. For August 2021, Nigerian Army release statement deny wetin di soldier wife tok say na fellow soldiers kill am bicos he no gree join dem do corruption.
articles.title: Top military officers wey Boko Haram, ISWAP don kill for terror war

articles.input: US chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky die at di age of 29
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Charlotte Chess Center US chess grandmaster and online commentator Daniel Naroditsky don die at di of 29. Di popular chess player family announce im "unexpected" death for statement wey di club, di Charlotte Chess Center, release on Monday. Dem no tok di cause of death. "Na wit great sadness we share di unexpected passing of Daniel Naroditsky," di statement tok. "Daniel na talented chess player, commentator and educator, and a cherished member of di chess community, wey fans and players around di world admire and respect." Di US and International chess federations don pay tribute to Naroditsky, along wit oda professional players. Naroditsky first take interest in chess at di age of six, wen im older brother Alan introduce am to di game to help entertain some children for one birthday party. Im papa Vladimir and multiple coaches soon notice im talents. "As far as I dey concerned, I was just just dey play games wit my brother," Naroditsky tell di New York Times for one 2022 interview. E gain international attention in 2007 wen e win di under-12 boys world youth championship for Antalya, Turkey. In 2010, at di age of 14, e become one of di youngest ever published chess authors wen e write a book wit di title 'Mastering Positional Chess, covering practical skills and technical manoeuvrings'. For 2013 Naroditsky win di US Junior Championship, wey help am get di title of grandmaster, di international chess federation highest-ranked chess competitor, while e still be teenager. Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Naroditsky later graduate from Stanford University and work as a chess coach for Charlotte, North Carolina. While e still dey compete for high-level events, e transfer im talents to di online chess universe. Naroditsky YouTube channel gain nearly 500,000 subscribers and im Twitch stream get up to 340,000 followers, wit hundreds of thousands of viewers wey dey watch im regular video tutorials and livestreams against competitors. Fans praise im talent and passion, casually begin call am 'Danya'. In 2022 di New York Times name Naroditsky as dia "new chess columnist" and invite am to contribute to many chess puzzles for di newspaper games section. For im interview wit di New York Times, di young grandmaster tok about how chess take influence im life. "Even at my level, I still dey discover beautiful tins about di game evri single time I train, teach, play or I be commentator for any tournament," e tok.
articles.title: US chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky die at di age of 29

articles.instruction: Write a news article in Pidgin
articles.input: Who qualify for 2026 World Cup and who dey play inter-confederation play-offs
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Julian Finney/Getty Images For Africa, DR Congo thrash di Super Eagles of Nigeria to reach Fifa 2026 World Cup inter-confederation play-offs while Portugal and Norway become di latest kontris to book dia places for di tournament. Plenti kontris don alreadi qualify for di 2026 World Cup while few ones still dey play dia group qualifiers game. Na total of 32 teams don dey sure of dia place for di 2026 World Cup including England, Croatia, France, Argentina and World Cup first-timers Cape Verde, Jordan and Uzbekistan. Howeva, e still get 16 spots wey some kontris still need to fill wit di majority dey come from Europe. DR Congo na di latest of di six kontris wey go play di inter-confederation play-offs to extend dia bid to reach di 2026 Fifa World Cup. Curacao become di smallest kontri to qualify for di World Cup. Wit dia population of just 156,000, di carribean kontri squeeze dia way to di tournament afta dia 0-0 draw wit Jamaica. Di oda kontri wey make history be Haiti. Dia last appearance for di mundial be in 1974. Dem beat Nicaragua 2-0 to qualify. Di team play all dia home qualifiers outside Haiti sake of political and gang wahala. Haiti dey suffer gang violence since 2021 when dem kill dia president. Dis gangs take ova dia stadium and oda places so dem neva play any home qualifiers dia. On top of dis problem, di team no get correct set of professional players. Many of di players be professionals wey decide to play football part-time. Football dey unite all dis kontris for di World Cup - di dream of every player. Di DRC beat Nigeria 4-3 on penalties afta 1-1 draw for di African playoff final. Meanwhile, Nigeria go miss from a second successive edition of di World Cup afta a poor performance for Rabat. Na three kontris don progress to di play-off and dem go battle am out for di next stage. Although dis kontris neva qualify for di tournament in full but dem don confam to take part for di inter-confederation play-offs for March 2026. Di teams wey remain na two teams from Central America, and one from Asia to qualify for Play-offs. Wales still get chance of finishing top of Group J but go need to beat North Macedonia and hope Belgium lose to Liechtenstein for dia home for di final Group J game. Switzerland, di Netherlands and Spain go all book dia places no mata di defeats and huge goal difference. Joint-hosts Canada, Mexico and di United States get automatic qualification. Australia, Iran, Japan, Jordan, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, South Korea and Uzbekistan don alreadi qualify from Asia. Oceania get one direct qualification spot and New Zealand don take am. Tunisia and Morocco na di first two African sides to go through to di World Cup, and Algeria, Cape Verde, Egypt, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Senegal and South Africa join dem. Brazil, Ecuador, Uruguay, Paraguay and Colombia na di oda South American nations wey don guarantee dia place. Hosts: Canada, Mexico, United States Africa: Algeria, Cape Verde, Egypt, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Morocco, Senegal, South Africa, Tunisia Asia: Australia, Iran, Japan, Jordan, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, South Korea, Uzbekistan Europe: Croatia, England, France, Norway, Portugal, Scotland, Spain, Switzerland, Austria, Belgium, Netherlands, Germany South America: Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Paraguay, Uruguay, Curacao Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Each of Fifa six confederations use different methods of qualification to determine which nations qualify for di World Cup. Oceania na di only continent to complete dia direct qualification process for next year World Cup. Of di 48 teams for di 2026 tournament, dem give three places to di host nations and 43 go earn dia spot through direct qualification from di six confederations. Di oda two spots go dey determined by intercontinental play-offs. Teams already through: Croatia, England, France, Norway, Portugal Teams guaranteed play-off (at least) through qualifying: Germany/Slovakia, Switzerland/Kosovo, Denmark/Scotland, Spain/Turkey, Republic of Ireland, Netherlands/Poland, Austria/Bosnia, Italy. E get 12 groups and di winners of each go qualify for di World Cup. Europe na di only continent wey no get any team for di intercontinental play-offs. Qualifying game bin start for March 2025 - wit some teams not even playing dia first qualifiers until September sake of di Nations League. Di group stages go end dis week, while di play-offs go start for March 2026. Scotland beat Denmark 4-2 for dia dramatic home game to qualify. Scott McTominay score one scissor goal from a cross to lead di team to dia famous win. Belgium scata Liechtenstein 7-0 to take top spot in their final game. Di Netherlands also beat Lithuania 4-0 to seal qualification. Poland go need to win for Malta wit goal difference swing of 13 goals. Austria draw 1-1 wit Bosnia-Herzegovina for dia final group game on Tuesday to qualify. Bosnia go enta playoffs. Spain draw 2-2 wit Turkey for dia final group game to win di group wit three points, wit superior goal difference. Germany sama Slovakia 6-0, for dia group to go through as group leaders wit 15 points, di Slovaks finish second wit 12 points. Switzerland qualify wit dia 1-1 draw wit Kosovo for dia final group game. Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Qualifying places: Six, plus one into intercontinental play-offs Teams already through: Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Paraguay, Uruguay Intercontinental play-offs: Bolivia South American 10 teams play 18 games each, and di process start for September 2023. Di top six all reach di World Cup, wit di side wey dey seventh place go into di intercontinental play-offs. Wit group qualifying now ova, Bolivia beat Brazil 1-0 for di final round of games to reach di intercontinental play-offs. Qualifying places: Eight, plus one into intercontinental play-offs Teams already through: Australia, Iran, Japan, Jordan, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, South Korea, Uzbekistan Asian qualifying game start for October 2023 wit di lower-ranked teams in action. For di third round, di top two teams for three different groups qualify automatically. Australia, Iran, Japan, Jordan, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, South Korea and Uzbekistan don secure dia places. One oda side go progress through di intercontinental play-offs, wey follow Asia play-off for November. Dat na between UAE and Iraq - wey draw dia first leg 1-1. Qualifying places: Nine, plus one into intercontinental play-offs Teams already through: Algeria, Cape Verde, Egypt, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Morocco, Senegal, South Africa, Tunisia Intercontinental play-offs: DR Congo E get nine African groups of World Cup qualifiers, each wit six teams, wey start for November 2023. Di top team from each group go through automatically - wia Algeria, Cape Verde, Egypt, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Morocco, Senegal, South Africa and Tunisia guarantee dia places. Di best four runners-up go into play-offs for November for di chance to earn dia  spot for di intercontinental play-offs. DR Congo beat Nigeria for di final. Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Qualifying places: Six (including three hosts), plus two into intercontinental play-offs Teams already through: None through qualifying - Canada, Mexico and United States automatically as co-hosts Di Concacaf qualifier get different look to usual, as three of dia biggest hitters no dey involved as dem don qualify as hosts, but plenti spots still dey. Twelve teams dey involved for di third round of qualifier wey start dis month. Di winners of each group go to di World Cup and di two best-ranked runners-up going into di intercontinental play-offs. Qualifying places: One, plus one nation into intercontinental play-offs Teams already through: New Zealand Oceania qualifier don alreadi end - wit New Zealand beating New Caledonia 3-0 for di final. New Zealand go through to di World Cup automatically, as a result of di expanded World Cup. Oceania usually only get a play-off spot. New Caledonia go take part for intercontinental play-offs for March 2026 - featuring teams from Africa, Asia, South America and North America - wit two out of six teams going through.
articles.title: Who qualify for 2026 World Cup and who dey play inter-confederation play-offs

articles.input: Nigeria qualify for 2026 World Cup playoffs afta Victor Osimhen hattrick
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Nigeria Super Eagles impress for dia last 2026 Fifa World Cup qualifier wia dem beat Benin 4-0. Di Super Eagles no allow dia neighbours di Cheetahs of Benin see goal for di Godswill Akpabio stadium, Uyo, southern Nigeria. Victor Osimhen score three goals for di third, 37th and 51st minutes, while Frank Onyeaka score di last goal for Nigeria close to full time. Benin no sleep at all for dis match, dem fight from start to finish. Dem also get good opportunities wey suppose be goal but Nigeria goalkeeper no allow dem shine. For first half Benin bin get one-on-one chance but di ball go over di bar. Even for di second half Benin worry Nigeria for di midfield to force dem to make mistake but di Cheetahs no see chance score. As e be so South Africa qualify automatically for Group C wit 18 points while Nigeria finish second wit 17 points, Benin place third wit same 17 points but goal difference separate dem. With 17 points, Nigeria stand chance of qualifying as one of di best runners-up, potentially dem go need play extra four matches. Di overall winner of di Africa playoff go progress to Fifa final six-team inter-continental qualifier wey go take place for March next year. Just few days to di last round of qualification matches, Confederation of African Football (Caf) explain how teams go take qualify for di playoffs. Hia na di breakdown of wetin dem tok; Na nine second-placed teams from each group go enta di playoff standings; one from each group. To compare dem fairly, dem no go count di results against di last-placed Team for each Group. Dis one mean say na only matches against di top five teams for each group dem go use do di calculation. Di only exception na Group E wey get only five teams becos Eritrea withdraw. Nigeria record 15pts and qualify for di playoffs through di points dem get for dia matches against South Africa, Benin, Lesotho and Zimbabwe. Di Super Eagles also progress sake of dia superior goal difference for di ranking of di second-placed teams. Wia dis foto come from, Flashscore
articles.title: Nigeria qualify for 2026 World Cup playoffs afta Victor Osimhen hattrick

articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images Di Confederation of African football don release nominations of players for di 2025 Best Player of di Year Award. Nigeria Super Eagles striker Victor Osimhen wey dey play for Galatasaray, Mo Salah of Egypt wey dey play for Liverpool and PSG player Ashraf Hakimi dey di list. Di awards dey celebrate ogbonge performers for di continent like players, coaches, clubs and national teams. According to Caf, di impact of players and coaches on di game for Africa and di world na im dem go use for di period wey dem dey consider. Na from 6 January to 15 October 2025, and dis nominations reflect di pipo wey bin don make major contributions to football for di continent. Caf tok say di panel of experts na dia Technical & Development Committee members, plus experienced coaches, CAF Legends and selected media representatives na im decide di 10 nominees for each category  afta dem consider dia performance for all competitions. Andre Frank Zambo-Anguissa (Cameroon/Napoli) Fiston Mayele (DR Congo/Pyramids) Mohamed Salah (Egypt/Liverpool) Denis Bouanga (Gabon/Los Angeles FC) Serhou Guirassy (Guinea/Borussia Dortmund) Achraf Hakimi (Morocco/Paris Saint-Germain) Oussama Lamlioui (Morocco/RS Berkane) Victor Osimhen (Nigeria/Galatasaray) Iliman Ndiaye (Senegal/Everton) Pape Matar Sarr (Senegal/Tottenham Hotspur) Andre Onana (Cameroon/Trabzonspor) Ahmed El Shenawy (Egypt/Pyramids) Munir Mohamedi (Morocco/RS Berkane) Yassine Bonou (Morocco/Al Hilal) Stanley Nwabali (Nigeria/Chippa United) Edouard Mendy (Senegal/Al Ahli) Ronwen Williams (South Africa/Mamelodi Sundowns) Aymen Dahmen (Tunisia/CS Sfaxien) Ismael Belkacemi (Algeria/Al Ahli Tripoli) Blati Toure (Burkina Faso/Pyramids FC) Issoufou Dayo (Burkina Faso/RS Berkane) Fiston Mayele (DR Congo/Pyramids) Mohamed Hrimat (Morocco/AS FAR) Mohamed Chibi (Morocco/Pyramids) Oussama Lamlioui (Morocco/RS Berkane) Shomari Kapombe (Tanzania/Simba) Romuald Rakotondrabe (Madagascar CHAN) Asharaf Tapsoba (Burkina Faso/Real du Faso) Alynho Haidara (Cote d'Ivoire/ Mainz 05 Jacqueville) Noah Sadiki (DR Congo/Sunderland) Abdellah Ouazane (Morocco/Ajax) Houssam Essadak (Morocco/US Touarga) Othmane Maamma (Morocco/Watford) Daniel Bameyi (Nigeria/Primorje) Momoh Kamara (Sierra Leone/Minnesota United) Mbekezeli Mbokazi (South Africa/Orlando Pirates) Tylon Smith (South Africa/Queens Park Rangers) Mamelodi Sundowns (South Africa)

articles.instruction: Write a news article in Pidgin
articles.input: Katy Perry and Justin Trudeau picture add fuel to tori say dem dey date
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Getty Images / Bloomberg via Getty Images E be like say Singer Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minster Justin Trudeau don confam dia relationship status afta foto of wia dem hold hands for one event for Paris go viral. Celebrity news site TMZ bin publish di photographs and video footage as di two of dem dey waka hand-in-hand bifor dem enta one motor. Di foto bin show as Oga Trudeau dey help di singer into di back seat as photographers dey hail am. Neither Perry nor Trudeau don publicly comment on dia relationship. But speculation don dey grow for weeks wit plenty fotos of di two of dem togeda. Earlier dis year, Trudeau bin attend one Perry concert wey fuel rumours of romance wit di pop star. Dia appearance for Paris bin collide wit Perry 41st birthday ova di weekend and e appear to mark dia first public outing as a couple. Representatives for Perry and Trudeau Liberal party no immediately respond to BBC request for comment. During one recent tour for London, Perry no tok anytin about her relationship status. Afta one fan propose to her from di audience during one performance, di singer joke say: "I wish you don ask me 48 hours ago." Dis na just days afta dem first publish fotos of her and Trudeau online. Perry bifor bin dey inside one long-term relationship wit actor Orlando Bloom. Di two of dem bin dey togeda for about 10 years and dem get one daughter, dem separate ova di summer. Trudeau, wey serve as prime minister of Canada from 2015 to 2025, bin dey married to Sophie Grégoire for 18 years bifor di couple go dia separate ways for di summer of 2023. Dem get three children togeda.
articles.title: Katy Perry and Justin Trudeau picture add fuel to tori say dem dey date

articles.instruction: Write a news article in Pidgin
articles.input: Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla: South Africa ex-president daughter plead not guilty to terrorism charges
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Supplied Di terrorism trial of Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla wey be di daughter of former South Africa President Jacob Zuma don start for di High Court for Durban on Monday, 9 November. She plead not guilty and her lawyer tok say di case wey di state get against her dey weak. 43-year-old Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla dey face trial on top accuse say she use social media to incite violence and terrorism through her social media posts during di July 2021 deadly protests wey lead to di death of 350 pipo. Prosecutors allege say Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla bin incite odas to commit acts of violence for posts she write on social media for July 2021 wen civil unrest break out afta authorities arrest her father, former President Jacob Zuma on top accuse say e disobey court order to testify for one corruption inquiry. For one of her posts, she bin include one Zulu word "azishe" wey literally mean "let it burn" but for slang e fit mean "Make di kasala start". She don repeatedly tok say di charges against her na attempt to settle political scores wit her father, afta e start im own political party and campaign against di African National Congress. Zuma-Sambudla dey face three counts wey relate to her online posts during di civil unrest. Count one wey be di incitement to commit terrorism. Prosecutors allege say between June 29 and July 2021, Zuma-Sambudla unlawfully and intentionally incite odas to commit acts of terrorism. Count two na di incitement to commit violence. Di state claim say she instigate or encourage pipo to gada unlawfully wit di intent to disturb public peace or infringe on odas rights. Count three na di Violation of di Riotous Assemblies Act. Di third charge relate to a violation of Section 17 of di Riotous Assemblies Act 17 of 1956, wey prohibit illegal gatherings intended to cause a riot. Jacob Zuma nine-year presidency, wey controversies full bin come to an end for 2018 for di middle of corruption allegations – e deny all di accuse. Den for 2021, dem jail am sake of say e fail to show up for one corruption inquiry. Dis mata cause protests plus di worst scenes of violence since di beginning of di democratic era for 1994. One week of katakata for KwaZulu-Natal and Gauteng provinces, wey include looting and arson, bin leave at least 300 people dead and e cause a$2.8bn (£2.2bout bn) damage. Prosecutors allege say Zuma-Sambudla play ogbonge role in adding fire to di violence. Few supporters from her party, uMkhonto weSizwe, show for KwaZulu-Natal high court, including her father plus oda party leaders. In recent years, Zuma-Sambudla bin emerge as di former president most strongest supporter as she dey always dey im side. She don also become member of MK parliament. For 2021, she para wen dem arrest her father and she post fotos from di looting. Di allegation na say dis bin escalate wetin dey hapun and ginger her plenty social media followers, like 100,000 at di time, to carry out destruction. Zuma-Sambudla dey accused of incitement to commit terrorism under di Protection of Constitutional Democracy against Terrorist and Related Activities Act. She also dey accused of di incitement to commit public violence. Several posts from July 2021 ontop wetin dey known before as Twitter dey di heart of di state case against her. For one tweet, she bin share post wey call for di "shut down" of KwaZulu-Natal including "roads, factories, shops [and] govment" until dem release di former president. Dem born and raise di MP for Mozambique, wen her father bin dey live on exile afta e spend 10 years as political prisoner for South Africa. She grow up wit her twin brother Duduzane and she be one of Zuma five children wit im third wife Kate Mantsho – wey take her own life for 2000. Duduzile and Duduzane na one of Zuma rumoured 20 children wit several wives and former partners wey dey very popular. For several years, na Duduzane dominate di headlines afta im association wit di controversial Gupta family bin come to light for di early 2010s. Dat family bin dey di centre of di corruption allegations wey affect Zuma presidency. Di Guptas and Zuma don deny any wrongdoing. Apart from her ogbonge wedding to businessman Lonwabo Sambudla for 2011, wey dem call di wedding of di year at di time, Zuma-Sambudla bin no dey spotlight. She mostly focus on raising her two daughters and being a housewife, according to South Africa Daily Maverick news site. She separate from her husband for 2017.
articles.title: Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla: South Africa ex-president daughter plead not guilty to terrorism charges

articles.input: Behind di glamour: Nigeria fashion industry dey face labour crisis
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, OLYMPIA DE MAISMONT/AFP via Getty Images Models dey faint. Some dey climb fence to escape di confusion wey dey happun for casting. One designer fit even comot from show afta dem catch am for wahala say models dey pay agency make dem showcase dem. International celebrities dey show for fashion brand event, while national stars dey waka for main runway. Lagos dey inside full season of art, design and fashion but behind all di fine fine tins of Lagos Fashion Week (LFW), Nigeria fashion industry dey face serious labour wahala. Di Sub-Saharan fashion market dey estimated at $31 billion, and Nigeria carry about 15 percent around $4.7 billion according to Euromonitor report wey dem quote for industry documents. Di modelling industry, wey na mostly women full am, dey attract plenty young pipo wey wan waka for LFW runway opportunity wey fit help dem build career and carry dem enta big fashion cities like Paris, London and New York. Reports dey tok say pipo dey suffer exploitation, bad working condition, and money matter wey no clear. All dis one don make many pipo dey question wetin really dey hold di industry ground. Samiat Salami move from United States go Nigeria for 2021 wit dream to create her own brand wey go celebrate century-old craftsmanship through hand-drawn batik prints. "I move come Nigeria sake of say I wan start textile business," na wetin Salami, wey be founder of Oya Abeo tok. "Afta I don live away for many years, I really wan come back home. I see say sometin fine dey happun wey I no dey part of, and e pain me." Now she tok say she dey inside industry wey to sabi di rules and politics important pass even talent, and most times she no dey sure how she go take waka inside am. Afta she participate for Lagos Fashion Week Green Access program last year, Salami spend six months prepare for dis year show - 15-piece collection wey she say cost her between 3.5 million and 4 million naira ($3000). But just few days bifor di event, dem remove her name from di lineup bicos of allegation say she gree make one agency pay her for models wey go waka her showcase. Di agency tok say dia models miss LFW casting bicos dem travel go outside di kontri, but Salami tok say she bin tink say di money wey agency offer her na just "inconvenience fee." "I feel scapegoated," Salami tell BBC. "E no even enta my head to confirm wit Lagos Fashion Week bicos I tink say na dem direct di agency come meet me." "I no even take am serious for beginning," she tok, referring to di email tok wey she get wit di agency wey claim say LFW organizers direct dem to contact designers on dia own. When di wahala bust, she say e shock her. "I just say, wetin be dis? Na joke be dis? I don realize say dem scam me. E even be like dem models sef don suffer. Dis one bad." Di whole controversy center around MHD Model Management and im founder, Enoch Raimi. Many models come out anonymously through Organisation for Models in Nigeria say dem dey ask make dem pay bifor dem go fit participate for Lagos Fashion Week. Hannah Martin, wey work wit di agency for some months, also share her own tori of exploitation and threat. She tok say afta dem pick her for one mandatory casting call, she decide to commot from di agency afta Enoch Raimi begin send her abusive messages. Martin tok say Raimi don tell her bifor say she don get international placement — chance to model abroad — and even send her email to confirm am. But later dem remove her from di placement. "E say e go bring me down and make sure I no model again" she tell BBC. "I dey cry… most times, you go see say dem no even ask model opinion bifor dem begin charge" she add. When she later ask why payments delay and deductions plenty, Raimi vex and begin act hostile. For phone interview wit BBC, Enoch Raimi defend imself but accept say e make mistakes. For di designer payment matter, e tok say e just dey try secure spots for im models both off schedule and main LFW stage. "Pipo don twist di issue like say I wan exploit public for Lagos Fashion Week. E no be so," e tok. E deny say e neva ask models to pay and claim say e even dey pay for dia transport and training. Raimi admit say e use wrong language sometimes "I no suppose mix emotion wit business. I still dey grow as agency. I make mistakes, but some no go ever repeat again." Talking about Salami, Raimi tok say e sorry "I really sorry say all dis happun." E tok say e mistakenly share screenshot of dia financial chats bicos e dey try defend imself from di pay-for-runway tok. Dis year Lagos Fashion Week casting dey "chaotic," model and creative director Naomi Utere tok. She attend but dem no pick her, later one designer directly recruit her. "Di place wey dem use for casting too small," Utere tok. "We all dey sweat. Eviribodi dey push. One girl climb fence escape bicos she no wan pass middle wia crowd full." Anoda model, Amanda Basil, confirm di same tin "Models no dey comfortable; odas climb fence just to go house... pipo wey enter looking fine come out looking somehow." Dem also complain say di all-black dress code plus cramped space make everytin worse. "We dey risk our life, time and energy to work we suppose dey get pay, no be exploitation" Basil add. Plenty models tell BBC say dem dey suffer poor pay, delay payment, and bad working condition. Many dey work overnight wit injuries and no get health insurance. Pay for Nigeria dey vary from small transport stipend to N300,000 ($168; £138)  for big show. LFW dey reportedly pay 100,000 to 50,000 naira  ($56–$84; £46–£69) for whole week. Meanwhile, for Paris or London, one single show fit give models thousands of dollars, while for oda African hubs like as South Africa and Kenya, high-profile bookings fit pass Nigerian model weekly income. "Na di same show o, one person go collect just transport, anoda 100k, anoda 250k," Utere tok. Basil add "Dis idea say models suppose collect small money need to stop. We be human beings wit bills to pay. Many pipo don quit sake of dis. If no be say I love am, I for don stop long time." Even for young models wey dey live wit family or for university hostels, wey dem pay for accommodation yearly, week fashion pay no fit covers dia basic costs. Dis gap show imbalance for Nigerian fashion industry, wia what many pipo dey consider international norms clash sharply wit local reality. Bernice Asein, wey write "Fashion Law in Africa" and be founder of one fashion law institute, describe di situation as part of one bigger crisis. "We get labour law crisis," Asein tok to BBC about Nigeria fashion industry, but she add say e reflect di wider labour situation and economic reality for di kontri. "Models dey react well well now bicos for years dem don dey overwork dem." Asein dey support say industry make dem self-regulate through code of conduct, like the New York Fashion Workers Act under state labour law, wey, for example, require say payment must show within 46 days afta job complete and make higher rates dey for extra hours — tins wey plenty models for Nigeria dey tok say never solve bicos Nigerian Labour Law no address dem. Di act still dey demand written contracts for all jobs, protection against unauthorised use of images, and safeguards to make sure fair treatment and pay transparency dey between models, agencies and brands. Asein, wey be lawyer wey represent plenty models and dey help dem through bad contracts, tok say she dey always push for dem to speak up because na important tin for change. "I don see progress wey don happun internationally and we need to copy dat here to protect dem." Plenty models still dey fear to share dia experiences for public, dem dey fear say industry big pipo fit blacklist dem. Lagos Fashion Week na platform wey "plenty pipo dey desperate to waka for" sake say e add to dia portfolios. "Pipo dey see am as prestige," one model tok, but ask make name no show. Di fear of losing opportunities make many keep quiet about exploitation. Recent online activism don bring many issues come light, including critics say some designers dey ask for volunteer models and one documentary wey show discrimination and exploitation. Even though dem drop her from Lagos Fashion Week, Salami still determined to show her collection alone, although she fear di extra cost as small brand. "Too many pipo depend on me for dia income... since I show up here, my reality don bicom to provide income for pipo; dat one never disappear," she tok. "Dis collection come from deep place. E go pain me if nobodi see am." Lagos Fashion Week organisers dem bin contact for comment but dem no reply BBC requests.
articles.title: Behind di glamour: Nigeria fashion industry dey face labour crisis

articles.input: PDP elect new chairman and secretary as dem pursue Wike, Fayose, Anyanwu sake of alleged anti-party activities
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Kabiru Tanimu Turaki/Facebook, Lere Olayinka/X, Amb. Taofeek Oladejo Arapaja/Facebook Di Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), wey be di major opposition party for Nigeria, don elect Kabiru Turaki (SAN) as dia National Chairman. PDP for dia national convention for Lekan Salami Stadium, Ibadan Oyo State, southwest Nigeria on Saturday and Sunday elect di former minister of Special Duties and Intergovernmental Affairs. For di convention wey di party say na ova 3,000 delegates from across Nigeria 36 states and di Federal Capital Territory attend, dem also elect Taofeek Arapaja National Secretary. "Senator Ben Obi, wey oversee di electoral processes, guide delegates through a transparent voting mechanism wey underscore di PDP's commitment to democratic principles," PDP tok. Wia dis foto come from, Lere Olayinka/X For di convention, di opposition party pursue di Minister of di Federal Capital Territory Nyesom Wike plus some oda top members of di party sake of accuse say dem do anti-party tins. Di oda pipo wey dem also pursue na Samuel Anyanwu wey be di National Secretary of PDP bifor dem elect Taofeek Arapaja, Austin Nwachukwu, Kamaldeen Ajibade (SAN), and former govnor of Ekiti State Ayo Fayose. Odas also na Umar Bature, Mohammed Abdulrahman, George Turner, Dan Orbih and Mao Ohuabunwa. Wia dis foto come from, Lere Olayinka/Facebook For di motion wey members of di PDP move during di convention, dem allege say di members wey dem expel don commit plenty offence against di party constitution, including "supporting and canvassing votes for di opposition". "Di decision dey ratified by overwhelming majority of delegates, and e show say di party dey committed to eradicate internal divisions and anti-party conduct wey don dey delay dia progress," di PDP write for dia verified X handle. Howeva, Lere Olayinka wey be di tok-tok pesin for oga Nyesom Wike don respond to di development as e tok say na decision of pipo wey don drink. "Dem gada for Ibadan to do social party, enjoy diasef and get drunk, dem dey free to tok anytin," Olayinka write for im Facebook handle. Dis PDP national convention bin happun in spite of one order by di Federal High Court for Abuja, wey tell di party make dem no go ahead wit di convention. But anoda High Court for Oyo State also give anoda order say make di convention go ahead and make di Independent National Electoral Commission (Inec) monitor di process. Sabi pipo bin tok say dis convention na chance for di PDP to put dia house in order as in-house gbas gbos wan scata di party wey bin rule Nigeria for 16 years and bin dey brag say na di biggest party for Africa. Since afta di 2023 general election, di PDP be like say e divide into two, one part dey loyal to Nyesom Wike, former govnor of Rivers State and di current Minister of di Federal Capital Territory, while di oda faction dey loyal to Seyi Makinde di current govnor of Oyo State. Di Wike faction include Sam Anyanwu and some former govnors like Samuel Ortom of Benue State, Ifeanyi Ugwuanyi of Enugu State, Ayodele Fayose of Ekiti State, and Okezie Ikpeazu of Abia State. For di Makinde faction, na some serving govnors like Bala Mohammed of Bauchi State, di acting National Chairman Umar Damagum, and di National Vice Chairman (North Central), Abdulrahman Mohammed dey dia. Former Senate President Bukola Saraki, wey bin head one reconciliation attempt for di PDP write for im X handle on Thursday say, make di party no go ahead wit dis national convention, rather, make dem appoint caretaker committee wey go take charge for di mean time. However, on Saturday morning, di PDP Board of Trustees issue statement say dem reject di report of di reconciliation committee wey dey fly around for di media. Chairman of di PDP BoT, Adolphus Wabara, wey also be former Senate President for Nigeria, tok for di statement say dem for di BoT neva see di report and dem no endorse am. "Di BoT tanda gidigba to endorse di conduct of di elective National Convention wey dey scheduled for Saturday, 15th to Sunday 16th November, 2025 for Ibadan, Oyo State capital for di purpose of electing new set of leaders to pilot di affairs of di Party for di next four years," di statement tok. "Di BoT reject any suggestion for Caretaker Committee for di Party. Such idea no fit dey contemplated by di Board." Wia dis foto come from, @OfficialPDPNig/X Dem born Kabiru Turaki for 1957 for Birnin Kebbi, Kebbi State. Turaki bin attend di University of Jos, Plateau State, wia e graduate wit Bachelor's degree in Law. E dey hold di traditional titles of Dan Masanin Gwandu and Zarumman Kabbi for im community. For 2013, former President Goodluck Jonathan swear-in Turaki as Minister of Special Duties and Intergovernmental Affairs E get ova 25 years experience in di private and public sectors and e become Senior Advocate of Nigeria (SAN) for 2002. Turaki na principal partner at K.T. Turaki and Co. Solicitors and Advocates. E bin contest for govnor for Kebbi State for 2011. Na ogbongbe politician wit di PDP until im become di PDP National Chairman. Dem born Taofeek Arapaja for 1958. For 2003-2007, Arapaja bin represent Ibadan South East/Ibadan North East Federal Constituency for di Federal House of Representatives. For 2007, Arapaja become deputy govnor to Otunba Christopher Adebayo Alao Akala of Oyo State. Until im appointment as National Secretary, Arapaja bin serve as di Deputy National Chairman (South). For 2012, Arapaja serve as di Nigerian ambassador to di Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan. For April 2014, Arapaja become di ambassador to Republic of Iraq.
articles.title: PDP elect new chairman and secretary as dem pursue Wike, Fayose, Anyanwu sake of alleged anti-party activities
