articles.input: Tori of assassination attempt on Lieutenant Yerima na lie - Police
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Lere Olayinka/Facebook screengrab Tori say dem wan assassinate one Nigerian Navy officer, Lt Ahmed Yerima for Abuja na lie, police tok. Di Federal Capital Territory Police Command dismiss di tori say Yerima survive assassination attempt – dem describe di claims as "false and unverified." Police make di statement on Monday morning afta tori spread say some unidentified men wey wear black inside two unmarked Hilux vans without number plates in Abuja dey follow di Naval officer. Local media say dem begin follow am around 6:30 p.m. for NIPCO filling station along di Kubwa Expressway and kontinu to Gado Nasco Way. Tori be say Yerima escape di attackers with speed. But police say all dos tori na lie. Josephine Adeh, di tok-tok pesin of di Federal Capital Territory Police Command say nothing like dat happun and nobody don report anytin like dat. "Di FCT Police Command don hear tori wey dey spread on social media wey allege attempted assassination on Lt. Ahmed Yerima. "Di command wish to categorically state say no such incident don dey reported or recorded anywia e within di Federal Capital Territory. "We advise di public to disregard dis false information and stop to dey spread unverified claims wey fit cause unnecessary panic," di statement she tok. Na serious drama wen Nigeria minister of di Federal Capital Territory (FCT, Nyesom Wike and military officials enta kwanta ova mata wey surround land issues. Di gbege happun wen di FCT minister wit some officials bin dey enta one land and military officers bin stop dem. Wike, former Rivers state govnor bin vex well well as e face di soldier wey lead odas to stop am ontop di land wey dem bin wan gain access into. Di minister kwesion di military for di approval wey dem receive to dey ontop dat land or to develop am. As di minister dey vex dey tok, di soldier stand for im front calm and dey reply am evri kwesion wey e dey ask. Wike ask di officers to show di document wey dem get for di land wen dem dey guide. "Show me di document wey you get, you no get document. I be minister you no fit tell me dat. We no fit dey kontinue to get dis imounity, we no fit dey kontinue dis way." "Wia di approval wey dem give you, how dat man for im level, even if e get problem make e write and say see wetin I get, but e go send soldiers to who intimidate who." Meanwhile, di military officers say dem dey act on order wey one of dia ogas bin give dem. Naso Wike vex shout ontop di officer say nobody dey higher dan di govment and nobody go fit intimidate am. "You no fit dey higher dan any govment, you no fit dey carry gun to intimidate pipo make dem no do dia jobs," Wike tok as e address di officers wey dey stop to enta di land. One of di milliary officers wey dey follow Wike tok make am clear say dem get document for di land, and dem get am legally, but di minister disagree. As di hot drama dey go on, Wike and di soldier dey throw words at each oda but while di minister dey use serious face to take cut warning give di officer, di military officer just dey calm dey stand on im words say im dey act on order. Afta di whole kwanta, Nyesom Wike follow tori pipo tok on wetin carry come ontop dat land. E say di land bin dey act on dia mandate wen e hear say dem use military take chase dem comot, na why e imsef gatz stand say e wan go see tins by imsef. "E dey unfortunate, na dis kain tin dey trouble our development. Di land department get di mandate to see wia illegal development and land grabbing dey go on." "Wen dem come hia, dem say di military chase dem comot, I think say dem fit dey act illegally. Wen I dey office, dem call me say di military don take ova di place, I gatz come see tins for mysef." Dis drama cause plenty tok-tok and reactions for Nigeria sotay, many pipo begin check wetin law tok about who get right pass. Di Nigeria Police, FCT command don come out to clarify di stop-and-search issue wey involve naval officer. One video wey bin dey trend for social media show wia police officers bin stop one ash-coloured and ask make di driver identify imsef. Di incident wey happun for Sunday 16 November 2025, don lead to different social media conversations, but di police say dem no attack nobodi. According to FCT police tok tok pesin SP Josephine Adeh, she say report say dem attack 'one Lt. Ahmed Yerima for NNPC junction for Kubwa area of di FCT' na lie. Di police say dia patrol team bin dey conduct routine stop-search for NNPC junction along Kubwa expressway wen dem find di car wey cova im plate number and also get full tinted windows. "In line wit standard operational procedure, officers approach di vehicle and politely request for di occupant identity, along wit an explanation for why e cova di plate number." "Di occupant, howeva bin refuse to identify imsef, e make several calls, and roll up im tinted windows, and e no engage wit di police team." Police say na few minutes afta di incident dem bin see three naval personnel arrive di location, and na dem identify di 'occupant of di vehicle as dia colleague.' "Di patrol team den kontinue dia operations peacefully and witout any further incident." "E dey surprising to wake up to maliciously tales and worst of all allegations of assassination." Lieutenant Ahmed Yerima na naval officer for di Nigerian Navy. Dem raise am for Kaduna State, Northwest Nigeria, wia plenti military activites dey take place. Yerima attend Ahmadu Bello University (ABU), bifor e later go di Nigerian Defence Academy (NDA), for Kaduna. E dey well known for di midst of im friends for class say e dey always speak out anc communicate well. Afta Yerima finish im military training, dem commission am as Lieutenant for di Nigerian Navy. Dat na how im military service bin start. Yerima don work for di Corps of Army Public Relations bifor, amongst oda roles wey e hold. Lt. Yerima be member of di Nigerian Institute of Public Relations (NIPR) and di African Public Relations Association (APRA).
articles.title: Tori of assassination attempt on Lieutenant Yerima na lie - Police

articles.input: Baek Se-hee: 'I Want To Die But I Want To Eat Tteokbokki' writer don die
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Instagram / Baek Se-hee Baek Se-hee, wey be di South Korean writer of bestselling memoir I Want to Die but I Want To Eat Tteokbokki don die at di age of 35. Her 2018 book, na a compilation of conversations wit her psychiatrist about her depression, wey be cultural phenomenon wit di themes of mental health wey readers across di world fit relate wit. Dem write di book originally for Korean language, but di book go international afta dem publish di English translation for 2022. Di details wey surround her death neva dey clear. Baek bin donate her organs - her heart, lungs, liver and kidneys - wey bin don help  to save five lives, di Korean Organ Donation Agency tok for statement on Friday. Di statement bin also include comments from her sister, wey say Baek bin wan to "share her heart wit odas through her work, and to inspire hope". I Want to Die but I Want to Eat Tteokbokki, wey dem bin publish for 2018, bin sell more dan a million copies worldwide and dem translate am for 25 countries. Dem bin celebrate di runaway bestseller sake of say she make conversations around mental health normal and how e dey affect inner struggles - di most of dem na di writer personal conflict between depressive thoughts and her appreciation for simple joys. "Di human heart, even wen e wan die, many times want to eat tteobokki di same time too," na di most popular line for di book. Wia dis foto come from, Bloomsbury Dem born her for 1990, Baek Se-hee do creative writing for university and she bin work for five years for one publishing house, according to her short biography on Bloomsbury Publishing, wey bin produce di English version of her 2018 memoir. Anton Hur, wey bin translate Baek book into English, bin write for Instagram say her organs don save five pipo but "her readers go know say she touch yet millions of lives more wit her writing". "My thoughts dey wit her family," im write. For ten years, she bin receive treatment for dysthymia, one mild but long-lasting type of depression, wey bin form di background of her bestseller, na wetin her Bloomsbury bio tok. Dem bin publish di sequel, I Want to Die but I Still Want to Eat Tteokbokki, for Korean language for 2019. Dem bin also publish di English translation for 2024. Tributes dey pour for social media. "Rest softly," one of di comment on Instagram tok. "Thank you as you save us wit your honesty." Another Instagram user bin say anytime dem read Baek memoir, dem dey get  "deep comfort from every sentence and dem bim dey grow wit am". "To create any single book wey fit lift pipo up... no be easy task, and I get  respect for you wey I no fit describe for you to achieve," dem write.
articles.title: Baek Se-hee: 'I Want To Die But I Want To Eat Tteokbokki' writer don die

articles.input: PDP don scatter? How dismissal of Wike, Fayose fit affect Nigeria main opposition party
articles.output: Nigeria biggest opposition party, di Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) don turn into one day one wahala sake of internal gbas-gbos wey dey threaten to tear di party apart. Ova di weekend, one faction of di party organise dia national convention for Ibadan Oyo State, wia dem agree to expel di Minister of di Federal Capital Territory Nyesom Wike, di national secretary Sam Anyanwu, former Ekiti State guvnor Ayo Fayose, and odas. Howeva, dis Monday morning, di same Anyanwu wey suppose dey suspended, don call for emergency meeting of di party Board of Trustees and di National Executive Committee. Di meeting go hold on Tuesday. For di invite wey don circulate for social media, Anyanwu tok say important matters go dey discussed and addressed. E no clear now who be di NEC and BoT members wey go attend di meeting, bicos for di national convention for Ibadan on Saturday and Sunday, di PDP elect new national chairman and secretary wey be Kabiru Turaki and Taofeek Arapaja. Dat convention bin also get di support of di PDP BoT wey di chairman na former Senate President Adolphus Wabara. Some top oga dem for di PDP don describe di national convention wey happun for di Lekan Salami Stadium Ibadan, Oyo State ova di weekend, as illegal. Dis na sake of say di federal high court for Abuja bin order say di convention no fit hold and even order di Independent National Electoral Commission (Inec) say make dem no monitor di process. Na di former guvnor of Jigawa State Sule Lamido bin carry di mata go court as e claim say di PDP no gree make e buy nomination form to run for di office of national chairman during di convention. Justice Peter Lifu rule say e dey against di PDP constitution for dem to stop any member wey wan run for any office, so e order say di convention no fit hold unless Lamido go dey allowed to contest for di position wey e want. During one interview for TV, Lamido tok say im no go witdraw di court mata bicos im dey fight for im right, "and if di convention go ahead, e go dey illegal". However, di convention organisers claim say dem get anoda order fro di Oyo State High Court wey order dem to go ahead wit di convention and di election of national officers. According to dem, dis order from Justice Ladiran Akintola bin come on Friday, 14 November, and e compel di PDP to hold dia convention as dem bin don plan am, and for Inec to also monitor am. Na based on dis Oyo State high court judgement di PDP go on wit dia convention. One oga for di National Judicial Institute (NJI), Babatunde Adejumo, bin don explain wetin go happen wen two courts wey get di same power give two different orders on top di same issue. Adejumo wey be di former President of di National Industrial Court, give di explanation on Thursday, 13 Novemba 2025, as e dey ansa questions from tori pipo ahead of di 2025 All Nigerian Judges' Conference. E say: "If two or three courts give conflicting decision on top di same subject matter, di appellate courts na dem go resolve am. Anytin wey di Supreme Court decide go bicom final and binding," e tok. So, e dey clear say dis court mata about di PDP national convention neva end. Wia dis foto come from, Sam Anyanwu, Nyesom Wike, Ayo Fayose/X For di convention, members of di PDP move motion to expel some of dia members wey dem accuse say dem dey anti-party activities. "Dis decision dey ratified by overwhelming majority of delegates, and e show say di party dey committed to eradicate internal divisions and anti-party conduct wey don dey delay dia progress," di PDP write for dia verified X handle about di members wey dem pursue. Reactingtodidevelopment, Lere Olayinka wey be di tok-tok pesin for oga Nyesom Wike say na decision of pipo wey don drink. "Dem gada for Ibadan to do social party, enjoy diasef and get drunk, dem dey free to tok anytin," Olayinka write for im Facebook handle. Similarly, Fayose also respond for im handle say "di dead no fit expel di living". Meanwhile some serving guvnors of di PDP don wash dia hand comot for di sacking of Wike and im allies from di party. Guvnor of Adamawa State Umaru Fintiri say im hand no dey for di decision at all and e no support am. "I believe say dis decision no be in di best interest of di party, and I no go follow for any attempt wey fit carry di PDP into more katakata wey no dey end," Fintiri write for im X handle on Saturday. E say im advice na "for all di stakeholders to work towards healing di divisions within di party and to strive for unity and cohesion". Also di guvnor of Plateau State Caleb Mutfwang say di PDP dey for "crucial moment" and for di party to start to dey expel pipo "no dey prudent or constructive". "Di move to expel Barr. Nyesom Wike, Ayodele Fayose, Samuel Anyanwu, and odas no dey discussed by di PDP Guvnors Forum or presented to di NEC. E no reflect my position or dat of our leadership," e write for im X handle. However, some oda PDP guvnors like Bala Mohammed of Bauchi and Dauda Lawal of Zamfara, dey in support of guvnor Seyi Makinde of Oyo State, who many say na im be di leader of di oda PDP faction. Bode George, one of di foudning elders of di PDP, also dey support di Makinde-led faction, and according to reports, na im even move di motion to expel Wike, seconded by Bala Mohammed. All eyes go dey on di emergency BoT and NEC meeting wey di Wike-led faction of di PDP don call for Tuesday, 18 November 2025. As e be now, e no dey clear weda Inec monitor di PDP national convention of November 15 and 16, and weda dem don recognise Turaki and Arapaja as di new national chairman and secretary of di party. Anoda tin wey neva dey clear na which BoT or NEC members wey go attend dis Tuesday meeting. Dis na bicos, di acting PDP chairman Umar Damagun and di current BoT chairman Adolphus Wabara both bin support di national convention ova di weekend. Weda dem go still attend di meeting wey di supposedly suspended Sam Anyanwu dey call, na wetin pipo dey wait to see.
articles.title: PDP don scatter? How dismissal of Wike, Fayose fit affect Nigeria main opposition party

articles.input: Kasala burst for PDP secretariat as two faction clash, govnors and party leaders collect teargas
articles.output: Wia dis foto come from, Chukwunaeme Obiejesi/BBC Na serious kasala hapun on Tuesday 18 November 2025 for di secretariat of Nigeria biggest opposition party, di Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) wen two faction set meeting for di same place. For inside Wadata plaza wey be PDP secretariat for Abuja, Nigeria capital, plenti police surround everywhere while dia vehicles station for different angles. Di kasala begin burst as police fire teargas wey disturb pipo eyes well well, for wia di party wan hold dia meetings. All dis hapun sake of di clash between two rival factions of di PDP wey dey claim leadership of di party. Ova di weekend, one faction of di party organise dia national convention for Ibadan Oyo State, southwest Nigeria wia dem agree to expel di Minister of di Federal Capital Territory Nyesom Wike, di national secretary Sam Anyanwu, former Ekiti State guvnor Ayo Fayose, and odas. PDP for dia national convention for Lekan Salami Stadium, Ibadan on Saturday and Sunday bin elect Kabiru Turaki (SAN) as dia National Chairman as dem also elect Taofeek Arapaja National Secretary. Meanwhile, di Samuel Anyanwu leadership still dey claim say im still be di party national secretary until im tenure expire. Anyanwu show for di PDP secretariat wia di two faction bin schedule meeting for di same location. Wia dis foto come from, Chukwunaeme Obiejesi/BBC Early Tuesday morning, party leaders of di PDP bin dey land for di headquarters wey be di same location wia di two faction put a venue for dia meeting. Nyesom Wike wey be FCT minister and also one of di suspended PDP members bin dey for di meeting venue but e no come down from im car. Security personnel bin surround im vehicle while di oda drama bin dey go om. Meanwhile, di faction led by di Govnor of Oyo state, Seyi Makinde bin enta di venue to address di press. Also present at di meeting na Bauchi State Govnor, Bala Mohammed wey also join for di press conference. Bala Mohammed say dem bin wan show say dem don get enough of "Wike gangsterism." Meanwhile, Seyi Makinde on im side say e no go address individuals personally sake of say dia struggle na to save Nigeria democracy and "no allow di kontri become one party state." According to wetin BBC News Pidgin monitor, we see say teargas even touch Seyi Makinde and Bala Mohammed. Wen dem dey comot di venue, we see dem dey use handkerchief to clean dia eyes sake of di effect of di teargas wey reach dem. Wia dis foto come from, Official PDP/X Afta di kasala wey burst for di PDP National Secretariat settle, di Govnor Seyi Makinde faction of di PDP wey Kabiru Turaki dey lead as di national chairman bin call on US President Donald Trump to come save Nigeria democracy. Turaki, wey follow tori pipo tok for di party headquarters tok say apart from di alleged Christian genocide for Nigeria, democracy dey under threat. "I wan call on President Trump, wetin dey at stake no be only genocide against Nigerian Christians, make e come save democracy for Nigeria, democracy dey under threat. I dey call oda developed nations, all advanced democracies, make dem come save Nigeria. I no fit understand how a serving minister of di Federal Republic of Nigeria, go lead armed thugs and wit di active cooperation of di police, create mayhem for di headquarters of our party." E also call Nigeria President Bola Tinubu to call im minister to order as e accuse am, say e "lead thugs" to come scata di secretariat. "Make di president call im minister to order. Di kain behaviour wey di minister engage imsef inside dis morning dey unbecoming. How serving minister go lead thugs to scata legally arranged meeting?" e ask. "Now, we don drive dem out of di secretariat, and as you can see, I don enta my office. I don assume leadership as di elected chairman," e tok. Dis article contain content wey X provide. We ask for una permission before anytin dey loaded, as dem fit dey use cookies and oda technologies. You fit wan read di X cookie policy and privacy policy before accepting. To view dis content choose 'accept and continue'. Wia dis foto come from, Lere Olayinka/X Meanwhile, di National Executive Committee (NEC) of di Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) wey dey loyal to di FCT minister Nyesom Wike don expel di govnors of Oyo, Bauchi and Zamfara States, Seyi Makinde, Bala Mohammed and Dauda Lawal from di party. Di NEC also expel di former Board of Trustees Chairman, Senator Adolphus Wabara, Senator Kabiru Tanimu Turaki, Deputy National Chairman (South), Taofeek Arapaja, plus di recently elected party National Chairman, Kabiru Turaki. Factional acting national chairman of di party, Mohammed Abdulrahman, wey present di memo for di expulsion for one meeting wey hold on Tuesday for di party national secretariat, say na sake of anti-party activities, disregard for court judgements, plus action e say put di party in disrepute. One communiqué from di meeting wey di National Secretary Senator Sam Anyanwu read say, "NEC don receive di report of di Acting National Chairman, Abdulrahman Mohammed, wey detail breaches of Articles 58(1) and 59(1), including anti-party activities, disobedience to court orders, and conduct wey bring di party into disrepute." Dem also dissolve di state executive councils for Oyo, Bauchi, Zamfara, Yobe, Lagos, and Ekiti states and direct di constitution of caretaker committees to conduct fresh congress. articles.input: Authorities deboard Social media influencers VDM and Mr Jollof afta dem 'exchange blow' inside plane
articles.output: Di United Nigeria Airlines don confam one fight wey hapun onboard dia aircraft between social media personality Matins Otse wey pipo sabi as Very Dark Man (VDM) and one comedian Freedom Atsepoyi alias Mr Jollof on Monday, 17 November. Di confirmation dey come afta one video wey go viral show di two social media influencers dey fight for inside di aircraft. Tok-tok pesin for di airline Chibuike Uloka for statement explain say di kasala hapun during di boarding of flight UN0523 for Asaba International Airport on Monday morning. E say to ensure di safety of di oda passengers, dem immediately remove di two fighting from di plane and dem give airport security for investigation. "In full compliance wit global aviation safety protocols, our crew bin respond immediately and professionally to de-escalate di situation. Dem de-board both passengers without delay to ensure di safety, comfort and security of all oda passengers and crew members." Uloka add say di two passengers still dey wit di authorities, as di aircraft fly wit di oda passengers. Wetin cause di kasala between VDM and Mr Jollof neva dey clear but di Nigeria Civil Aviation Authority (NCAA) don tok say dem go torchlight am. Dis article contain content wey X provide. We ask for una permission before anytin dey loaded, as dem fit dey use cookies and oda technologies. You fit wan read di X cookie policy and privacy policy before accepting. To view dis content choose 'accept and continue'. Di video wey don go viral for social media now, show di two social media influencers dey fight inside plane. Pipo fit hear as VDM tok say im go slap pesin come down from di plane. Di video show as e near Mr Jollof, bifor di fight escalate between di two of dem. You fit hear pipo dey shout "VDM, VDM, Pls, make una hold dat guy now," inside di plane. Dis dia fight don generate plenty tok-tok for social media, as e dey come few months afta di Nigerian Civil Aviation Authority, NCAA, ban popular Nigeria fuji star Wasiu Ayinde alias K1 De Ultimate from flying for six months sake of one airline kasala, but dem later lift di ban and turn am to aviation ambassador. Also for August, di Airline Operators of Nigeria bin place one female passenger, Comfort Emmanson, wey get altercation wit airline officials on top one Ibom Air flight, on a 'No Fly' list till further notice, but dem later lift di ban, afta investigations and intervwntions. You fit wan read di X cookie policy and privacy policy before accepting. To view dis content choose 'accept and continue'. As wetin cause di fight between VDM and Mr Jollof neva still dey clear, di Director, Public Affairs & Consumer Protection for NCAA, Michael Achimugu for im initial reaction tok say no mata wetin lead to di fight, no excuse go make am dey acceptable. Oga Achimugu for one post on X tok say, di aviation body go investigate di mata and di two of dem go face di law. "No tolerance dey for dia unruly behaviour aboard an aircraft. Both individuals go face di full strength of di law. E dey even more shameful wen one consider both of dem partners in educating dia millions of followers to avoid unruly behaviour," e tok. E say im go give full details about di position of NCAA soon. articles.input: 'Dem shoot me three times' - Sudan siege survivors tok wetin dia eye see as RSF take over el-Fasher
articles.output: Wetin remain na only di cloth wey e wear, Ezzeldin Hassan Musa Shaken wey im eye don see shege describe di brutality of Sudan Rapid Support Forces (RSF) as di paramilitary group take control of el-Fasher city for di Darfur region. E say dia fighters torture and murder men wey dey try to run. Now for di town of Tawila wia e dey, Ezzeldin na one of di several thousand pipo wey make am to area wey dey safe small afta e escape wetin di UN don describe as "horrific" violence. On Wednesday, 29 October, RSF leader Gen Mohamed Hamdan Dagalo bin admit to "violations" for el-Fasher and e say dem go investigate am. One day later, one UN senior official tok say RSF don give notice say dem don arrest some suspects. About 80km (50-mile) journey from el-Fasher, Tawila na one of di several places wia dos wey dey lucky enough to escape di RSF fighters dey run go. "We comot el-Fasher four days ago. Di suffering we see for road dey unimaginable," Ezzeldin tok. "Dem divide us into groups and beaten. Di scenes dey extremely brutal. We see as dem kill pipo for our front. We see as dem beat-beat pipo, E dey very terrible. "Dem beat me for head, back, and legs. Dem beat me with sticks. Dem wan kill us finally. But wen di opportunity come, we run, but dem catch dos wey dey in front of us." Ezzeldin tok say im join one group of escapees wey bin take shelter inside one building, na night dem dey move and sometimes dem go just crawl for ground make nobody see dem. "Dem tiff our belongings," e tok. "Phones, clothes – everything, even my shoes dem tiff am. Nothing remain. "For three days, we go chop as we dey waka for road. By God's mercy, we escape." Dos wey dey Tawila tell BBC say, RSF dey thoroughly question and investigate di men wey travel come, as di fighters dey target anyone dem suspect to be soja. Ezzeldin na one of around 5,000 pipo wey fit don land Tawila since di fall of el-Fasher on Sunday. Many of dem waka di entire journey wit dia legs, dem travel for three or four days to escape di violence. One freelance journalist for Tawila, wey dey work for BBC, bin follow some of those wey travel di journey tok. Close to Ezzeldin, Ahmed Ismail Ibrahim sidon, bandage full im body. E say one artillery strike injure am for eye, and e comot di city on Sunday afta e receive treatment for hospital. RSF fighters bin stop im and six oda men. "Dem kill four of dem for our front. Dem beat and kill dem," e tok, e add say dem shoot am three times. Ahmed describe how di fighters order to see di phones of di three of dem wey still dey alive and dem go through dem, check dia messages. One fighter, e tok, finally tell dem say: "OK, get up and go." Dem run enta bush. "My brothers," e add, "dem no leave me behind. "We waka for about 10 minutes, den rest for 10 minutes, and we continue until we find peace now." For di next tent, na one clinic wey medical charity Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) dey operate, Yusra Ibrahim Mohamed describe how im make di decision to run comot di city afta dem kill her husband, wey be soja wit di Sudanese army. "My husband bin dey di artillery," she tok. "E bin dey return home bifor dem kill am during di attacks. "We dey patient. Den di clashes and attacks continue. We manage to escape. "We comot three days ago," she tok, "moving in different directions from di artillery areas. Di pipo wey dey guide us no know wetin dey hapun. "If pesin no gree, dem go beat or rob am. Dem go collect evritin you get. Dem go even kill you. I see dead bodies for streets." Alfadil Dukhan dey work for di MSF clinic. E and im colleagues dey provide emergency care to pipo wey land di town - among dem, e say, na 500 pipo wey dey in need of urgent medical treatment. "Most of di new arrivals na elders and women or children," di medic tok. "Pipo wey dey wounded dey suffer, and dem don amputate some already. "Dem dey really suffer too much. And wey dey try to give dem some support and some medical care." Di ones wey come dis week for Tawila bin join hundreds of thousands wey don run earlier from di violence for el-Fasher. Before di RSF seize am on Sunday, di city bin dey under hostage for 18 months. Dem bomb pipo wey dey trapped wit deadly artillery and air strikes as di army plus di paramilitaries battle for el-Fasher. Di RSF blockade of supplies and aid also put dem into serious hunger crisis. Hundreds of thousands bin dey displaced for April wen di RSF seize control of di Zamzam camp wey dey close to di city, at di time, one of di main sites wey dey house pipo wey dey forced to run. Some experts don show concern at di low numbers of pipo wey dey land for places like Tawila now. "Dis really na point of worry for us," Caroline Bouvoir, wey dey work wit refugees for neighbouring Chad for di aid agency Solidarités International tok. "For di past few days we get about 5,000 pipo wey don come, and we believe say about a quarter of a million pipo still dey for di city," she tok. "We see di conditions wey those wey just arrive dey in. Dem dey highly malnourished, highly dehydrated, or sick or injured, and dem clearly dey traumatised wit wetin dem don see either for di city or for road. "We believe say many pipo currently dey hooked for different locations between Tawila and el-Fasher, and dem no fit move forward – weda bicos of dia physical condition or sake of di insecurity for di road, wia militias unfortunately dey attack pipo wey dey try to escape go find safe haven." For Ezzeldin, e no too happy say im escape di city sake of di fears e get for those wey still dey behind. "My message na say make public roads dey safe for citizens," e beg, "or make dem send humanitarian aid go di streets. "Pipo dey for critical condition – dem no fit move, speak, or seek help. "Aid suppose reach dem, bicos many dey miss and more dey suffer." Civil war break out for Sudan for April 2023 afta one violent struggle for power between dia army and one powerful paramilitary group, di Rapid Support Forces (RSF). Di war don lead to famine and claims of genocide for di western Darfur region - fears also dey for di residents of di city of el-Fasher afta RSF recently capture am. More dan 150,000 pipo don die for di conflict across di kontri, and about 12 million pipo don run comot dia homes for inside wetin di United Nations call di largest humanitarian crisis.
articles.title: 'Dem shoot me three times' - Sudan siege survivors tok wetin dia eye see as RSF take over el-Fasher
